description: The Pick Hotels Corporation announced yesterday that it had entered into an agreement in principle to purchase the majority of the Americana Hotel chain from American Airlines. The transaction is expected to be completed by the end of the year. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

title: GARDENING
description: SPACE isn't everything in a garden. It's the design that counts. Sharon and Edward Kreps have a garden on the East Side that is 13 feet wide. It was the skinniest thing I've ever designed, said Halsted S. Welles, the landscape architect who was called in by the Krepses to do something, about their tiny garden. It had been neglected by the former owners and was overgrown with weed trees. The couple were particularly eager to have a play yard for their 2yearold son, Adam.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Sandy Lieberson and Ashley Boone have been named presidents in the film division of the Twentieth CenturyFox Film Cprporation, effective immediately. At the same time, an agreement was signed between the company and three top production officials who previously announced plans to resign  Alan Ladd Jr., Jay Kanter and Gareth Wigan  terminating their contracts as of Oct. 1.

title: Capital's Diverse Oil Lobbyists: Much Criticized, Often Effective
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 It's known on Capitol Hill, sometimes admiringly and sometimes begrudgingly, as the Slick and Smiley Show.

title: U.S. Teaches Britons Way of Life in the Colonies
description: LONDON. Aug. 8 Americans are used to getting what they want fast, and when they don't, they holler until they do, says a guidebook printed for the record one million Britons visiting the United States this year. If you find yourself in a similar situation, don't be shy.

title: Collapse of Kemper Arena's Roof Was Inevitable, Engineer Finds
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 8 (AP)  A California engineer told city officials today that a steady buffeting by winds, metal fatigue in two key steel bolts and a flawed design made the collapse of the Kemper Arena roof inevitable.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: From Leonardo to Titian, a halftour WNBCTV special featuring Italian Renaissance paintings from the Hermitage Museum in Leningrad, will be broadcast on Channel 4 at 10 P.M. Friday.

title: Screen: The Witches, Five Italian Seginents
description: THE Witches, the fivepart Italian comedy now at the Public Theater, is most interesting when looked at as a series of footnotes to comparatively recent film history. The 1967 film, produced by Dino De Latuentiis, is a sort of inhouse celebration of the cool, sculptured, highfashion beauty of Mr. De Laurentiis's wife, Silvana Mangano, who began her career as the passionately earthy peasant in Bitter Rice.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 8 (AP) Troops protesting the execution of a colonel and a sergeant clashed with revolutionary guards in Orumiyeh, in northwestern Iran, according to press reports today. A number of people were wounded, according to the official press agency Pars.

title: Pakistan Perplexed by U.S. Stand on Nuclear Arms
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Aug. 8  Pakistani officials, affirming their Government's continuing admiration and friendship for the United States, are expressing bewilderment at what they regard as Washington's shortsighted punitive policies on the issue of nuclear arms development here.

title: Arson Destroys a Yonkers House After Blacks Move In
description: YONKERS, Aug. 8  Four hours after the members of a black I.B.M. executive's family moved into their splitlevel house in a predominantly white community here, an explosion and fire drove them into the street in an arson incident that officials believe was racially motivated.

title: Dual Effects From the Holocaust Are Found in Survivors Children
description: Until recently, almost everything that was known about the effects of the Holocaust on the second generation came from journalistic accounts of what it was like to grow up as the child of a survivor. In the last few years, however, behavioral experts have begun to make scientific studies of that experience.

title: Corporate Reports
description: For periods as shown.(N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (O) overthecounter.

title: Institute Seeks to Coordinate Oil Lobbying in Washington
description: In the public eye, easily the most prominent of the oil industry's lobbying groups is the American Petroleum Institute, which among other things publishes an array of oilindustry production figures every week.

title: Market Place
description: THE Integon Corporation, a small diversified life insurance company in North Carolina, is sitting in the catbird seat.

title: I.T.T. Agrees to Settle Foreign Payments Suit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation today settled protracted litigation bought by the Securities and Exchange Commission that had accused the company of making millions of dollars in illegal, improper, corrupt and questionable payments abroad.

title: Frederick M. Karger, 63, Arranger and Composer
description: Frederick M. Karger, a vocal arranger, composer and orchestra leader, died of leukemia Sunday at St. John's Hospital. Santa Monica, Calif. He was 63 years old and lived in Santa Monica.

title: About Suffolk
description: SMITHTOWN, L.I., Aug. 6  Call it gentry's revenge or suburban midlife crisis. However the odd approaching event is rationalized, Suffolk's normally monolithic Republicans are in such disarray that they are forced to hold a primary election next month an aberration of democracy that, as a welcome import from city life, ranks somewhere close to sidewalks, busing and lowincome housing.

title: BEN MERSON
description: Ben Merson, a journalist for half a century, died of a heart attack Monday at his home in Long Eddy, N.Y., a community on the Delaware River in northwestern Sullivan County. He was 69 years old.

title: COMMODITIES Gold and Silver Futures Advance by Daily Limits
description: Gold and silver futuret shot forward to limit highs yesterday on the expectation that the national index of producer prices for July would reflect a worsening of the rate of inflation. The figures were scheduled to be released this morning in Washington.

title: Israel Said to Pull Out U.S. Guns in Lebanon
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Administration sources said today the Israeli Government had apparently responded to American pressure and pulled its Americanmade artillery out of southern Lebanon.

title: Massachusetts Rejects Request To Reset Its Democratic Primary
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  The Massachusetts Senate voted today against moving back the date of the gate's Demo. cratic primary, a change requested by the Democratic National Committee and one that presumably could aid President Carter's renomination efforts.

title: 5 Die in North Carolina Crash
description: LUMBERTON, N. C., Aug. 8 (AP)  A car racing to a hospital with a woman in labor crashed into a parked truck last night, killing the woman and four other persons and injuring three, the police said. The dead were identified as Carrie Mae Oxendine, 25 years old, the expectant mother; her sister, Diane Locklear, 23; her mother, Marrinda Jane Locklear, 47; Ricky Oxendine, 8, and Steven Ray Oxendine, 2.

title: Deaths
description: POTOFSKYJacob S., The Reunion of Old Timers deeply mourn the Passing of a distinguished Labor Leader and Social Democrat. We extend our profound sympathy to his entire family.

title: U.S. SEEKS WORLD AID TO FEED CAMBODIANS
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 8 The United States is consulting with other governments on the launching of an international humanitarian operation to save Cambodians from starvation, members of the American delegation said today

title: 4,600 More Laid Off At Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Aug. 8  The financially troubled Chrysler Corporation, its newcar and truck sales continuing to falter, disclosed today that it had laid off an additional 4,600 production workers indefinitely, along with several dozen whitecollar workers.

title: The City
description: Passengers were safely removed yesterday from a Flushing No. 7 subway train that was derailed under the East River between Queens and Manhattan, the Transit Authority said.

title: Armao Leaving Unpaid City Job In Protocol Unit
description: Robert F. Armao, who personally represents Mohammed Riza Pahlevi, the deposed Shah of Iran, and whose publicrelations firm, Armao & Company, represents the New York State Coalition for Casino Gambling, has resigned his unpaid city post as vice chairman of the Mayor's Commission for Distinguished Guests.

title: Ruth Dodd McHugh Is Wed To Arthur T. Kraft in Queens
description: Ruth Dodd McHugh, widow of Francis Dodd McHugh, was married yesterday to Arthur Taylor Kraft of Light House Point, Fla. The ceremony was performed in the Zion Episcopal Church in Douglaston, Queens, by the Rev. Littledale Burrell.

title: Richard C. Plumer, 55, an Official At University of New Hampshire
description: Richard C. Plumer, public affairs officer of the University of New Hampshire in Durham, died yesterday of cancer at Wentworth Douglass Hospital in Dover, N.H. He was 55 years old and lived in Dover.

title: Advertising
description: WITH an admitted sense of shock, the Interpublic Group of Companies said yesterday that it had been informed by the Miller Brewing Company that Miller would terminate its account, effective Nov. 30, with McCannErickson, the largest unit of Interpublic. Miller's more than $72 million in billings are being moved to Backer & Spielvogel, a new advertising agency formed by several former top executives of Interpublic and McCannErickson.

title: 70,042 See Cosmos Triumph, 43
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 8  Everyone was a winner at Giants Stadium tonight.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 8, 1979

title: Yankees Rally Tops White Sox
description: The way the Yankees slumbered for seven innings then burst to life in the eighth last night served as a microcosm of Chris Chambliss's season. Chambliss slumbered for the first half of this season but has burst to life in the last four weeks.

title: Exodus of Skilled Ethnic Chinese Worsens Hanoi's Plight
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  A crew of skilled Soviet longshoremen are now hard at work in Vietnam's busy harbor at Haiphong, unraveling a huge tieup caused by a lack of skilled workers.

title: Lively Selections at the Modern
description: THE iridescent liqueur glasses (circa 1913) by Josef Hoffmann are empty; the multijointed architect's lamp (1927) by Edouard Wilfred Buquet is not turned on; the slim Bang & Olufsen microphone (1969) by Jakob Jensen is quiet; the quilted, slipcovered Ribbon chair (1975) by Niels S. Bendtsen is pristinely unoccupied.

title: Mets Bow to Cards, 84
description: The Mets squandered an early lead yesterday and bowed to the Cardinals at Shea Stadium, 84. Page B7.

title: Red Sox Swept by Indians
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Dan Spillner, normally a relief pitcher, hurled a sixhitter in his first complete game in four seasons tonight as the Cleveland Indians defeated the Boston Red Sox, 82, for a sweep of a twilightnight doubleheader.

title: LANDRIEU IS FACING QUERY ON LAND SWAP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Former Mayor Moon Landrieu of New Orleans, who is President Carter's choice to head the Department of Housing and Urban Development. was granted a lucrative partnership interest by a real estate developer last year after his term of office expired.

title: Stage: Raul Julia Portrays Othello
description: WERE it not for Iago, there would be no Othello. It is this archvillain, the incarnation of absolute evil, who contrives the plot, sets th play in motion and uses others as instruments of his own malice. Once the machinery of lago's vengeance is activated, the play proceeds like a massive puzzle, with every part locking in place, until Othello is imprisoned by his own jealousy. For lago's scheme to be convincing, the play must have an Othello with dimension, one who is great enough for a majestic fall.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: THE Lilliputian world of doll houses includes a surprising number of tiny versions of standard hardware. Miniature making and collecting have become big business in the United States in the last 10 years, and this is reflected in the. number of readymade hardware items on the market. Door hardware, moldings, lighting fixtures, furniture hardware, flooring, shingles, shutters, curtain rods  all exist in minuscule versions of real life.

title: David J. McDonald, Retired Head Of Steelworkers Union, Dies at 76
description: David J. McDonald, the former president of the United Steelworkers of America, died yesterday in Palm Springs, Calif. He was 76 years old.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Dictaphone Corporation, a maker of business machines and forms, has ap. ,nointed Rudolph Grua president of its Dictaphone Product and Systems Group.

title: Around the Nation
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (AP)  The United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit, in Chicago, yesterday stayed a Federal judge's order to put into effect a desegregation plan for this city's schools this fall, an attorney in the case said today.

title: Philharmonic in the Park
description: MOVE the New York Philharmonic out to its portable concert shell in the Central Park Sheep Meadow on a hot August night, engage Andre Kostelanetz to lead the orchestra in RimskyKorsakov's Scheherazade. the Second Suite from Stravinsky's The Firebird and four Sousa marches, promise fireworks with the concluding Stars and Stripes Forever, and what do you get? A monster rally of such proportions that even the police are surprised. It all happened last night as the Philharmonic began its annual series of free concerts in the parks. The police estimated that more than 200,000 people were there, the most ever for any kind of musical event.

title: Lawyer, 38, Is Taking the Reins In Ecuador as Army Withdraws
description: QUITO, Ecuador, Aug. 8  Ecuador, ruled for the last nine years by civilian and military dictatorships, returns to democracy Friday with the inauguration of a man who promises to have a larger and more commanding voice in the hemisphere than either the size of his tiny nation or his own youth and limited experience in public life would suggest.WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Rosalynn Carter flew to Quito, Ecuador, today to attend the inauguration of Presidentelect Rolds.

title: Notes on People
description: In Moscow yesterday, Ida Milgrom, the mother of Anotoly B. Shcharansky, the imprisoned Jewishrights activist, told Western newsmen about how she had been allowed to visit her son in prison for the first time in a year. She said he was seriously ill, with eye trouble and weight loss, and was not being given adequate medical care. Mrs. Milgrom said she and her son Leonid were allowed to see Mr. Shcharansky for two hours Monday at the Chistopol prison, 500 miles east of Moscow in the Tartar Republic.

title: Deaths
description: Alan, Elsie Baer. Max Bardusch, William Becker, Wade Bernstein, R. Bird, Marion Bodner. Esther Boyers. Ann Braun, Harry Cara ley. James Chasin, Celia Cohen, Mary Cromwell, Curtis deFreitas, Alice Fabrikant. B. Falk. Arthur Feeney, Frances Finck, Sidney Fleischmann, C. Garrell, Jack Grossbardt, A. Haugh, John Hawkins, Dorcas Sarah

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Aug. 8, 1979

title: Plea in Rattlesnake Assault
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8, (UPI)  Two Synanon members pleaded not guilty today to charges of conspiracy to commit murder and assault in a rattlesnake attack on a lawyer who had won a lawsuit against the organization. The suspects. Lance Kenton, 21 years old, son of bandleader Stan Kenton, and Joseph Musico, 29, are expected to go on trial in November. Still at issue is whether Charles Dederich, 66, founder of the drug rehabilitation organization, should be tried separately in the case.

title: Moody's Cuts Itel's Ratings
description: Moody's Investors Service said yesterday that it had lowered the ratings on the Itel Corporation's 10 percent sinking fund debentures due 1998 to B from Ba and the $1.44 cumulative preferred stock to Caa from B.

title: Dealers and Motorists Growing Lax On OddEven GasolineSale System
description: With the long lines at gas stations now just a memory and with supplies becoming more plentiful, dealers and motorists in the metropolitan area Appear to be growing less diligent in observing oddeven restrictions on gasoline sales than they were at the height of the gaS crisis earlier this summer.

title: Forecast of Soviet Wheat Crop.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters)The Soviet Union will harvest a betterthanaverage spring wheat crop that could be the best for the last five years, the Agriculture Department announced today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TOMORROW, August 10 GUGLIELMO MARCONI (Itlalan Line Cruises International). Left St. Maarten August 6; due at 8 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: Letters
description: To The Home Section:

title: No SpeedUp of Study
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (Reuters) A Treasury Department spokesman said today that the Administration would not accelerate its study of the beleaguered Chrysler Corporation's financial situation.

title: Paraguay Annuls the Citizenship Of Mengele, Nazi War Criminal
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug, 9 (UPI)  The Supreme Court today annulled the Paraguayan citizenship of Dr. Josef Mengele, a convicted Nazi war criminal.

title: Ballet: Godunov in Bolshoi 'spartacus
description: ALEKSANDR GODUNOV, his firm jaw thrust out more than usual, made his local debut Tuesday night in the title role of the Bolshoi Ballet's Spartacus and carried the audience at the State Theater effortlessly along with him. At the curtain calls, this New York favorite received from his fans the biggest bouquet seen here in years.

title: Trucker Admits Dumping Poison In Lot in Bronx
description: A trucker admitted to the police yesterday that he had illegally dumped a load of poisonous chemicals in a South Bronx lot eight days ago and pocketed the $35 dumping fee meant for a local rubbish compacting and removal firm.

title: Nuclear Plant Building Is Malted In Indiana After Safety Challenge
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Construction on the Marble Hill nuclear power plant, shut down because of prob. lems with shoddy concrete and plumbing work, will be halted for several weeks, officials have said.

title: CurrencyFutures Trading
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  The New York Futures Exchange Inc. has requested permission to trade futures contracts in foreign currencies and United States Treasury bills and bonds, the Commodity Futures Trading Commission announced today. The futures exchange applied for permission to trade British pounds, Canadian dollars, German marks, Japanese yen, Swiss francs, 90day United States Treasury bills and 20year United States Treasury bonds.

title: Remnants of Watergate
description: Richard M. Nixon's resignation from the Presidency, five years ago today, just one step ahead of impeachment for abuse of power and gross violation of individual rights, was seen as a vindication of the rule of law. Unfortunately, however, Mr. Nixon's exile to San Clemente and the subsequent revelations of widespread Government spying have been taken more as a national exorcism than a lesson for the future.

title: Brooklyn Man Indicted in Rapes
description: Joseph DeSantis, a 39yearold father of two who lives at 1358 57th Street in Brooklyn, was indicted yesterday on five counts of rape, assault and robbery for series of attacks on females between the ages of 13 and 29 in the Bay Ridge section.

title: The Answer to Sunday Afternoons
description: MOST people marry for unconscious reasons, said a friend of mine who is a psychotherapist, and that's one of the difficulties. Not knowing why they did it in the first place, they're always wondering whether they should stay married.

title: Xerox Announces Facsimile Unit
description: The Xerox Corporation announced yesterday a new facsimile unit that can send and receive via ordinary telephone lines a typical onepage business letter in about one minute.

title: Music: Chamber Players From Boston
description: THE Boston Symphony Chamber Players themselves probably do not know just when or how it happened, but sometime during their 15 years of existence as an ensemble these firstchair musicians of the Boston Symphony have learned to play Mozart beautifully. Not daringly, not grandly, not solemnly, not spectacularly, just beautifully. This ability was much in evidence at Avery Fisher Hall on Tuesday night when the group made an appearance in the Mostly Mozart Festival.

title: Lehman Bros. Plans Acquisition
description: Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb Inc., major investmentbanking firm, has announced an agreement in principle to acquire the SonnenblickGoldman Corporation, one of the country's largest mortgagebrokerage companies.

title: Talks on the Palestinians: Into a Minefield
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 8  We had breakthrough, and now we are standing at a minefield. That is how the peace process with Egypt was characterized recently by the Minister of the Interior, Dr. Yosef Burg, who is head of the Israeli delegation to the negotiations with Egypt and the United States on establishing selfgovernment for the million Arabs who have lived under Israeli military occupation since the war of 1967.

title: A Time to Save Lives
description: Cambodia lacks the food to keep its people alive. Years of war and disastrous government have pushed the farmers from their land. According to Red Cross and United Nations officials, well over 2 million people are starving; most of the other 7 million Cambodians are dangerously undernourished. Vietnam has provided some food to the government it has installed in Phnom Penh, much of it from the Soviet Union. But that is not enough and it is politically managed. Even those who are eating the Government's rice get only 4.5 ounces a day, less than a third of what they need. Children, especially, are dying in large numbers; visitors have seen too many of them with the swollen bellies hunger.

title: Funeral in Philadelphia For Commander Collins
description: Funeral services were held in Philadelphia yesterday for Lieut. Comdr. Henry Collins, a retired Navy pilot who made the first successful airship flight above the Arctic Circle.

title: Trying to Be Fair About Poison
description: When people in Niagara Falls, N. Y. had to be evacuated because toxic wastes were seeping out of the Hooker Chemical Company's old dumping ground Love Canal, a reader striving to be fair might have argued that, well, it all started years ago when people didn't know better and when such careless disposal was widespread.

title: One Family's Year With a Windmill
description: THE most original wedding gift I received was a windmill, a present from my husband Frank, which we installed to generate electricity for our home. Occasionally, it does.

title: SEOUL WILL INCREASE MILITARY SPENDING
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Aug. 8  President Carter, visiting here at the end of June, persuaded President Park Chung Hee of South Korea to raise annual military spending next year by about $500 million from currently budgeted levels, South Korean officials revealed today.

title: Peak Australia Wheat Sales to Soviet
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 8  The Soviet Union has bought a record 3.2 million metric tons of Australian wheat this year worth about $475 million, providing further indications of a poor Soviet harvest.

title: Home Beat
description: HIS mother claims that the first game that really interested him, when he was about 5 years old, was Scrabble. Fifteen years later, Stuart Call, above, is still experimenting with word games. Last fall he made a 45footsquare Scrabble board; this summer he is making other oversize games. I found that people are fascinated with large boards, said Mr. Call, who lives in Greenwich, Conn., and will be a sophomore next month at Bowdoin College in Brunswick, Me. Mr. Calle found that backgammon and checkers were two very popular games and proceeded to make some giant versions of the boards and playing pieces. He will make backgammon boards as large as you want, although the smallest he finds acceptable is 6by4 feet. The boards are made of lightweight plasterboard and are painted with waterbase colors. I like bright colors with a semigloss finish, Mr. Call said. Once the paint is dry, he puts on several layers of polyurethane so that the boards are shiny, durable and can be used indoors or out. The backgammon stones are made of threeinchthick foam rubber and each of the two jumbo dice measures a cubic foot. A 6by4 backgammon set is $95, and it takes Mr. Call about a week to complete a custom order. The address of Mr. Call is the Pop Art Stable, 132 Round Hill Road, Greenwich, Conn. 06830. His telephone number is (203) 6614889.

title: Oil Shortfall Seen Widening
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  World oil. supplies could fall short of demand by as much as four million barrels a day by 1985 if present trends continue, a top official of the International Energy Agency said today.

title: Harlem, Tourist Center in 20's and 30's, Seeks Rebirth
description: A program to reestablish Harlem as the attraction that it was in the 1920's and 1930's, when tourists from all over the world visited its cultural institutions and entertainment spots, was announced yesterday by the Uptown Chamber of Commerce of Manhattan.

title: Pressing for Peace in Ulster
description: New York is not Camp David and Governor Carey may have erred proposing that senior British and Irish officials meet here to discuss the intractable problems of Northern Ireland. Moreover, the Governor won no marks as a diplomat by announcing his invitation before anyone accepted it. But Mr. Carey was at least trying to nudge forward a peacemaking process that has been stalled for five years. He also was able to put American concern over Ulster on the front pages of the London press. It may be irksome to the British that an IrishAmerican politician should seem to be meddling in what Bernard Shaw called John Bull's Other Island. But the outcry misses the crucial point about Governor Carey's unorthodox initiative.

title: Q & A
description: Q. I recently pulled some growing ivy off the side of my house, which is covered with aluminum siding. The problem is that now there are marks left where the ivy originally attached itself to the siding. Now can I remove these marks?  A.B., Great Neck, L.I.

title: Deaths
description: ALANElsie M. In memory of my beloved mother who graced all whom she knew. Gifts in memory to Concern For Dying, 250 West 57th St, NYC.

title: Killing Sharpens Texas Feud on Vietnamese Fishing
description: SEADRIFT, Tex., Aug. 8  An ugly, longsimmering feud between Texas fishermen and Vietnamese refugees in this small town has finally exploded with killing, several firebombings and an attempted bombing in the last five days.

title: Connors Defeats Taroczy
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 8 (AP)Both topseeded players, Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert Lloyd, turned in victories in the United States Open claycourt tennis tournament today, although Mrs. Lloyd was carried to three sets for just the second time in 22 matches here since 1972.

title: Houseboat Owner Delights in Life Afloat
description: FOR Gary Dunne, a boat lover, the living is ideal. He never has to leave the water. He has lived on a houseboat for the past three years and cannot conceive of ever becoming a landlubber again. Docks don't destroy the property, he said. and with his partner, Neal Tannenbaum, who still lives on land, he has just bought 13 acres in Heliport, L.I., with 1,700 feet on the water, where he hopes to establish a houseboat community.

title: PAYMENTS TO POOR FOR HEATING COSTS PROPOSED BY CARTER
description: WASHINGTON. Aug. 8  The Carter Administration plans to propose $1.6 billion in special assistance for the poor to offset higher energy costs this winter and $2.4 billion for the winter of 198081.

title: 2 Want Jets New Job: Man in Middle
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 8  Middle linebacker is a glamour position for winners. And for losers? Well, there are no glamorous positions for losers.

title: Consumer Prices Abroad
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (Reuters)  Consumer prices in major nonCommunist industrial countries rose ninetenths of 1 percent In June, compared with 1 percent in May, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said today.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York Stock Exchange issued yesterday its latest report of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchange.

title: PMI Sells Mortgage Issue
description: The PMI Mortgage Coloration said in San Francisco yesterday that it had issued a $26.98 million series of Penni Mae securities, the nation's first public issue of conventional mortgage passthrough certificates by a conduit company.

title: Suffolk Site Would Combine Racing on TV, Betting
description: New York State's first site combining closedcircuit television of live thoroughbred racing with parimutuel betting will be in Suffolk County if the State Legislature approvps, the New York Racing Association confirmed yesterday.

title: Bridge:
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., Aug. 8  A tough Aces foursome, playing like the world champions they all are, won the Spingold knockout team championship here in the early hours of this morning, concluding the American Contract Bridge League's Summer Nationals, the biggest bridge tournament in history.

title: Nicholas Monsarrat, Novelist, Dies; Wrote War Epic The Cruel Sea
description: Nicholas Monsarrat, the British amateur sailor turned author who wrote the bestselling novel The Cruel Sea and two dozen other books, died of cancer Tuesday in a London hospital. He was 69 years old and lived on the Mediterranean island of Gozo, off Malta.

title: Ballet: Ohioans Open at Jacob's Pillow
description: BECKET, Mass., Aug. 8  The Ohio Ballet opened to a capacity audience at the Jacob's Pillow Summer Dance Festival yesterday, a sign of its standing as one of the most interesting of American regional companies. A mere five years old, the Akronbased troupe of 23 dancers shows the firm guiding hand of its director and chief choreographer, Heinz Poll, as does the repertory  of which 10 ballets are to be shown here through Saturday.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE OXFORD BOOK OF AMERICAN LIGHT VERSE. Chosen and edited by William Harmon. 540 pages. Oxford. $15.95.

title: Disks: Legendary Hoagy Carmichael
description: UNLIKE other releases in RCA's Legendary Performers series of reissues, this Enagy C.arniichael collection is not a skimming off the top of the most familiar records by the performer in question. In fact, as a performer, Carmichael does not really fit into the series. Which is why the word composer has been added to the title.

title: Grand Jury Investigation of Rep. Jenrette Widened
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  A Federal grand jury in South Carolina is investigating allegations against Representative John W. Jenrette Jr., including one that there is a possible connection between him and drug smuggling in the state.

title: 36 Million Watched YankeeOriole Game
description: The YankeeOriole baseball game broadcast on ABCTV last Monday night attracted 36 million viewers, network officials reported, and was the evening's highest rated television program.

title: Margery Maude, 90; Actress and Daughter Of Actor Cyril Maude
description: Margery Maude, a stage actress and the daughter of the famous British actor Cyril Maude, died Tuesday at the Wade Park Manor in Cleveland. She was 90 years old and had been a Cleveland resident for more than a year, after many years of living in New York.

title: Roland Gagnon, 42; Conductor and Coach Who Aided Miss Sills
description: A requiem mass is to be offered at the Church of St. Paul the Apostle tomorrow at 10 A.M. for Roland Gagnon, a conductor and coach of opera and musical comedy, who was found dead Monday in his apartment on West End Avenue. The death, attributed to natural causes, is believed to have occurred toward the end of last week. He was 42 years old.

title: Carter Plans Food Talks
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  President Carter has summoned 15 food retailers and officials of food trade groups to the White House on Monday afternoon to explain to him why the nation's consumers have failed to benefit from reduced farm prices, Administration officials said today

title: Burger Suggests Some Judges Err In Closing Trials
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Chief Justice Warren E. Burger was quoted today as saying that judges who were barring the press and public from trials might be misreading the Supreme Court's recent decision allowing closed pretrial proceedings.

title: Gubernatorial Runoff Between 2 Democrats Needed in Mississippi
description: JACKSON, Miss., Aug. 8 (UPI)Lieut. Gov. Evelyn Gandy, a veteran of more than three decades in state government, outpolled five male opponents yesterday in her bid to become Mississippi's first woman Governor, but faces an Aug. 28 runoff against a longtime state political leader, William Winter, who is also a former Lieutenant Governor.

title: Spending Rise In Japan Seen
description: TOKYO, Aug, 8 (AP)  Capital spending by major Japanese corporations is expected to increase 19.2 percent in the JulySeptember quarter from the yearearlier period, a Government survey said today.

title: Ailing Tekefunken: German Anomaly
description: BONN, Aug 8  A.E.G.Telefunken, the thirdlargest electrical products company in continental Europe, is an anomaly amid the prosperous ranks of West German industry.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: The Carter Administration plans to propose$1.6 billion in aid for the poor to offset higheFenergy costs this winter plus $2A billion for 1981, according to Governinent officials. The aid, which must be approved by Congress, follows pledges by President Carter to use part of the revenues from the proposed windfall profits tax on oil counter the impact of rising energy prices. [Page Al.]

title: Deaths
description: BODNEREsther. The Officers and Members of the Aviva Chapter of the American Mizrachi Women records with profound grief the passing of our beloved and esteemed Past president, Esther Bodner, and extends its deepest condolences to the family.

title: Regan Criticizes State for Record Of Hospital Plan
description: State Comptroller Edward V. Regan yesterday issued a report criticizing the state's Health Department for not acting aggressively enough in closing excess hospital beds.

title: A.F.L.C.I.O. Sees Danger in Exporting Critical Technology to Soviet
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 8  Strong concern over what it called the transfer of critical technology to the Soviet Union in the form of computers, precision ball bearings, seismic equipment, oildrill bits and other products was expressed today by the executive council of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations.

title: Oriana Rodman, Author, Bride of Hugh MacRae
description: The Immaculate Conception Roman Catholic Church in Mahwah, N.J., was the setting yesterday evening for the marriage of Oriana Rodman, daughter of Selden Rodman of Oakland, N.J., and Maia Wojciechowska of Santa Fe, N.M., to Hugh. MacRae, son of Max MacRae of Jacmel, Haiti, and Shirley MacRae of Elora, Ontario. The Rev.

title: Specialist Asserts DC10 Builder Did Not Back Maintenance Shift
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 8  An American Airlines specialist conceded today that the builder of the DC10 jumbo jet, the McDonnell Douglas Corporation, had not approved a maintenance procedure that turned out to be a major factor in the DC10 crash here two months ago.

title: Cabaret: Julie Wilson
description: JULIE WILSON, who retired to Omaha three years ago to raise her two sons, has apparently thought better of a steady stay in Nebraska. The blackhaired singer is back in New York in a state that is described as semiretirement, appearing at a new, club, Savannah, a large, planthung room on the street floor of the Edison Hotel on 47th Street between Broadway and Eighth Avenue.

title: Ivaco Offered 97% Of Atlantic Steel
description: Shareholders of the Atlantic Steel Company have tendered about 1,257,000 common shares, or about 97 percent, under an offer by Ivaco Ltd. of Montreal to purchase all Atlantic Steel common at $40 a.share. Ivaco said it had purchased all shares validly tendered.

title: Scars of the Nightmare
description: WASHINGTON  Five years ago today, Richard M. Nixon resigned from the Presidency. A newly in: stalled President Ford said, Our long national nightmare is over.

title: NICARAGUA TO DROP MOST CURBS ON NEWS
description: LEON, Nicaragua, Aug. 8  Nicaragua's new Government plans to announce tomorrow that it is ending most restraints on the country's news organizations, a Government official said today. The action would clear the way for the return of the nation's independent newspapers and radio and television stations as early as next week.

title: How a Tax Was Killed
description: Although not a cardcarrying member of the oil lobby, Charls E. Walker, the Deputy Secretary of the Treasury in the Nixon Administration and one of Washington's most influential business strategists, is given credit for almost singlehandedly killing an important segment of President Carter's comprehensive energy bill last year.

title: Suspect Seized In Record Theft At a City Bank
description: A 28yearold man who is believed to have been one of four welldressed gunmen who robbed a Manhattan bank of more than $500,000 last Friday  a record theft  was arrested yesterday after he was involved in a traffic accident in the Bronx.

title: Topics
description: A reader asks a sensible question: I needed some help from a Government office the other day  the tax office, to be exact  and I was delighted to find one near my own place of work. The Government is worried about productivity, I thought, so it wants to give service without disrupting the citizen's work day.

title: Gov. Evans Asserts U.S. Mistakes Aided Spread of Idaho Forest Blaze
description: Gov. John V. Evans of Idaho blamed the United States Forest Service yesterday for the spread of a huge forest fire in the state, saying that the agency had misread weather conditions.

title: Asarco Lifts Copper 2?? Others Also Raise Price
description: Asarco Inc., a major copper producer, raised its spot price of cathode copper by 2 cents, to 90 cents a pound, yesterday. Other producers, such as the Noranda Sales Corporation and the Inspiration Consolidated Copper Company, raised prices by 2 cents, to 88 cents a pound.

title: Rejection of Jane Fonda Deplored
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8 (UPI) Prominent members of the Hollywood entertainment industry today denounced the State Senate's rejection of Jane Fonda's appointment for a seat on the State Arts Council.

title: Music: 4 by AvantGarde
description: LENOX, Mass., Aug. 8  Devising programs for a modernmusic festival in 1979 cannot be easy. The avantgarde composing certitudes of the last 50 years have been replaced by a general confusion of aims and priorities. Some of the great rallying ideas, such as Serialism, nave lost most of their force. Few musicians would say now with assurance that they know where their art is tending, or should be tending. Music is becalmed. That being so, an event such as the Festival of Contemporary Music, which is being held here at Tanglewood this week, probably ought to reflect the current feeling of stasis or, at best, drift.

title: Congressman Asserts He Passes Information For U.S. and P.L.O.
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Representative Paul Findley said today that he passes information between the Carter Administration and the Palestine Liberation Organization, but he added, I'm not an emissary in any sense.

title: 10 Days and Nights of Polka Upstate
description: The polka, that early-19th-century peasant dance, which hoppped and skipped its way through the fashionable ballrooms of Prague, Vienna and Paris within a decade of its creation. will enliven Hunter Mountain, N.Y., for the next 10 days. The northern Catskills ski town will be the center of the National Polka Festival, opening tonight.

title: Potofsky Is Described in Eulogy As Gentle, Fearless Labor Chief
description: Governor Carey, Senator Daniel Patrick Moynihan and an aide to President Carter joined union leaders and clergymen yesterday to eulogize Jacob S. Potofsky, the former president of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers, who died Sunday in his Manhattan home at the age of 84.

title: PRODUCER PRICES UP BY 1.1% LAST MONTH
description: WASHINGTON,Aug. 9 - The nation received a new inflation jolt as the Government's index of producer prices for finished goods, which anticipates what consumers will pay in a few months, shot up 1.1 percent in July, the Labor Department reported today.

title: As Expected, Gross Is Named Chief Medical Examiner
description: Mayor Koch, as expected, yesterday named Connecticut's Chief Medical Ex- aminer, Dr. Elliot M. Gross, to replace Dr. Michael M. Baden as the city's Chief Medical Examiner.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT

title: Connors, Trailing by 52 in Final Set, Gains
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 9 (AP) Jimmy Connors, the defending cham- pion, was down by 52 in the third set and 2 points from defeat, but he rallied and survived today against Balazs Taroczv of Hunearv. Two service breaks by Connors were vital as he held on for a 57, 61, 97 victory in the third round of the $275,000 United States open clay court tennis tournament.

title: Former U.S. Aides Face InterestConflict Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP)  A Federal grand jury today indicted the former director and a former assistant director of the nation's money and stamp printing agency on charges of conflict of interest and lying to a grand jury.

title: And Not Far Off
description: The annual Folk Festival of the Catskills takes place tomorrow and Sunday at the Bobcat Ski Center in Andes, N.Y., featuring the music, crafts, working skills and traditional cooking of the area. A special program for children will offer storytelling and an introduction to the life of an earlier era by a visit to grandmother's attic.

title: Outcry on Vandam Street
description: Outcry, a twocharacter play about actors by Tennessee Williams, will be presented this weekend at Shelter West, 15 Vandam Street. The play, directed by Richard Egan, features Louise Salisbury and William Jones. It was produced on Broadway in 1973. Performances are at 8 P.M. today and tomorrow, 3 P.M. on Sunday. Tickets are $3.50 ($2.50 for students and the elderly); Theater Development Fund vouchers accepted. Information: 6750498.

title: My Speech To the Graduates
description: More than any other time in history, mankind faces a crossroads. One path leads to despair and utter hopeless- ness. The other, to total extinction. Let us pray we have the wisdom to choose correctly. I speak, by the way, not with any sense . of futility, but with a pan- icky conviction of the absolute mean- inglessness of existence which could easily be misinterpreted as pessi- mism. It is not. It is merely a healthy concern for the predicament of mod- ern man. (Modern man is here defined as any person born after Nietzche's edict that God is dead, but before the hit recording I Wanna Hold Your Hand.) This predicament can be stated one of two ways, though Certain linguistic philosophers prefer to re- duce it to a mathmatical equation where it can be easily solved and even carried around in the wallet.

title: U.S. Denies Report It Gave Foreign Agents Free Rein
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  Carter Administration officials today denied allegations in a Senate report that foreign governments were given a free hand to spy on, and in some cases harass, their citizens living in the United States.

title: Navy Ship Saves 20 Boat People
description: MANILA, Aug. 9 - A Vietnamese refugee boat, floundering in I2foot waves 350 miles east of Ho Chi Minh City, was rescued early this morning by the U.S.S. Beaufort; a salvage ship of the Seventh Fleet.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: 21 N.H.L. Clubs Draft 126 Players
description: The 21 clubs of the National Hockey League, including the four new ones from the defunct World Hockey Associ- ation, conducted their entry draft of amateur players yesterday by way of a telephone hookup and spent nearly seven hours choosing 126 players.

title: Sylvia Syms, Singer From Swing St.
description: In the summer of her 15th year, Sylvia Syms was discovering jazz on the block of 52d Street west of Fifth Avenue that was so packed with little jazz clubs that it was known as Swing Street.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Broadcasting Companies named Robert Bookman vice president in charge of worldwide production, motion picture division.

title: Events and Openings
description: SUNBURN, directed by Richard C. Swam, Gemini I, Embassy 46th Street and other theaters.

title: At the Auction for Refugees From Southeast Asia
description: Who wants a widow with three chil dren?

title: COMMODITIES
description: By The Associated Press

title: Miss Ahern Posts 71 For OneShot Lead
description: JERICHO, L.I., Aug. 9 - The Meadow Brook Club golf course may be the most difficult test on this year's Ladies Professional Golf Association tour, and just to complicate the situa- tion the wind came up strongly and

title: Construction Worker Rescued After Washing Over Ohio Dam
description: John Wirebaugh, a construction worker, was using a small boat as he worked on a wall along the Great Miami River yesterday near downtown Dayton, Ohio. The outboard motor powering the boat stalled and the. anchor failed to keep him from being washed over a nearby dam. He was able to cling to the overturned boar until Dayton firemen could throw him a life preserver and pull him to saftey.

title: 2 in Private Plane Killed In a Crash at La Guardia
description: A small private air taxi attempting takeoff crashed and burned off the end of a runway just short of a busy highway at La Guardia Airport yesterday afternoon. The pilot and a woman passenger were killed and her husband was critically burned.

title: Prostitutes Get Police Warning In Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 9 - This resort city, plagued by steadily increasing pros- titution since the casino era began here 14 months ago, has embarked on a novel program to combat it. Street crime has increased along with the rise in prostitu- tion.

title: Plea in Rattlesnake Assault
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Two Synanon members pleaded not guilty Wednesday to charges of conspiracy to commit murder and assault in a rattlesnake attack on a lawyer who had won lawsuit against the organization. The suspects, Lance Kenton, 21 years old; son of bandleader Stan Kenton, and Joseph Musico, 29, are expected to go on trial in November. Still at issue is whether Charles Dederich, 66, founder of the drug rehabilitation organization, should be tried separately in the case.

title: Envirodyne's Loan Is Backed
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9  Envirodyne Industries Inc. has received Government approval for a 90 percent guarantee on a requested $90 million in loans for rehabilitation work and new pollution control equipment at the company's ailing Wisconsin Steel division.

title: Radio
description: 9:0610, WQXR: Piano Personalities. Impromptus on a Theme by Clara Wieck, Schumann; Pour le Piano, Debussy;

title: Theater: Cicely Tyson Stars in Rose Tattoo
description: STOCKBRIDGE, MASS. ACTORS are not necessarily the best judges of their own versatility. Witness Cicely Tyson, who, for her first stage role in 10 years, has chosen to perform as Serafina Delle Rose in Tennessee Williams's The Rose Tattoo at the Berkshire Theater Festival. Miss Tyson is an excellent dramatic actress, as demonstrated by, to name only one of many examples, The Autobiography of Miss Jane Pittman. A major problem with Miss Tyson's portrayal of Serafina is that comedy does not come naturally to her. In the earthy, robust Rose Tattoo, she barely elicits smile. One might conclude that comedy, at least this kind of lusty romantic comedy, is not in her range.

title: Sav ingsBanked sums. Obs.
description: WASHINGTON - In our consumer- crazed nation, the saver has fast be- come an endangered species. The bor- rowerspender rules supreme. But like cheap oil, cheap and readily available credit may be. a thing of the past. You can add savings to that list as well.

title: Ballet: Bolshoi's Stars Shine in Spartacus
description: THEY came, we saw, they conquered. They are Nadezhda Pavlova and Vyacheslav Gordeyev, two of the greatest dancers to be seen anywhere today, and when they stepped into the leads of the Bolshoi Ballet's Spartacus on Wednesday night, they not only scored a sensational personal triumph but also led the entire company into its best showing this season.

title: Politics in Census Hiring Will Go On, Carter Says
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) President Carter has decided that the 275,000 extra people needed to take the 1980 Census will be hired through political channels, rather than through the Civil Service, the White House said today.

title: PRESIDENT WEIGHING FIVEYEAR INCREASE IN MILITARY OUTLAYS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  The Carter Administration, in a bid to win the support of Senate moderates for the treaty on limitation of strategic arms, is seeking formula to increase military spending over the next five years. Government officials said today.

title: Bridge:
description: The result of the Spingold knockout team championship in the Summer Nationals in Las Vegas, Nev., this week makes it clear that the 1980 American team in the world championship in the Netherlands will be substantially different from the one competing in Brazil this fall.

title: Delig.hts of Sharm el Sheik Making Israeli Pullout Painful
description: SHARM EL SHEIK, Israeli-Occupied Sinai - Israel's public discomfort over giving the Sinai Peninsula back to Egypt is well known: military men are worried, oil men are distraught. But the sharpest pain is private, felt by individual Israelis who have been seduced by the mysterious beauty of the desert and have come here in the last 12 years as pioneers of a special kind, devoted to building lives that must now be dismantled and discarded.

title: Gunny Sacks to Book Rackso Texas Photographer's Odyssey
description: Charles Collum is a selfdescribed poor boy from the wrong side of Dal-  las whose father supported the family by buying and selling used burlap bags. You know, gunny sacks, Mr. Collura says now with a faint smile.

title: Big Board Seat Price Rises
description: A seat on the New York Stock Exchange was sold for $210,000 yesterday, the highest price paid for a Big Board seat since June 6, 1972, the exchange said. The latest sale was up $15,000 from the previous sale on Wednesday.

title: Large Bluefish Plentiful In Deep Water Offshore
description: AREA A  Captain Andy's Marina in Margate, N.J., reports plenty of large bluefish offshore in 60 to 70 feet of water, most being taken on umbrella rigs. Both snapper (young of the year) blues and sea bass are being caught in Margate Bay, and there are goodsized weakfish along the beaches with shore anglers doing well from the bridges at night. Numerous white marlin can be found about 28 miles offshore; one 300pound blue marlin has been caught. Yellowfin tuna are plentiful offshore, also. Fishing for 6-to-8-pound bluefish is excellent both day and night about three miles offshore, according to a report from Lighthouse Marina at Barriegat, N.J.They are being taken by both jigging and chumming, mostly the former. At Point Pleasant, N.J., Ken's Landing says that large bluefish have been plentiful the past two weeks, most of them about six miles offshore. Because these fish have been on top as well as running deep, a wide variety of angling approaches has been possible. AREA B  Blues are being caught in the surf from Sandy Hook to Long Branch, reports Giglio's Tackle at Sea Bright, N.J., and weakfish to 8 pounds are also being taken by shore anglers. The offshore blues, often within reach of cartop boats, are running slightly larger (8 to 10 pounds) than their inshore brethren. Smaller blues and weakfish are being caught in the Navesink and Shrewsbury Rivers; 2-to4pound fluke are in Sandy Hook Bay and crabbing is excellent in bay waters and river mouths. Captree State Park reports good fluking from the Fire Island Bridge to Fire Island Inlet, quite a few bluefish from 2 to 5 pounds inshore and plenty of snapper blues.

title: U.S. Helicopters Head for Europe In Test of Refueling Requirement
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (Reuters)Four United States helicopters will try to make aviation history by flying to Europe without refueling over the Atlantic, the Army said today.

title: Amtrak Sets a Record In Riders for a Month
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) - The gasoline shortage helped Amtrak to achieve its first two-millionpassenger month in June, officials of the Governmentrun rail system said today.

title: Orioles Rally to Defeat Brewers
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 9 (UPI) - Rich Dauer's tworun double with one out in the eighth inning tonight brought Mike Flanagan his 15th victory and enabled the Baltimore Orioles to snap a four- game losing streak with a 32 victory over the Milwaukee Brewers.

title: U. S. Inquiry Finds Unusual Wear In Subway Cars BodyTruck Link
description: Federal investigators who visited New York this week to examine problems related to 754 defective subway cars produced by the Pullman Standard Company yesterday confirmed that they had found abnormal wear at the point where the cars are attached to their undercarriages.

title: Officials Move to Keep Metropolitan Hospital Open
description: A top New York City official said yesterday that in the final analysis, we will probably find a way to keep open Metropolitan Hospital in East Harlem  a hospital the Koch administration had said would close. The official's comment came as it was learned that state officials were quietly urging the city to keep open, and to speed the opening of a new hospital in Brooklyn.

title: Fire in Big Geneva Hotel
description: GENEVA, Aug. 9 (AP) - A predawn fire today forced the evacuation of guests from the upper floors of the 18story InterContinental Hotel, the city's largest, officials said.

title: 17,000 Survivors Mark 1945 Nagasaki ABlast
description: NAGASAKI, Japan, Aug. 9 (UPI)Survivors of the world's second atomicbomb blast, including a former United States Marine who says he is dying of bone cancer caused by radiation from the 1945. explosion, gathered in Nagasaki today for prayers and memorial services.

title: 7 Arrested in Pentagon Protest
description: WASHINGTON, Aug.9 (AP)  Seven demonstrators opposing nuclear weapons were, arrested today for throwing blood and ashes in a shopping concourse inside the Pentagon. the police said. Earlier. about 30 protesters briefly chained themselves to the front of the Pentagon and threw blood on the Defense Department's headquarters. The demonstrations were the second this week by members of the Atlantic Life Community marking the 34th anniversary of dropping of atomic bombs on Japan at the end of World War II.

title: Ford Sets Cutback At 2 Plants in Ohio
description: DEARBORN, Aug. 9 (Reuters) The Ford Motor Company said today that it would close its Econoline Wagon and Club Wagon lines at the Lorain, Ohio, plant for two weeks beginning Aug. 13 to balance inventories.

title: WEEKEND MOVIE CLOCK; MANHATTAN; Below 42d Street; 43d-60th Streets; Upper East Side; Upper West Side; Specials; BRONX; BRONX (Cont'd); BROOKLYN; STATEN ISLAND; QUEENS; LONG ISLAND; Nassau; Suffolk; LONG ISLAND (Cont'd); ROCKLAND; WESTCHESTER; FAIRFIELD
description: ART (CR 34011) Fri. Sat. Sun. Witemistress (R) 4:10,1:10; Bread & Chocolate 1:55. 6, 10. Fri. Sat. Outrageous (R) mtcnight.

title: Koch Is Called `A Public Scold By Ohrenstein
description: Mayor Koch has been labeled a public scold by a fellow Democrat, the mi- nority leader of the State Senate.

title: Prosecution Rests in Gambler's DrugSmuggling Trial
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 9 - The prosecution ended its case today in the drug smuggling trial of Jamiel (Jimmy) Chagra, a case that is pare of a web of Texas intrigue with strands that lead to more than one murder and to numerous insights into the widening drug trade in the Southwest.

title: Sandy Duncan Tries Wings as Peter Pan
description: When she zooms onto the stage tonight as Broadway's first new Peter Pan in a quarter of a century, Sandy Duncan will doubtless strike many in her audience as she has always seemed: cute, pert and perky.

title: Past Vandalism Recalled in Yonkers
description: YONKERS, Aug. 9 - From the sound of her name it might be hard to tell that Heidi Monasterial, who lives across the Yonkers street from the firebombed home that a black family had just moved into, has a Puerto Rican mother and a Filipino father.

title: U.S. Voices Concern Over Famine In Cambodia and Offers Assistance
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 - The Carter Administration said today that it was deeply concerned over mounting signs of famine in Cambodia and declared would participate in international efforts to help all Cambodians in need. regardless of their political affiliations.

title: Dance: Ohio Ballet
description: BECKET, MASS.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: ICING FOR THE GARDEN

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran,Aug. 9 (AP) - Religious zealots clashed today with thousands of demonstrators opposed to the Government's new press law until Islamic revolutionary guards fired into the air to disperse them.

title: Arum Charges tie on Apartheid Shift
description: JOHANNESBURG, Aug.9 - Robert Arum, the American boxing promoter, accused the South African Government today of having lied to him about plans to change its apartheid policy at sport- ing events beginning with the World Boxing Association heavyweight title fight he is promoting between John Tate and Gerrie Coetzee in Pretoria on Oct. 20.

title: Which Horse for the Missile Races?
description: How do you install American missiles so that the Russians can count them for the purposes of arms con- trol without knowing where to find them if they ever choose to attack? That riddle has been confronting American defense planners as they faced up to the pro- spective vulnerability of their Minuteman missiles in underground silos. Many solutions have been studied and some were even hailed before flaws became evi- dent. The same fate may overtake the socalled race track system now recommended by Defense Secre- tary Brown. More likely, however, this is the plan President Carter will soon approve. He needs to com- mit himself to a mobile missile in order to win Senate ratification of SALT II because all sides regard a mo- bile system - the current favorite missile being the MX - as essential to American security through the life of the arms control treaty.

title: Market Place
description: Karen W. Arerison

title: Auctions
description: WHAT is described as the most distinguished collection of coins from this continent to be auctioned in this century will go under the hammer in several sales at Bowers & Ruddy Galleries in Los Angeles, beginning in the fall. It is the Garrett Collection. comprising regular United States mint issues, Colonial, territorial, pattern and related coins, and its sale will begin Nov. 28 and 29. In all, there are more than 2,000 coins in the assemblage that was started in the 1860's by T. Harrison Garrett, who later became president of the Baltimore & Ohio Railroad and died in 1888.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Satellite Photograph

title: China Bolsters Refugee Fund
description: GENEVA, Aug. 9 - The office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees announced today that China had paid the $973,000 contribution it promised for the program to aid Indochi- nese refugees. China announced.its inten- tion to make the contribution during last month's United Nations conference here on the Indochinese refugees.

title: Jet Hijacker Gets 10 Years
description: OMAHA, Aug. 9 (AP) - A California man who hijacked a Trans World Airlines jet over Nebraska nearly 10 years ago and ordered it flown to Cuba has been sentenced to 10 years in a Federal prison.

title: The Miserable Weather of Tokyo in August Melts Aplomb and Manners
description: TOKYO, Aug. 9 - August is a tense time of year in Tokyo. It is a season when 100degree temperatures and near 100 percent humidity stretch the nerves. Selfcontrol melts away and mariners are forgotten.

title: Disabled Queens Woman Is Killed In an Electrical Fire in Apartment
description: A 65-year-old Queens woman, disabled from a hip injury, died in a fire early yes- terday that started in her Rego Park apartment when an electrical plug short- circuited, showering sparks onto her bed, authorities said.

title: HANOI IS DENOUNCED BY AN AIDE WHO FLED
description: PEKING, Aug. 9A ranking Vietnamese Communist official who defected to China last month held a news conference here today and charged that Hanoi's treatment of ethnic Chinese in Vietnam was even worse than Hitler's treatment of the Jews.

title: Girls in Athletics Provide New Focus for Doctors
description: When the 24,000member American Academy of Pediatrics holds its annual meeting in San Francisco next October, a seminar on The Girl Athlete will be on the agenda for the first time in the organization's 49year history.

title: CORRECTION
description: A chart accompanying an article on the Palm Beach Company in Business Day on Tuesday incorrectly reported the company's pershare earnings. The correct earnings were $3.80 in 1978 and $3.30 in 1077.

title: Bar Refuses to Support Curb on Third Party  Searches
description: DALLAS, Aug. 9 The American Bar Association's top administrative board today. rejected a proposal to put the associatiOn on record in favor of restricting the power of the police to conduct surprise searches of third parties who are not themselves suspected of a crime.

title: The Region
description: Expressing fears that publicity might prejudice the right of three de- fendants to a fair trial, a State Supreme Court justice in Riverhead, L.I., has barred the public and the press from pretrial hearings in a murder case in- volving three Yonkers men.

title: Toward a Hands Off Doctrine for Superpowers
description: To the Editor:

title: New Italian Premier Pledges to COnsult With Reds
description: ROME, Aug. 9 - Italy's new Prime Minister, Francesco Cossiga, presenting. his threeparty coalition Government to Parliament today, promised to consult closely with the opposition Communist Party and appealed for wide national support in the face of expected economic difficulties.

title: World Gold
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 9, 1979

title: New I.T.T. Chief Reassures Analysts
description: In a move apparently designed to counteract a decline in the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation's stock, Rand V. Araskog, the newly named president and chief executive. assured security analysts vester- day that there would be nosignificant policy changes at the company despite the surprise resignation of Lyman C. Hamilton Jr. as president and chief executive almost one month ago.

title: U.S. Will Stop Aiding Central African Empire
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) - The United States is ending its foreign aid program to the Central African Empire because of humanrights violations and will take a hard look at future international loans for that country, the State Department said today.

title: Bluegrass Contest And OldTime Music At South St. Seaport; Picking and Sawing At Bluegrass Contest; Vying for Cash and Bookings
description: PLENTY of regular folks, including a Wall Street lawyer, a former nuclear engineer, housewives, professors and truck drivers, are going to be picking guitars and banjos and sawing away at fiddles tomorrow and Sunday at the Seventh Annual New York City Bluegrass and Old Time Country Music Contest. The event, as in years past, will be taking place at the South Street Seaport Museum at Fulton Street and the East River Drive. The pickers, all amateurs or semiprofessionals, will be competing for $1,000 in prize money to be awarded by a panel of professional judges.

title: Hans Winterkorn, 73; A Princeton Professor And an Expert on Soil
description: Hans Friedrich Winterkorn, professor emeritus of civil engineering and geophysics at Princeton University, died of cancer Tuesday at New York Hospital. He was 73 years old and had lived in Manhattan since his retirement five years ago.

title: A Sindona Inquiry by Italian Parliament Gets Support
description: ROME, Aug. 9 - A parliamentary in- vestigation into links between Michele Sindona, the missing Italian financier, and members of the Italian Government appeared assured today.

title: Art People
description: IT'S no easy task to slog around the city shaking hands with each of the 8,500 sanitation workers wbo grapple with our garbage, but for Mierle Laderman Ukeles it's a labor of well, art. In a project called Touch Sanitation, she is working all of the sanitation Department districts in every borough, dropping in at garages, incinerators, marine transfers, landfills, neighborhoods where San men battle trash cans. She has mapped a campaign of greeting between 75 and 100 men a day, often working a 12hour shift. Thank you for keeping New York City alive, she says to each one, with a firm handshake (the men remove their gloves).

title: The Pop Life
description: POP music in recent years has generally meant music that is played on the radio, or could well be rock or soul or disco or salsa or new-wave/no-wave rock or country or folk. This is music that ap- peals to the young, usually to people who listen to progressive FM stations or who frequent New York clubs.

title: The City
description: An estimated $200,000 worth of dia- monds, other gems and gold was stolen from an office in Manhattan's diamond district by two men who accosted a jeweler and locked him in his safe, the police said.

title: 5,000 Chrysler Salaried Employees Face Layoffs
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9  The Chrysler Corporation, its losses mounting, is reportedly planning to lay off 5,000 whitetollar workers across the country beginning next week.

title: Second Suspect, a Teller, Is Seized In Record New York Bank Robbery
description: Less than a week after the biggest cash robbery from a bank ever committed in New York City, Federal agents. and the police said yesterday that they had arrested a second suspect  the assistant head teller at the bank  and that they knew the identities of the others involved.

title: $805 Million Bidder Gets Bodcaw
description: The International Paper Company disclosed last night that it had bought the majority of the shares of the Bodcaw Company and was proceeding to acquire the remainder, for a total of $805 million in cash and notes.

title: Franklin Mint Seeks Sport Chain
description: The Franklin Mint Corporation, the world's largest private mint, which has been seeking to diversify in an effort to counter slumping sales of its coins, announced yesterday that it had entered into an agreement to acquire Eastern Mountain Sports Inc., a leading seller of outdoor equipment for such pastimes as camping and skiing.

title: 2 Coast F.B.I. Agents Slain; Another Shot.Dead in Ohio
description: EL CENTRO, Calif., Aug. 9 - Two agents of the Federal Bureau of Investigation were shot to death today in this desert community 90 minutes after another agent was slain in Cleveland while trying to arrest a fugitive. The three killings, which appeared unrelated, made the day the worst for loss of life in the bureau's 71-year history.

title: Engineers, Disclosing New Technology, Express Optimism on World energy Problems
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7A huge body of new technology is being disclosed here this week by some 700 of the world's most in- novative engineers, who believe that solutions to pressing global energy prob- lems have already been found and that the technology can be applied as soon as money is made available.

title: Kent J. Bartschi Marries Elizabeth Smith in Utah
description: Elizabeth C. Smith and Kent J. Bartschi, students at the University of Utah, were married yesterday in Salt Lake City. The ceremony was per- formed in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints by Elder Jack H. Goaslind.

title: Correction Chief Quitting; Ward Named to Fill Post
description: Mayor Koch announced yesterday that he had accepted the resignation of Wil- liam J. Ciuros Jr., Commissioner of Cor- rection, and that he would replace him with Benjamin Ward, chief of the Hous- ing Authority police and former State Commissioner of Correctional Services.

title: Suggested Rule Change Viewed As a Way to Block Kennedy Draft
description: DETROIT, Aug. 9  Officials in the DemoCratic National Committee today suggested a new requirement for candidates in primary elections that could be used to block a movement to draft Edward M. Kennedy as the party's Presidential nominee in 1980  by using an uncommitted line on primary ballots as a, surrogate for the Massachusetts Senator.

title: Black Market Makes Ho Chi Minh City Run; Two Million Residents?; To Some, Death City; Gasoline on Black Market; Food Benefits Reduced
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  Four years after the Communist victory, Ho CM Minh City, renamed for the father of the Vietnamese revolution, has emerged as one of the black market capitals of Southeast Asia.

title: How to Keep Good Soldiers
description: One big attraction of a military career today is the chance to retire at half pay after 20 years of service. But there's a catch. For those who retire sooner, the only goingaway present is a pat on the back.

title: Death of Divers Investigated
description: ABERDEEN, Scotland, Aug. 9 (Reuters) - An Energy Department investigation has begun into the death yesterday of two divers who were trapped in a diving bell at the bottom of the North Sea when a cable snapped while they were working on an oil rig. They were identi fied today as Richard Walker of Santa Barbara, Calif., and Victor Guiel of Springfield, Mass. The accident happened 130 miles northeast of the Shetland Islands in the Thistle Field, where the British National Oil Corporation is drillMg.

title: White House Pledges Full Airing of Findings On Landrieu Interests
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI)  Any possible conflict of interest involving Moon Landrieu, President Carter's nominee for Secretary of Housing and Urban Development, will be fully aired, Jody Powell, the White House press secretary, said today.

title: S.E.C. Judge Backs Penalty for Allen &
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 - An administrative law judge for the Securities and Exchange Commission ruled today that Allen & Company, a New York City brokerage firm, and one of its traders should be suspended from over- thecounter trading for five. days. He cleared both defendants of more serious charges brought by the commission, however.

title: Sudanese Armed Forces on Alert As Students Riot on Living Costs
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Aug. 9 (UPI)  The Government ordered the armed forces on alert today because of student riots over the rising cost of living, including gasoline prices.

title: Modern Museum Begins Friday Film Cycle
description: The development of international cinema from its earliest days to the present is the subject of the fifth cycle in the History of Film series at the Museum of Modern Art, 11 West 53d Street. The cycle, consisting of 190 pro- grams, will be shown Fridays at 6 P.M. for the next four years.

title: Survey Reports. Fertility Levels Plummet in Developing Nations
description: Fertility levels in developing countries are declining at a dramatic rate and about half the women of reproductive age say they want no more children, the largest international population survey ever undertaken has found.

title: U.S. Gift to Israeli Memorial
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 9 (UPI)  President Carter's Holocaust Commission presented Air Force photographs of Auschwitz today to Israel's memorial to the six million Jews killed by the Nazis. The 42 members toured the memorial, Yad Vashem. The photos were taken by an American bomber in 1944, indicating that the United States knew of the death camps.

title: Canadian in Tanzania
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Joe Clark of Canada met with President Julius K. Nyerere today after  officials of both countries signed a new phase of the Canadian wheat program. Mr. Nyerere and Mr. Clark, who arrived on a twoday state visit earlier today, were believed to be discussing the Zimbabwe Rhodesia issue and further Canadian aid to Tanzania.

title: Screen: 'Americathon' Spoofs National Politics:1998, Not a Good Year
description: THE premise of "Americathon" is strong enough to sustain a 15-minute skit, but the movie has the ill fortune to drag on for an hour and a half. Here's the funny part: America is almost bankrupt in the year 1998, thanks perhaps to the lousy leadership of former President Fred Silverman (whose portrait hangs prominently on a wall) and the current President, a jive turkey from California. This fellow, Chet Roosevelt (John Ritter), makes his Cabinet members wear name tags that say "Hi, I'm Morty" or whatever, and conducts business from the Western White House, which is a condominium in Marina Del Ray. He is fond of telling the populace "I love you" on state occasions, and sleeps on red satin sheets bearing the Presidential seal.All of this is established amusingly but all too quickly, before "Americathon," which opens today at the Paramount and other theaters, moves on to the soggier business at hand. To keep the country from going broke, the President decides to stage a 30-day telethon with a $400 billion goal. If this isn't the world's greatest idea, at least it's better than anything his First Lady  or his Old Lady, as he likes to call her  has been able to come up with. Her plan was to throw a big dance and charge everybody a $5 admission fee.Once the telethon  hosted by Harvey Korman, who plays the transvestite star of some very successful sitcom  gets under way, the movie stops in its tracks. There's nothing to satirize here; the real thing is ridiculous enough. When the director (Neil Israel, who also made "Tunnelvision") brings on the ventroquists and the tap-dancing moppets and the roller-skaters, he achieves a feeling of clutter and little more. The show also features a very unfunny Vietnamese rock band and fleeting guest appearances by Elvis Costello and Meat Loaf, neither of whom does anything that might make the rest of the movie worth sitting through for his fans."Americathon" is rated PG ("Parental Guidance Suggested"). It contains a few lewd gestures and innuendoes.

title: Commercial Paper Unfazed by Chrysler
description: The Chrysler Corporation's financial problems may be sending shock waves through Washington and the banking system, but the sensitive commercialpaper market, which has been upset by Chrysler in the past, has remained relatively aloof from the problems this time around.

title: IN THE NATION American Dilemma: IV
description: SAN JUAN, P.R. - Ruben Berrios Martinez, the 40-year-old leader of the Puerto Rican Independence Party, recently found an apt metaphor with which to damn both statehooders and supporters of the present com- monwealth status as assimila- tionists.

title: The Editorial Notebook Don't Kill Revenue Sharing
description: When word trickled out of Washington recently that the general revenue sharing program was in danger of being scrapped, local officials registered alarm. This seven-year-old program, which annually pumps $6.8 billion in highly flexible grants into local treasunes, is more popular man any other form of Federal aid. Governors, mayors and county officials use their allotments for street and sewer re- pairs, police, fire and other services.

title: Money Supply Up
description: The nation's basic money supply climbed by $1.2 billion in the latest reporting week, an unexpectedly big jump that touched off forecasts yesterday that the Federal Reserve Board would move shortly to tighten credit nolicv.

title: Carter Plans Journey on a Riverboat
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  President Carter will journey down the Mississippi River on one of the nation's last two overnight passenger steamboats to rally support for his energy program, the White House announced today.

title: WHITE HOUSE OFFERS CHRYSLER AID ONLOANGUARANTEE PLAN, REJECTING $1 BILLION ADVANCE
description: WASHINGTON; Aug. 9 - The Carter Administration announced today that it would help the financially troubled Chrysler Corporation formulate a loanguarantee plan for submission to Congress but rejected the auto maker's request for a $1 billion interestfree advance.

title: Mudslide Hits New Zealand City
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Aug. 9 (UPI) - Millions of tons of mud from a rainweakened hillside slsid into the southern, New Zealand city of Dunedin today, crushing 50 homes and briefly trapping 17 people.

title: The International Haughtons
description: Billy Haughton has driven winners of 4,400 harness  races, accounting for more than $27 million in purses, and has polished off just about every important stake except the Roosevelt International Trot. Starting 20 years ago, he has tried for that one six times and six times it has got away.

title: Restaurants
description: the new Japanese restaurant, Mitsukoshi, opened 25 years ago, it would probably have been heralded as a gastronomic landmark. But given the level of sophistication and authenticity represented in New York's Japanese restaurants today, this ambitious and somewhat handsome installation while decent, leaves much to be desired in gastronomic excitement. It would be interesting to know what sort of evaluation of the local food scene was made by the owners of this costly newcomer before they decided on the culinary level they consider adequate. Located just below a shop (also called Mitsukoshi) selling fine Japanese porcelain and art objects, the entrance stairway, cocktail lounge and sushi bar of the restaurant are beautifully laid out with blond wood, mirrors and plants. The setting is spacious, quiet and conducive to conversation as one has a beforedinner drink or some of the vinegar rice, seaweed and fish sushi or the raw fish sashimi that are Mitsukoshi's best offerings. There is also a single tatami room behind sliding shoji panels and judging by a few quick peeks, this; too, is a handsome room.

title: Plaintiffs in a Suit on Drug Tests Win Limited Victory Over C.I.A.
