The deal, which is subject to final documentation and closing conditions, is expected to be completed by Sept. 30.

title: ABROAD AT HOME Missing Andrew Young
description: There was no good alternative to Andrew Young's resignation when came. He was not prepared to comply with the policy to which his Government was publicly committed, on highly sensitive subject. He had to go.

title: Prodigal Son's Atonement
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N.Y.,

title: Moslem Extremists in Syria Trying to Destabilize Government With Terrorist Attacks
description: DAMASCUS, Syria, Aug. 16  As citizen, I may criticize the Government, but I cannot accept these sectarian killings, a Syrian engineer said the other day, expressing revulsion over the slaying of the country's leading neurosurgeon, for no apparent reason except that he belonged to the ruling Moslem Alawite sect.

title: IRAN'S TROOPS MOVE ON KURDISII CAPITAL AT KHOMEINI'S ORDER
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 19  Iranian Government forces converged on the Kurdistan capital, Sanandaj, today after Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini ordered general mobilization to crush what he called a Kurdish rebellion there.

title: Marriage Announcement 11 -- No Title
description: Emily Ann Morris Is Married

title: Auto Strikes Considered
description: DETROIT, Aug. 19 (AP)  The United Automobile Workers union is considering strikes in late August at several General Motors Corporation plants to spur contract negotiations at a G.M. plant in Oklahoma City, a union spokesman said today. According to unidentified union officials quoted in an article in The Flint (Mich.) Journal, the strikes are tentatively planned for Aug. 30 and 31, probably at plants that supply parts for G.M.'s fastselling small cars.

title: Aides Removed by Koch On White House job List
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 17  It was a coincidence that Mayor Koch's cabinet shakeup took place within weeks of the cabinet shuffle of President Carter. But in politics, coincidence can lead to convenient results. Now, some of those ousted from the Mayor's inner circle are on lists circulating at the White House for jobs in Washington.

title: Teamsters Union Is Negotiating Pact for Its First Unit in Chinatown
description: A teamsters local that announced in May a drive to organize Chinatown businesses began negotiating its first contract with two small food warehouses last month. It won election as the bargaining representative for their employees in June.

title: No Title
description: Esther Margolis Bride Of Dr. Stanley Fisher

title: Pirates Beat Dodgers on Madlock Homer
description: Pitching was the dominant force yesterday at Three Rivers Stadium in Pittsburgh, where the Pirates turned back the Los Angeles Dodgers, 20.

title: Woman Killed and Pilot Injured As Plane Goes Down on Takeoff
description: PIITSTOWN, N.J., Aug. 19 (UPI) A 30yearold woman passenger in a private plane was killed and the pilot critically injured today when a plane crashed on takeoff from Alexandria Airport, officials reported.

title: Jets Todd Deals With Being Second String
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 19  Richard Todd, on the second day of knowing that Matt Robinson was the coach's choice as the starting quarterback for the New York Jets, was in his room at Hofstra University today playing cards and quoting Paul (Bear) Bryant, his college coach at Alabama.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partial list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Hard Work Brings Golf Payoff
description: HARRISON, N.Y., Aug. 19  Winning isn't everything, Jack Renner said yesterday after gaining his first victory since joining the PGA Tour 26 months ago. There is more to life than golf.

title: CITIZEN UNITS FOUND OUTSPENT ON ISSUES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 19 (UPI)  When citizens groups force votes on local issues affecting business interests, they are often outspent by corporations and lose in the balloting, a public interest research group says.

title: Hot Spots Doused in Idaho Fire
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 19 (UPI)  Mopup crews today doused socalled hot spots smoldering in the remnants of Idaho's biggest forest fire in 40 years, which burned across 100 square miles of pristine wilderness in three weeks.

title: Frederick C. Rieber, Former Aide With City Correction Department
description: Frederick C. Rieber, former first deputy commissioner of the city's Department of Correction, died yesterday in the Cabrini Health Care Center in Manhattan. He was 79 years old.

title: A Listing of New Books
description: GENERAL

title: LeDoux Rally Earns Draw With Norton
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 19 (AP)  Scott LeDoux staggered Ken Norton twice in the final two rounds and rallied for a draw in a 10round heavyweight fight today at the Met Sports Center.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Loeb Placing 75% of New Hampshire Paper in a Trust for Employees,
description: CONCORD, N.H., Aug. 19 (AP)  William Loeb, the conservative newspaper publisher, said today that he had turned over ownership of 75 percent of The Manchester Union Leader to a trust for the sole benefit of his employees.

title: V.F.W. Panel Favors Giving Endorsements And Campaign Gifts
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 19 (UPI)  A Veterans of Foreign Wars committee approved a bylaws change today that would allow the organization to drop an 80year tradition of nonpartisanship and allow political endorsements and campaign contributions.

title: Three Soviet Diplomats Expelled by Costa Rica
description: SAN JOSE, Costa Rica, Aug. 19 (UPI)  President Rodrigo Carazo Odio ordered the expulsion of three Soviet diplomats today as renewed labor rioting injured hundreds in Limon.

title: Greenpeace Ship Towed to Port For Hampering Icelandic Whaling
description: LONDON, Aug. 19 (AP)  The Icelandic coast guard has boarded the Greenpeace organization's antiwhaling ship, Rainbow Warrior, and towed it to Reykjavik today, Tony Marriner, representative for the ecology group, said today.

title: Son of Dodd May Seek Ribicoff's Seat
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 18  Of all the biographies of Connecticut officials in the State Register & Manual, the government handbook, Christopher J. Dodd's is by far the shortest. It says only that he is a thirdterm Democratic Congressman from Norwich, has two district offices, was born in Willimantic 35 years ago and is married to the former Susan Mooney.

title: Prime Minister Is Cited In Rhodesian Law Suit
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  The commander of Zimbabwe Rhodesia's Selous Scouts, Lieut. Col. Ron ReidDaly, is suing Prime Minister Abel T. Muzorewa and eight others over the alleged tapping of his telephone. his lawyer said today.

title: For Yaz, Baseball Is Finally Fun
description: BOSTON

title: Near New York, Three Health Farms for BudgetConscious Dieters
description: The best time to diet is spring, because summer follows spring and summer means bathing suits.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Toyota and Datsun Exports Rise
description: TOKYO. Aug. 19 (AP)  The Japanese auto makers Toyota and Nissan reported that production and exports of passenger cars last month exceeded yearearlier levels.

title: Pisarcik, Dean Not Hurt Seriously
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N. J., Aug.19  The Giants got some consolation today when Joe Pisarcik and Randy Dean were able to attend a team meeting at Giants Stadium to review last night's 73 exhibition loss to the San Diego Chargers.

title: AIDES SAY U.S. KNEW ABOUT YOUNG'S TALK
description: Senior American intelligence officials said yesterday that the State Department knew about the substance of Andrew Young's meeting with a representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization before it asked him to provide an account of the conversation.

title: City Opera to Give Free Daughter of the Regiment
description: The New York City Opera will give a free, fully staged performance of Donizetti's The Daughter of the Regiment next Saturday at 8 P.M. at the Lakeside Theater of Eisenhower Park, East Meadow. L. I.

title: W.H. Hammond Jr. Weds Linda Eastman
description: Linda Kay Eastman, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James S. Eastman of Livingston, N.J., was married there yesterday to William Henry Hammond Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Hammond of Aurora, Colo. The ceremony was performed in the Presbyterian Church by the Rev. Dr. William Ackerman. He was assisted by the Rev. Dorothy Specht.

title: Former Uganda Deputy Minister Reported Arrested With 2 Others
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  A former deputy minister under former President Yusufu K. Lule, and two journalists have been arrested, their lawyers said today.

title: Chess:
description: Ljubomir Ljubojevic won a 10game match with Svetozar Gligoric in Belgrade by the margin of 54, winning four games, losing three and drawing three.

title: Egypt Reports Communist Plot
description: CAIRO, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  The Egyptian police plan a series of raids this week to arrest members of the banned Communist Party following discovery of a plot to overthrow President Anwar elSadat, Interior Ministry officials said. today. All party members will be rounded up if there is evidence they were involved in the plot to set up a Communist government in Egypt, the officials said.

title: 9 Palestinian Guerrillas Captured In Clash with U.N. Lebanon Force
description: METULLA, Israel, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  Troops of the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon clashed with Palestinian guerrillas in southern Lebanon today and took nine prisoners, members of the United Nations force said.

title: 2 Ulster Officers Hurt by Bomb
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 19 (Reuters)  Two policemen were slightly injured today when a bomb planted by guerrillas exploded on a country road near Newbutler, about 10 miles from the border with the Irish republic.

title: The Region
description: NEWARK (AP)  An offduty Essex County sheriff's officer was shot yesterday when he was investigating a suspected breaking and entering at the transport company where he was working, the police said.

title: Economic Union Studied By South Pacific Nations
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 19  New Zealand, struggling with a steep economic slide, is losing a steady stream of emigrants to Australia, 1,200 miles west across the Tasman Sea. and in both countries politicians and business executives alike are beginning to indicate that a Europeanstyle common market may be ahead for them.

title: Letter: On Northern Ireland
description: To the Editor:

title: INDIAN LEADER QUITS, SEEKS NEW ELECTION; Singh Fails to Get Backing of Mrs. Gandhi for Vote of Confidence
description: NEW DELHI, Monday, Aug. 20  The Government of Prime Minister Charan Singh resigned this morning when it became apparent that it could not muster a majority in a parliamentary vote of confidence.

title: Disks: 10 Selections on One Record, by the Father of Them All
description: ALTHOUGH Composers Recordings Inc. customarily devotes itself to previously unrecorded contemporary music, it has established a valuable American Historic reissue series to preserve significant recordings that commercial companies have dropped from their catalogues for one reason or another.

title: Rogers Has New TV Series on School
description: If you are 5 or 6 years old and jittery about starting school, or if you are an equally jittery parent of a child starting school. relax. Fred Rovers will be hick with a new series of his awardwinning Mister Rogers Neighborhood television programs starting next Monday on the Public Broadcasting Service  and he has something reassuring in mind for parents as well as youngsters.

title: Books: Raymond Massey On the Stage of the Past
description: THE early 1930's in London were a great time to get to love the theater. The players could not have been bettered. The new

title: Mears Triumphs In Kitzler 150
description: TRENTON, Aug.19  Rick Mears gambled today that his rapidly wearing tires would hold out until the end of the Ditzler 150 auto race at Trenton International Speedway.

title: Lapidus Takes Final
description: GROSSINGER, N.Y., Aug. 19  Jay Lapidus of Princeton, N.J., scored a 76, 61, 61 victory over Fritz Buehning of Short Hills, N.J., today in the final of the United States Tennis AssociationCelanese men's 21 singles championship at Grossineers Hotel.

title: Blacks Seek Closer Arab Ties
description: Several black civil rights leaders are saying, in a major shift in policy, that they are moving to establish closer ties with the Palestinians and to try to force a change in American Middle East policy.

title: America's Morocco Policy
description: PORTLAND, Ore.  Morocco, a close ally of the United States, has become bogged down in a struggle for control of the mineralrich but sparsely populated Western Sahara. Some of the public debate on this struggle has generated serious misperceptions about America's relationship with Morocco. Far from promoting an aggressive policy, the Government has encouraged King Hassan II to be moderate and accommodating and has refused to authorize any major arms sales in the last two years, a position that has caused some irritation in America's normally harmonious relations with Morocco.

title: Bar Owners Say Sailors' Violence Cost Profits in Great Lakes Area
description: NORTH CHICAGO, Ill., Aug. 20 (AP)  Six weeks ago  before a twoday rampage along North Chicago's entertainment strip  the Great Lakes Naval Training Center had the atmosphere of a college campus.

title: Miss Little Endures Sting, Wins by Stroke
description: PLYMOUTH, Ind., Aug. 20 (UPI) Sally Little overcame a bee sting on the 17th hole today and won the $100,000 Ladies Professional Golf Association Barth classic with an eightunderpar 208. It was her second victory of the year.

title: Mexico and U.S. Still Split on Natural Gas
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 20The sensitive natural gas issue is once again straining relations between the United States and Mexico, just weeks before President Jos Lopez Portillo is due in Washington for fresh energy talks with President Carter.

title: George McL. Harper Jr.; Held Chair at Williams
description: George McLean Harper Jr., Garfield Professor of Ancient Languages emeritus at Williams College, died Friday at North Adams Regional Hospital, North Adams, Mass., after a brief illness. He was 79 years old and lived in Williamstown, Mass.

title: JURY IN RACKET CASE. ILL NOT BE LIMITED
description: ROME, Ga., Aug. 20 (UPI)  A Federal judge today opened the racketeering trial of Michael G. Thevis, the convicted pornographer, by telling defense attorneys that he would not exclude jurors simply because they were revolted by explicit sex material.

title: Comdr. Walter Slye Dead at 78; Yacht Pilot for Four Presidents
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Comdr. Walter Chapman Slye, who piloted yachts for four Presidents, has died of cancer at Bethesda Naval Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: PARK PEP Today's lunchtime diversion in the Bryant Park Music and Dance Festival features the Mime Duet  Vivian Belmont and Mark Stolzenberg  who do more than just miming Their act also includes unicycling, comic and fire juggling, music, acrobatics and audience participation. The partners have performed with Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus, at Lincoln Center, the Guggenheim Museum, the United Nations and in television and film.

title: Tapes in Napoli's Trial Tell of Special Favors in Jail
description: A series of secret tape recordings was played yesterday at the bribery trial of James Napoli, the reputed organizedcrime figure. On tape Mr. Napoli described how his influence enabled him to get special attention from officials while he was in jail.

title: About New York
description: Should you find yourself on the waterside promenade walk of Battery Park at noon tomorrow, you will, things go according to plan, see a newcomer to New York's port undergoing one of the more hallowed rituals of the harbor: an oldfashioned welcome. The guest of honor is not a new ship, but this is her first time here and tradition will beinvoked.

title: About Education
description: USINESS and higher education have long been involved in a lovehate relationship, needing but distrusting each other. Academics charge that business is interested only in the bottom line, and, businessmen complain that academics never have to meet a payroll. Academics tend to be condescending about corporate conservatism; business people suspect that the campuses are dominated by wildeyed radicals who know more aboutMarx than the market.

title: Quadruplets Die in Kentucky
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 20 (AP) Quadruplets born more than three months premature to a Louisville couple Jdied early today in the intensive care nursery of NortonChildren's Hospital, a spokesman said. Three boys and a girl were born last night to James and Barbara Keane. Mrs. Keane, 26 years old, was in satisfactory condition.

title: Closing Hospitals, Opening Wounds
description: The resignation yesterday of Deputy Mayor Haskell Ward, the highest ranking black in the Koch administration, reportedly resulted from his opposition to the Mayors plans to close Metropolitan Hospital in East Harlem. Mr. Ward had been harshly criticized by black and Hispanic leaders whenever he tried to justify the Mayors plan to close four municipal hospitals and reduce the size of others.

title: Taxes
description: OVER the years, hope has sprung eternal in the hearts of medical interns and residents who have sought to escape income taxes on at least a portion of the scholarship grants they received from their training hospitals. But tax law clearly states that fellowship income (up to $300 month) is exempt only if it is awarded for educa tional or research purposes, and not if it amounts to compensation for services rendered. Thus the courts have invariably turned a deaf ear to the young doctors petitions and ruled that their grants were essentially payment for services to patients at their training hospital.

title: Three Killed in Copter Crash
description: YAKIMA, Wash., Aug. 20 (AP) Three men were killed and one was injured today when a twinengine Chinook helicopter crashed at the Yakima Firing Center, the Army announced. The names of the victims were withheld pending notification of next of kin.

title: A Souvenir on Tap
description: It is, without doubt, the high tourist season in New York, and there's no shortage of novelty items for visitors to take home. In fact, a tourist may now even leave with something of the city's very essence  a bottle of water, straight from its source  in this case the tap.

title: U.S. Expects To Learn From Soviet Space Effort
description: THE two Soviet astronauts who lived for six months 200 miles above the earth in a compartment the size of a small house trailer are expected to provide biologists and physicians with a wealth of scientific data about living and working in space. But eager American space scientists likely will have to wait until the end of October to learn of any new Soviet findings or why one of the astronauts complained after landing of having trouble speaking normally. tists likely will have to wait until the end of October to learn of any new Soviet findings or why one of the astronauts complained after landing of having trouble speaking normally.

title: Film Union Asks Strike Sanction
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug 20 (Reuters) Representatives of 29 trade union branches today called on members to authorize a strike that could close down the United States film industry.

title: Typhoon Strikes Soviet Far East
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  A typhoon with winds gusting to 85 miles per hour struck the Soviet far east on Saturday, causing widespread flooding and leaving many people homeless, the Communist Party newspaper Pravda reported today. Pravda said that the typhoon ripped roofs from houses and caused flooding in a wide area around the towns of Vladivostok, Spassk and Ussuriysk. No casualty figures were given.

title: A MaandPa Restaurant for Jacob's Pillow Dancers
description: BECKET, Mass.  Someone's in the kitchen with Tessie, doing an entrechat six. Or helping her wash the silverware, despite the carefully lettered cardboard sign that reads: No Admittance. Tessie is BUSY. This means you.

title: Israel Bombs Lebanese Port and Says Captured Terrorists Sailed From It
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 20  Israeli fighters attacked three targets in southern Lebanon today in the first air action over the area in almost a month.

title: Somoza Begins Temporary Residence in Paraguay
description: ASUNCION, Paraguay, Aug. 20 (AP)  Anastasio Somoza Debayle, Nicaragua's deposed President, has begun temporary residence in Paraguay, one of the few countries that has not recognized the rebel Government that ousted him a month ago.

title: Singh's Resignation After 24 Days Leaves Indian Politics in Turmoil
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 20  India's political scene was in turmoil today as Prime Minister Charan Singh resigned after only 24 days in office and an opposition leader applied to the President for the right to try to form a Government.

title: Koch Tours Areas Looted in 1977
description: Mayor Koch walked the littered streets of Brooklyn's Bushwick and BedfordStuyvesant sections yesterday, visiting the Broadway shopping area that was looted during the 1977 blackout, listening to the praise and complaints of merchants and shoppers and stressing his commitment to all of the five boroughs.

title: Theater: Riffraff Revue, 7 Prisoners
description: RIFFRAFF REVUE, with book, music and lyrics by Mike Kellin. Directed by Albert Takazauckas; musical direction by John Miller; choreography by Sammy Bayes; setting and costumes by Michael Massee; lighting by Pat Collins; musical staging by Sammy Dallas Bayes; production stage manager, Mark Hare. Theater for the New City, George Bartenieff and Crystal Field present the Apole Stage production, Lawrence Goossen, producer. At 162 Second Avenue.

title: World News Briefs
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan, Aug. 20 (UPI)  Afghan Moslem rebels reported today that they had scored victories in fighting in areas on three sides of the Afghanistan capital of Kabul.BANGKOK, Thailand, Tuesday, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  About 50 people were killed and more than 100 were injured today when a freight train and a crowded passenger train smashed into each other six miles from the capital, the police reported.

title: Treasury Bill Yields Jump
description: Yields on threemonth and sixmonth Treasury bills rose sharply at the weekly auction yesterday.

title: Orioles 30 Victory Is Flanagan's 17th
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 20 (AP)  Mike Flanagan, again supported by Ken Singleton, who drove in all of Baltimore's runs with a homer and a double, pitched the Baltimore Orioles to a threehit 30 victory over the Texas Rangers tonight and became the American League's first 17game winner.

title: Auto Suppliers Help Chrysler
description: DETROIT, Aug. 20 (UPI)Automotive suppliers rallied to the support of the Chrysler Corporation today, offering to match the company's $400 rebate on big and midsized cars and trucks.

title: Violette Verdy Joining Boston Ballet
description: Violette Verdy, the French dancer who became one of the New York City Ballet's most popular ballerinas before leaving to direct the Paris Opera Ballet, has been named associate artistic director of the Boston Ballet. She will assume the newly created post on Sept. 1, 1980.

title: Editorial Faults Some Research On Cancer
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (AP)  Some Government reports about substances that may cause cancer are inaccurate, misleading and cause problems for doctors and patients, the editor of the Journal of the American Medical Association said in an editorial today.

title: 2 Questions on SALT
description: To those millions of Americans to whom evaluation of the strategicarms treaty has become lost in technicalities and conflicting generalities, I suggest that you ask your Senators two basic questions. You will be amazed by the extent to which the answers will cut through to the bottom line, not only for yourself, but also for your Senators as they approach their own moment of truth in making one of the most crucial decisions in our country's life.

title: Martins Preview to Open City Ballet's 71st Season
description: The opening of the 71st season of the New York City Ballet will be marked Nov. 11 with a gala featuring a preview of Peter Martins's new ballet Giardino di Scarlatti.

title: Center for Victims Eases the Pain a Bit
description: The young woman, trimly dressed in blazer and slacks, was outwardly collected as she told of having been sexually molested by a man she had never seen before. But she was nervous and uncertain about what was in store for her.

title: CocaCola to Alter Dr Pepper Cap Game
description: The New York State Attorney General has accused the CocaCola Bottling Company of New York of running an illegal lottery in its Dr Pepper cash caps game.

title: Borg Defeats McEnroe in Final
description: TORONTO, Aug. 20 (UPI)  Bjorn Borg, mastering the serve of John McEnroe, scored a 63, 63 victory today to win the $210,000 Canadian open tennis tournament.

title: Cosmos Carlos Alberto Will Play Against Tulsa
description: The Cosmos were relieved to learn yesterday that Carlos Alberto would probably be able to play against the Tulsa Roughnecks in the next round of the North American Soccer League playoffs.

title: Stocks Push Ahead
description: Stock prices forged ahead yesterday to their highest level in 10 months on the Dow Jones industrial average and the highest closing in six and a half years as measured by the composite index of all common issues on the New York Stock Exchange. Takeover situa

title: Promotion Time For Interpublic
description: A batch of management promotions at the Interpublic Group of Companies and its biggest operating unit, McCannErickson Worldwide, were announced yesterday by Interpublic.

title: OPEC Is Dismissed From Suit
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 20  United States District Court Judge A. Andrew Hauk today dismissed the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries from a suit charging the oil cartel and its 13 member nations with violation of United States antitrust law. The action came as hearings opened here on the case, which was brought by the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers.

title: William P. Chafee, an Architect On Roosevelt Island Projects, 48
description: William P. Chatee, a 48yearold architect who designed much of the development on Roosevelt Island in New York City, was killed in a singlecar accident Friday, en route from Evergreen, Colo., to his home in Denver.

title: EARNINGS
description: The Harris Corporation, international producer of communications and informationprocessing equipment, reported yesterday that profits had increased 22.6 percent for the quarter ended June 30 and 21 percent for the full fiscal year. In reporting the results, Joseph A. Boyd, chairman, said that new orders during the year exceeded $1.1 billion, resulting in a record backlog of $700 million, up from $600 million a year earlier.

title: Moroccan King Hints of Talks With Algeria on War
description: FEZ, Morocco, Aug. 20 (Reuters) King Hassan II of Morocco said last night that there was still a chance of discussions with Algeria over a fouryear war against Algeriabacked guerrillas in the Western Sahara.

title: Hamburgers Hope to Share Legal Status With Fire Island Cookies
description: OCEAN BEACH, Fire Island Cookies have been declared legal here, as have ice cream cones, but the jury Is still out, so to speak, on pizza, hot dogs and hamburgers.

title: Kenneth Lamott, West Coast Literary Figure, Dies
description: Kenneth Lamott, a writer and West Coast literary figure, died of cancer Saturday at his home in Bolinas, Calif. He was 56 years old.

title: Dance: Pearl Primus Presents Earth Theater
description: THE Perry Street Theater became Earth Theater on Sunday afternoon. Earth Theater was the name that Pearl Primus and Percival Borde gave to their concert of African, Caribbean and AfroAmerican dances, and a wellchosen name it was, for Earth Theater ter choreographically proclaimed that the earth is our home, the place where we live and die, love and work, mourn and rejoice.

title: 2 Bright Bolshoi Lights Discuss Rise to Stardom
description: ON Saturday night, the curtain calls had gone on and on excitedly after Romeo and Juliet, bouquets sailing through the air and audiences cheering Slava and Nadia, as Vyacheslav Gordeyev and Nadezhda Pavlova have come to be known during this Bolshoi Ballet season at the New York State Theater. Sunday morning, however, it was back to class as usual, as the two stars, who have been husband and wife for nearly four years, worked through an intensive private coaching session. It continues, Mr. Gordeyev said simply.

title: A Foul River, a Helpless Imperial Valley
description: CALEXICO, Calif., Aug. 19  You can smell the New River long before you reach its banks, and it is not a pleasant smell. As it oozes through California's lush Imperial Valley on its way to the inland Salton Sea, the river carries with it tons of human waste, the discharge of string of slaughterhouses, dead dogs and cats, an occasional human body and wide range of communicable diseases.

title: Thermostat Controls Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  About 53,000 thermostatic control devices for homes are being recalled because of a possible fire hazard, the Consumer Product Safety Commission said today. The commission said that the recall affects heating units of a device called Temperature Tender made by Intermatic Inc., of Spring Grove, Ill., a manufacturer and supplier of electrical products. The recall affects models FS100 and FS1 Temperature Tender heating units.

title: Hey, Gtcher Savwor Fare Red Hot!
description: Running universities is becoming harder every year.

title: U.S. Women Swimmers Are Stronger Than Ever
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Aug. 20  The Amateur Athletic Union's national longcourse championship meet was the most significant swimming competition in the world this year. But in 31 events over four days of swimming by more than NO men ano women, only two world and six American records were broken, all by women.

title: Yankees Rout Royals To Open Long Trip, 174
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 20  The New York Yankees made things so easy for Luis Tiant in Royals Stadium tonight that Tiant had to work only five innings to pick up his 10th victory of the season.

title: City Aide Urges More Jobs for Artists
description: To lessen the impact of scheduled layoffs, artists working on CETAfinanced projects and their employers have to find, a city Commissioner said yesterday, creative and imaginative ways to put unemployed artists to work.

title: China Seeks Loans
description: TOKYO, Aug. 20 (AP)  China is asking Japan for Government loans totaling more than $5.2 billion eo help modernize its hydroelectric power plants and railways, the newspaper Niainichi reported today. The newspaper said that China wanted to obtain loans with an annual interest rate of about 2 percent for repayment in 20 to 30 years. Details will be discussed when Gu Mu, a Chinese Deputy Prime Minister, visits Japan Sept. 1

title: 2dLargest Grain Harvest
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (Reuters) R'orld grain production this year will total an estimated 1.38 billion metric tons, the secondlargest crop in history, a Government report predicted today.

title: EventsToday
description: FILMMOBILE, Fort Four Park, Sedwick and Reservoir Avenues, the Bronx, after dark.

title: Concert: Youth Symphony
description: THE Youth Symphony of the United States wound up its first 10city transcontinental tour this last week with four concerts in New York City, the final one of which took place Sunday night in Avery Fisher Hall. Under the direction of its musical director, Manuel Prestamo, the orchestra presented a trio of Russian showpieces, Tchaikovsky's Romeo and Juliet Overture, RimskyKorsakov's Capriccio Espagnol and Mussorgsky's Pictures at an Exhibition.

title: G.E. Move May Help Cox Merger
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 20 (AP)  The General Electric Company, in a deal that removes a major obstacle in a proposed merger with Cox Broadcasting Corporation, has agreed to hire more minority employees and to produce primetime minority affairs programming at WSBTV in Atlanta.

title: BMW Mororrad G.m.b.H. To Martin Surtevant
description: BMW Motorrad G.m.b.H. has awarded its North American motorcycle account to Martin, Sturtevant, Silverman & Marshall. The West German manufacturer interviewed 17 agencies for the $650,000 account, and three finalists took the trouble to fly over to Munich to submit presentations. Gaynor & Ducas and RMI Inc. were the other two travelers. The account had been with Wilson, Haight & Welch for four years.

title: Addenda
description: Success Unlimted magazine, currently a digestsize monthly, to go to an 8by11 inch, or Time magazine size, effective with the October issue.

title: Key Topic in Vietnam: Likelihood of Chinese Attack
description: HANOI, Vietnam, Aug. 17  The expectation of renewed attack from China is a common theme in conversations here both with high officials and with the Vietnamese public.

title: Yankees Rout Royals
description: Jim Spencer hit two home runs and Bobby Murcer had one as the Yankees pounded the Kansas City Royals, 179, last night. Details on page C17.

title: Catching Up With Puerto Rico
description: Mainland Americans are only belatedly beginning to sense the political ferment in Puerto Rico. Until a few years ago, the island's commonwealth status seemed to be the ideal middle ground between statehood and independence and few Puerto Ricans regarded it as colonialism. But now, the middle ground has turned into a morass. The early economic promise of commonwealth status has gone sour; the jobless rate is at least 20 per cent. Even the Puerto Rican bar association, in a change of position, has come out for a United Nations inquiry into charges of colonialism. As never before, Puerto Ricans are divided about what to do  and whichever course they follow will present difficulties that Americans only dimly perceive.

title: Around the Nation
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Aug. 20 (AP)  The judge in the murder trial of Dr. Jeffrey MacDonald severely limited testimony today on statements by a key defense witness, calling her a tragic figure who lacked credibility.

title: Books: Adventurous Life Of Eddie Rickenbacker
description: LIKE a modern astronaut, Eddie Rickenbacker should have been regarded as the epitome of the American hero: dashing, a mechanical wonder on the ground and an adventurer in the air, and an inspiration for American youth. Up to a point, he was all of these things. That point

title: U.S. Officials Fearful For an American Held At a Salvadoran Plant
description: SAN SALVADOR, Aug. 20 (AP) United States Embassy officials expressed apprehension today about the health of William Boorstein, an American executive held with a handful of workers in a textile factory by union members.

title: Dams in the Data Stream
description: WASHINGTON  The developed nations face yet another challenge in choosing between protectionism and free trade in international information exchanges. Privacy and dataprotection laws, taxes on information, and increased tariffs and restrictions on telecommunications facilities are emerging in Europe, Canada and Japan; more direct control of international information flows everywhere appears likely as tensions rise over trade, unemployment and inflation.

title: OBSERVER
description: Copying machines are revolutionizing the way we live. With recording tape plugged into the radio, a person can now create a private musical library far more cheaply than by buying records. With print duplicators, a fetching piece of writing can be quickly reproduced and circulated among hundreds of acquaintances without the expense of paying the writer for his labor.

title: Casinos Lift Playboy Profit
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 20 (Reuters) Playboy Enterprises Inc. reported sharply higher profits today for its fiscal fourth quarter and full year, mainly because of improved results at its five gambling casinos. Profits in the fourth quarter, ended June 30, totaled $939,000, up from $97,000 a year earlier, while fiscal year profits rose to $9.1 million from $6.3 million. Playboy said the higher profits were partly offset by expenses for the restructuring of its bookpublishing business.

title: EDUCATION
description: I'M gonna be showing you some pictures. Some about kids and some about other things. After I show a picture, I'm gonna ask you some questions about it. Ain't no right or wrong answers  just say what you want.

title: Slaying Suspect Is Ordered Held In Prison Ward
description: The man accused of killing a New York City police officer and wounding a detective during a shootout after a bank robbery on Friday was ordered held in maximum security in the Bellevue Hospital prison ward yesterday.

title: News Summary
description: International

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Crimes Alleged At Priest's Trial Tied to 2d Man
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 20 (UPI) The attorney for a 39yearold Pennsylvania man testified today that his client was involved in the alleged gentleman bandit robberies and that a Roman Catholic priest had been wrongly charged with the crimes.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: After the sharp increases in rates last week, the shortterm credit markets were relatively steady yesterday. But dealers were not confident that the stability would continue for a prolongued period of time and some predicted further tightening of credit by the Federal Reserve System.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: International

title: Money
description: MONDAY, AUGUST 20, 1979

title: New Regulations On Nitrite Labeling
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Nitritefree hot dogs can be legally labeled hot dogs instead of uncured cooked sausage under a new Agriculture Department regulation announced today.

title: Ralston Cat Dinners Shifted to Tatham, Laird
description: Ralston Purina has assigned its Special Dinners Cat Food brand to TathamLaird & Kudner, after handling it at its inhouse Checkerboard Advertising agency. T.L.K., which already has a number of assignments in Ralstons Human Foods and Pet Foods Divisions, will also get several new pet food products from Ralston.

title: Canadian League Fines 6 For Dress Code Violations
description: TORONTO, Aug. 20 (CP)  The Canadian Football League continued its crackdown today on sloppy uniforms worn in games. Commissioner Jake Gaudaur levied $100 fines against six players who had not conformed to the regulations.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Coalition Offers Energy Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  A group of consumer and labor leaders called today for creation of a Governmentowned corporation to produce and develop energy resources found on public land.

title: STRAUSS IS REPORTED SET TO ASK CARTER WHO DIRECTS POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  Robert S. Strauss, President Carter's special Middle East envoy, returned home today from meetings with Israeli and Egyptian leaders, reportedly seeking clarification on who is in charge of America's Middle East policy. Mr. Strauss acknowledged that the results of his mission to Israel and Egypt were not good.

title: Fluor Resuming Iran Construction
description: The Fluor Corporation yesterday announced the resumption of construction of a petroleum refinery near Isfahan, Iran, that is being built by a Fluor subsidiary and Thyssen Rheinstahl Technik G.m.b.H. of West Germany. Work on the retinery was interrupted early this year by the Iranian revolution.

title: No Title
description: ALFRED KAY

title: THE DOCTOR'S WORLD
description: AS an intern in San Francisco I treated a business executive, a member of a prominent West Coast family, who went to surgery for repair of a hip that he broke in a fall. Although he denied drinking more than an occasional cocktail, my suspicion  based on limited experience as a medical student at Boston City Hospital where alcoholism was a commonly treated problem  was that he was an alcoholic with impending delirium tremens, or the D.T.'s. It was something about his manner, perhaps the way he answered questions. My suggestion to the orthopedic surgeon in charge was that the man be treated for this potentially lifethreatening condition.

title: Tip About Young's Meeting Laid to Sources in Mideast
description: United States intelligence sources in the Middle East learned that Andrew Young might meet with a representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization last month and reported that information to the State Department four days after the, meeting took place, a senior American intelligence official said yesterday.

title: Man, 29, Fatally Beaten On Street in Jersey City
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 20 (UPI)  The body of a Jersey City man who had apparently been beaten to death was found early today on a street here.

title: 22 Newspapers Forced to Close By Iran Regime
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 20Iran's religious leaders shut down 22 opposition newspapers today and ordered political organizations that oppose Islamic rule to surrender their weapons.

title: Scientists See Peril In Wasting Helium
description: HELIUM, as commonplace as the gas filled children's balloons sold at the zoo, is under intense new scrutiny because of a warning by scientists that wasting it will imperil the world's technological future. The warning has compelled Government policy

title: C.I.A. Chief Drawn Into Young Dispute
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  The State Department invoked the highest intelligence authority in the Government today to support its statement that by July 30 it did not have an account of Andrew Young's unauthorized meeting with a representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: REPORT PATES HALF OF CITY ROADS DIRTY
description: Half of New York City's streets are officially rated as dirty, and none of the 58 sanitation districts in the five boroughs has been made significantly cleaner in the past year, Mayor Koch reported yesterday.

title: People
description: Nathaniel C. Doughty and Joseph M. Harte elected senior vice presidents of N.W. Ayer, New York.

title: Letters: On Andrew Young
description: To the Editor:

title: Troubled Ohio Housing Complex Turns to Carter for Aid
description: LINCOLN HEIGHTS, Ohio, Aug. 19 Did we hear from President Carter yet? Elmer Williams asked a visitor yesterday afternoon. Do you think he will intercede?

title: For a Caribbean Poet, Inner Tension and Foreign Support
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad  It is one of those hotels in which at night even an unreflective traveler would think of death. Its bare bulbs and damp rooms are enough to send one howling for the solace of its narrow and empty bar, decorated with the signatures of the Guyanese cricket team and those who attended the 1979 Oil Spill Pollution Control Workshop.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  The Civil Aeronautics Board suggested today that Alaska Airlines might have violated Federal regulations by purchasing 21 to 30 percent of the stock of its main competitor in Alaska, Wien Air Alaska, without seeking board approval.

title: Bridge:
description: The format of Swiss Team events, in which squads with similar scores are matched against each other, tends to produce exciting finishes: sometimes as many as six teams are in contention going into the final round.

title: At Least 44 Are Reported Dead In a Pileup of Vehicles in Kenya
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 20 (UPI)  At least 44 people were killed in Kenya's Great Rift Valley in a vehicle pileup involving a bus returning from a wedding party and several trucks, it was reported today.

title: A Suffolk Board Challenges State Over 2 Diplomas
description: The Board of Education of a Suffolk County school district has challenged New York State's policy on competency testing by granting highschool diplomas to two handicapped students. It said it believed the students deserved the diplomas even though they did not pass the required tests in reading, writing and mathematics.

title: Q & A
description: Q. Why do fluorescent Lights hum?

title: Miss Nyad at Last Swims From Bahamas to Florida
description: JUNO BEACH, Fla., Aug. 20 (AP) Diana Nyad, who sobbed when she was forced to quit two earlier longdistance swims, grinned triumphantly today as she waded ashore here, the first person to beat currents, sharks and jellyfish in a 60mile swim from the Bahamas to Florida.

title: Divers Find Artifacts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20 (AP) Divers have discovered three more artifacts  a pepper shaker, a soap dish and a brass hinge  in the wreckage of the Civil War ironclad Monitor, lying submerged 220 feet deep off Cape Hatteras, N.C., expedition officials reported here.

title: Big Board's Seat Prices on Rise Again
description: One of the most profitable investments this year has been a seat on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Science Watch
description: The antianxiety drug diazepam, sold under the trade name Valium, is the most commonly prescribed of all medications, and some reports have linked it to abuse and to deaths. The authors of a new study, reported in the Journal of the American Medical Associaton, have judged its role in fatal cases to be minimal.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY TransAtlantic

title: Profit Up At Grand Union
description: The Grand Union Company, operating some 840 units, reported a net income of $9 million in the 16 weeks ended July 21, almost triple the $3.3 million earned in the corresponding first fiscal quarter last year. Sales for the company rose 79.2 percent to $937.4 million from $523.2 million in the quarter a year ago.

title: Resisting S.E.C., TexasStyle
description: FORT WORTH, Tex.  Even by Texas standards, the 0KC Corporation is not a typical oil company. The characters and events in its recent history include Cloyce Box, a former end for the Detroit Lions football team and now an oilbaron millionaire; his twin

title: Hundreds Gather in New Protest Over Filming of Movie Cruising
description: Several hundred noisy demonstrators gathered in Greenwich Village last night in a renewed attempt to disrupt the filming of Cruising, a movie protesters says portrays homosexuals in an unflattering light.

title: Gilliam, Former Steeler, Found Beaten in Baltimore
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 20 (AP)  Joe Gilliam, the former Pittsburgh Steelers quarterback who is now playing for the semipro Baltimore Eagles, was found beaten on the head tonight on Baltimores west side.

title: Vietnamese Refugees Cheered in Venice
description: Refugees waved at thousands of Italian citizens who were lined up along the shore yesterday as three vessels, the Vittorio Veneto, the Andrea Doria and the Stromboli, part of the fleet sent to rescue 896 boat people, sailed up the Grand Canal in Venice. A redcarpet celebration marked the end of a sixweek voyage from the South China Sea. The three ships picked up 196 people adrift and then collected another 700 from Malaysian refugee camps. At left, Nguyen Cao Minh, the eldest son of Nguyen Cao Ky, the former Vice President of South Vietnam, aboard the Vittorio Veneto said, I want to shake hands with many Italians. They rescued me and offered me liberty and I will never forget that. Many of the refugees said they did not intend to stay in Italy, but would join relatives in other countries.

title: Civil Rights Leader Backs Cause Of P.L.O. After Meeting at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 20 The president of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference met here today with representatives of the Palestine Liberation Organization and said afterward that his group unconditionally supports the human rights of all Palestinians, including the right of selfdetermination in regard to their own homeland.

title: Kyle R. Morris,. Painter And Art Historian, 61
description: Kyle R. Morris, a painter, art instructor and art historian, died Friday in Southampton (L.I.) Hospital after emergency surgery for an aneurysm. He was 61 years old. He lived in East Hampton, L.I., and maintained a studio on Mercer Street in SoHo and a home in Manhattan on East 17th Street.

title: Pan Am Settles C.A.B. Charges
description: Pan American World Airways agreed yesterday to a compromise civil penalty payment of $17,500 levied in settlement of charges by the Civil Aeronautics Board that the airline had engaged in unfair and deceptive advertising of a $99 New YorkLos Angeles roundtrip fare last January.

title: General Mills Plans Rise in Spending
description: General Mills Inc., the diversified foodproducts company, said in its annual report that it planned capital spending of between $185 million and $190 million in its 1980 fiscal year ending next May. The company said that it spent $154 million in the preceding year.

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: When a revolution begins, control of the legal government is invariably a liability. As the revolution advances, true power inexorably passes to a shadow rival that is better organized and obeyed. The very process of revolution tests, hardens and selects a radical leadership that can outmatch  and outpromise  any moderate interim regime.

title: Mrs. Stuart Registers Net Upset
description: MAHWAH, N.J., Aug. 20  Bettyann Stuart of Newport Beach, Calif., ended Pam Shriver's hope of getting a good tuneup for the United States Open by beating the 17yearold rookie pro in the first round of the $75,000 Volvo Cup tennis tournament at Ramapo College today.

title: Arthur Imerman Dies; Garment Manufacturer
description: Arthur Imerman, a garment manufacturer and the former president of the National Democratic Club, died Sunday in the John F. Kennedy Hospital, Palm Beach, Fla. He was 84 years old and lived in Palm Beach.

title: Corporate Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchenge,(A) the American Stock Exchange and (O) overthecounter.ACME ELECTRIC (O)

title: Prolonged Court Fight Looms As G.&W. Halts S.E.C. Talks
description: The prolonged battle between Gulf and Western Industries and the Securities and Exchange Commission seemed to be headed for a possibly long court fight yesterday after the company's announcement that its directors had voted to terminate settlement discussions with the commission.

title: MANHATTAN TELLER SLAIN BY A ROBBER
description: A 23yearold teller on the job for less than five months was shot to death  apparently without warning or provocation  in a bank in lower Manhattan yesterday by a jittery holdup man wearing a Halloween mask. It was one of five bank robberies in Manhattan in little more than an hour yesterday.

title: OilSpill Fighters Off TexasFace 5 Weeks of Suspense
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., Aug. 20 Five weeks of suspense lie ahead for the Federal force of 200 persons trying to cope with the recordsize oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. Ever since June 3, when a Mexican oil well blew out, winds from the southeast have been tending to drive the oil from the Bay of Campeche on to beaches in Texas.

title: Joe Niekro Posts 17th Triumph As Astros Trounce Mets by 84
description: Joe Niekro had his knuckleball working in top form last night as he became the National League's first 17game winner by turning back the New York Mets, 81, on two hits.

title: Notes on People
description: Janet Auchincloss is getting married again, but she won't say when or where. Mrs. Auchincloss, the mother of Jacqueline Onassis and Lee Radziwill, said in Newport, R.I., that she intended to marry a very close childhood friend, Bingham Morris, a widower who lives in Southampton, L.I. He is a retired investment banker.

title: Sun Extends Offer
description: RADNOR, Pa., Aug. 20 (Reuters) The Sun Company said today that it had received 42 percent of the outstanding stock of the Carboline Company under its tender offer and had extended the offer until Aug. 31. The $30.75ashare offer had been scheduled to expire last Saturday.

title: Reliance Asserts Exxon Cannot Withdraw Offer
description: In an unexpected development, the Reliance Electric Company yesterday challenged the right of the Exxon Corporation to withdraw its contested offer to buy Reliance for $1.17 billion in cash.

title: GovernmentSale Reporting Widened
description: Companies that derive 10 percent or more of their total sales from business with government entities will have to disclose that fact in their annual reports, the Financial Accounting Standards Board said yesterday.

title: $500,000 in Coins and Stamps Are Lost to Cab Driver in Boston
description: BOSTON, Aug. 20 (AP)  Three Philadelphia men leaving a Boston stamp and coin show hailed a cab for the airport, handed their bags to the driver and then watched the cab take off with $500,000 worth of rare stamps and coins, the police said.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Fleeing South Africa
description: The pernicious effects of South African racial oppression are beginning to touch Americans in a fresh way. Unwilling to serve in the South African Defense Force and to become tools of the enforcement of apartheid, a growing number of young white South Mricans are fleeing their homeland and seeking refuge in the United States.

title: Cayuga Indians Reach Accord in Land Claim On Finger Lakes Area
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 20  The Department of Interior today announced a provisional agreement with the Cayuga Nation on the Indian tribe's claim to 64,000 acres in New York's Finger Lakes district. The agreement, which is subject to Congressional approval, is the first major negotiated Indian land settlement in the country.

title: Dr. Henry M. Magrid; Philosophy Professor, Author and Lecturer
description: Dr. Henry M. Magrid, an author, tele vision lecturer and professor emeritus of philosophy at the City College of New York, died Saturday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived in Tappan, N.Y.

title: MixedRace Adoption s Meet New Barriers
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 20  The unsuccessful struggle of a white Connecticut family to adopt a 5monthold black child they had raised almost from birth has highlighted what many adoption experts say is a dramatic change in adoption patterns across the country in the last five years.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Copper led a broad decline in prices of metals futures yesterday in what brokers described as lackluster trading. The copper market on New York's Commodity Exchange opened with some carryover buying from last week's advance of about 4 cents pound. But when new buying failed to materialize, profit taking developed.

title: Mother and Son, 6, Found Slain In Their South Bronx Apartment
description: The bodies of a 23yearold woman and her 6yearold son were found last night in their South Bronx apartment in what the police are describing as a double homicide. Both were face down on their beds and had apparently been suffocated, according to the police.

title: U.S. Eases Tax Laws for Steel In Bid to Encourage Investment
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 20 (AP)  The Federal Government has moved to encourage investments in the steel industry, but the change in tax laws is less than the steel industry was seeking.

title: Dividends
description: xpayable In Canadian funds.

title: Britain's Trade Balance Exactly Even in July
description: LONDON, Aug. 20 (AP)  Follcwing a revised June deficit of 300 million pounds, or about $665.6 million, Britain's visible trade was in absolute balance in July on a seasonally adjusted basis, Britain's Department of Trade said today. Britain recorded a visible trade deficit of about $332.8 million in July 1978, the department said. Conversions into dollars are at current exchange rates.

title: U.S. Air Force to Tighten Rules After Two Jets Crash in Germany
description: BONN, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  The United States Air Force plans to adopt stricter flying regulations in West Germany after two jet fighters crashed last week, the West German Defense Ministry said today.

title: Canadian Mideast Envoy Is Due To Visit the Region Next Month
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  Canada's special Middle East envoy, Robert Stanfield, hopes to begin a tour of Middle East countries in the middle of next month, his aides said today.

title: BASF Confirms Bid for Cook Paint
description: The West German chemical group, BASF A.G., confirmed that its United States subsidiary was seeking to acquire the Cook Paint and Varnish Company, a Kansas City maker of automobile lacquer and other paint products.

title: Dolores Wilson Playing Miss Hannigan in Annie
description: Beginning tonight, Dolores Wilson will play the role of Miss Hannigan in the Broadway musical Annie at the Alvin Theater.

title: Bethlehem Steel Is Lifting Prices 1.5%
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation, the nation's secondlargest steel company after the United States Steel Corporation, announced late yesterday that it was raising prices for structural shapes, piling, carbon plates and rod and wire, effective Oct. 1. When aver aged over the company's total product line, the increase comes to 1.5 percent.

title: Single Parents Try Out the Shared Life
description: MILL VALLEY, Calif.  At the picturesque restaurants and tiny shops of this affluent suburban community north of San Francisco, a popular topic of conversation is the challenge divorced parents face in raising children alone.

title: Market Place
description: SHARES of healthcare companies have been bouyant for weeks, and this may suggest that the shares are ready for a relapse. But leading analysts argue that investor interest will persist because these companies tend to do well in poor as well as good economic environments.

title: Steel Output Down in Week
description: Steel production fell to 2.562 million tons in the week ended Aug. 18, a decrease of fivetenths of 1 percent from the preceding week's 2.574 million tons, the American Iron and Steel Institutc reported yesterday.

title: Soviet Jews Find Old Woes, New Joys in New World
description: On 108th Street in Forest Hills, Queens, the Red Apple is no chain supermarket but a ruggedindividualist little grocery, decorated with Russiancostumed dolls. It sells Russiancanned salmon and sturgeon soup and tickets to Russian movies screened regularly at the nearby Continental Theater. Monya Popovitser, a Soviet Jew who owns the Red Apple with his wife, Ida, immigrated in 1971. He worked as a leather cutter here, as he had in the Ukraine, and opened the store five years later.

title: The Region
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I.  The final witness in the grandlarceny and extortion trial of a former Smithtown Republican leader, Nicholas Barbato, said yesterday that a former insurance agent whose testimony led to Mr. Barbato's indictment never mentioned being afraid of economic reprisals.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Fred R. Katter has spent his whole career selling hightechnology products, and, as he puts it, I'm pretty comfortable in technology. Now he is involved in a relatively new area that proponents believe could achieve a significant niche in electronic data processing.

title: Hammond May Miss Season; Jets to Start Blinka
description: Bobby Hammond, the boy from Bayside, Queens, who grew up to be the leading runner on his hometown professional football team, was placed on the injuredreserve list yesterday, meaning he had virtually no chance of playing for the Giants this year.

title: Chronicle of a U.F.O. Sighting: Investigation Leading Nowhere
description: IN 1975, Dr. Peter A. Sturrock, professor of space science and astrophysics at Stanford University, circulated a questionnaire to 2,611 astronomers asking them their sources of information on unidentified flying objects and whether they believed the subject deserves serious scientific study.

title: Don't Look Back, Boys
description: The Houston Astros, who may be the biggest surprise of the baseball season, checked into New York yesterday in full flight. So this would be a good time for them to remember Satchel Paige's words of wisdom: Don't look back, somebody might be gaining on you. Somebody is gaining on them, namely the Cincinnati Reds. Without Sparky Anderson, without Pete Rose and with six weeks to go in the pennant races, the Reds stand within a stride or two of catching the Astros in the National League's Western Division. In a

title: New Bond Issues
description: UTILITY BONDS

title: Books of The Times
description: DISTURBING THE UNIVERSE By Freeman Dyson 283 pages Harper & Row $12.25

title: Rookie Linebacker Is No Stereotype
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 20  Who is Stan Blinka and why is he starting at middle linebacker for the Jets in their final preseason game against the Giants on Saturday night in the Meadowlands?

title: Fay Kanin, Academy mead, on Film vs. TV
description: FAY KANIN has been waving the flag. Mrs. Kanin, the effervescent new president of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and an Emmy Awardwinning screenwriter and producer, was passing through New York the other day og her way back from Belgium, where she lectured before Belgian film makers. While there, she showed Friendly Fire, her moving, harrowing, threehour television movie about the truelife story of a patriotic Iowa farm couple who became transformed into radical activists against the Vietnam War after their son had been killed by United States artillery fire.

title: Psychiatric Care At Kings County Is Disaccredited
description: Adult psychiatric services at Kings County Hospital Center have been disaccredited again because of overcrowding and inadequate patient care.

title: WARD GIVES UP POST AS A DEPUTY MAYOR; WON'T GIVE REASONS
description: Haskell Ward, Deputy Mayor for Human Services and the highestranking black in the Koch administration, resigned yesterday.

title: Novel 'scruples Coming To TV as MultiPart Film
description: Scruples, a novel by Judith Krantz about the world of fashion and the affluent, is being turned into a multipart television movie to be presented on CBSTV next February.

title: Black Group, in Meeting P.L.O.
description: With the meeting yesterday between an American black religious leader and representatives of the Palestine Liberation Organization, the Southern Christian Leadership Conference has taken another controversial step into a political area outside its traditional civil rights concerns.

title: Home Sales Profit Near Pennsylvania Nuclear Plant
description: HARRISBURG, Aug. 20 (AP)  Some homeowners are still uneasy about having the Three Mile Island cooling towers visible from their yards. But the worst accident in United States commercial nuclear power apparently did not depress real estate values in the area.

title: Lillian Placek, 56, of Newsweek; Was Senior Reference Librarian
description: Lillian Placek, senior reference librarian for Newsweek magazine, died of cancer Sunday at Riverview Hospital, in Red Bank, N.J. She was 56 years old and lived in Little Silver, N.J.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Rhodesian Guerrilla Leaders to Attend London Talks
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Aug. 20 (Reuters)  Guerrilla leaders whose  forces have been fighting to topple the Zimbabwe Rhodesian Government of Prime Minister Abel T. Muzorewa announced here tonight that they would attend a urltisnsponsored peace conference in London next month. But they rejected a British appeal for a ceasefire during the talks.

title: Pacific Telephone Files X341 Million Refund Plan
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 20The Pacific Telephone and Telegraph Company today filed a plan for refunding $341 million to its customers and reducine rates by $80 million a year.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Braniff International, the Dallasbased airline, has appointed James B. Lawrence vice presidentPacific and Asia.

title: Tower for St. Vincent's Approved
description: The New York City Planning Commission yesterday approved a proposal by St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center to replace two of its buildings with a 16story tower.

title: Pompeii Dead 1,900 Years, but Vesuvius Lives
description: IT was just after one o'clock on sunny August afternoon in the bustling resort city of Pompeii when residents and tourists noticed the strange cloud that seemed to be rising out of the nearby mountain named Vesuvius. Oh, there had been earthquakes in the past few days, but they were common enough in the area. No one realized it was the last day of Pompeii.

title: MISSISSIPPI CASTING SPELL ON PRESIDENT
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 20The tranquil vistas of the upper Mississippi River appear to have cast their spell upon President Carter since he began a sevenday trip from St. Paul to St. Louis last Saturday.

title: The City
description: A nationwide alarm was issued for Lawrence Hecker, a 36yearold Queens man, who may have stolen as much as $10 million from 60 or more unsuspecting investcrs who were led to believe they could reap windfall profits from a generic drug business that may never have existed.

title: Advertising
description: BRACE yourself, Scotch drinkers. The Scotchdrinking capital of he world is getting a new taste.

title: A Letter in Sindona's Handwriting Says Captors Do Not Seek Ransom
description: A letter in the handwriting of Michele Sindona, the missing Italian financier, says that his captors are not asking for a ransom.

title: Comer and Rangers Conquer Orioles, 21
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 21 (AP)  Steve Corner, with lateinning relief from Jim Kern, continued his mastery over the Baltimore Orioles while pitching the Texas Rangers to a 21 victory tonight. Home runs by Buddy Bell and Richie Zisk accounted for the Rangers runs.

title: Robert E. Schuler Is Dead at 57; Scholastic Magazines Executive
description: Robert E. Schuler, advertising director of CoEd and Forecast for Home Economics magazines, died Sunday at Central General Hospital in Plainview, L.I., after a short illness. He was 57 years old and lived in Wantagh, L.I.

title: Moscow Ousts Canadian Lawyer Who Tried to Aid Shcharansky
description: LONDON, Aug. 21  Irwin Cotler, a Canadian law professor seeking to help Anatoly B. Shcharansky, said here today that Soviet authorities had told him he had five minutes to pack your bags and leave the Soviet Union on Sunday and had then put him aboard a Japanese airliner bound for London.

title: The Caesar's Restaurant Recipe
description: The waiter at Caesar's Restaurant was induced to part with the house recipe for Caesar Salad, which the restaurant has conveniently printed on the back of its business cards. With all due respect, the use a highquality olive oil is suggested.

title: New Yorkers,etc.
description: THERE is a retired American diplomat, living in Portugal, who always looks forward to the visit of American friends. He enjoys the camaraderie and the firsthand news and gossip, but what he really enjoys the most is the Hellmann's mayonnaise they clutch as they ring his doorbell. His friends know that heading for the Algarve without Bill's mayo would be like heading for the Arctic without a parka. Foolhardy.

title: McGuire Sets Up 2 Units to Help Fight Surge of Holdups in the City
description: Ten more banks in New York City were hit by holdup men yesterday and Police Commissioner Robert J. McGuire announced the formation of two bankrobbery units to stem the continuing surge in such crimes.

title: Elderly Couple Found Murdered and Robbed In Flatbush Building
description: An elderly couple were found stabbed to death yesterday in their fourthfloor apartment at 755 Ocean Avenue, in Brooklyn's Flatbush section.

title: Great White Shark Captured
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 21 (UPI) healthy Great White shark was captured near San Francisco today and placed in Steinhart Aquarium in Golden Gate Park. This is the first time that a Great White shark is in such fine shape after being caught, Pam Wing, an aquarium spokesman, said.

title: Deaths
description: ALTERSONBen of Merrick NY. Beloved husband of the late Corinne. Devoted father of Sandy Altenon. Dear uncle and cousin. Funeral secvice will be held at the I.J. Morris Funeral Hans, 46 Greenwtds St., Hempstead on Wednesday, August 22 at 10ern.

title: FreightTrain Ride Ends in Injury
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 21 (AP)  A Norwalk man who had hopped aboard freight train was burned when he came in contact with an overhead line carrying 11,000 volts of electricity. The police said Paul Glenn, 24 years old, was treated Saturday at Stamford Hospital for thirddegree burns in the groin and leg and later released. The police said Mr. Glenn and Donald Stern, 25, of Great Neck, L.I., both Harvard University graduates, had jumped aboard the train in Bridgeport. The police noted the two men apparently had often talked about taking a freighttrain ride. After rushing Mr. Glenn to the hospital, the Conrail police charged both men with criminal trespassing.

title: News of the Theater Bent, a Play That Has to Be Done
description: BENT, a muchtalkedabout play in London in recent months, is on its way to New York. Written by the American playwright Martin Sherman, the play has created a stir because of its explosive subject matterthe horrifying treatment of homosexuals in Nazi concentration camps.

title: Associated Press
description: WORKER DIES IN TEXAS GAS EXPLOSION: Firefighters in Orange, Tex., preparing to hose down homes near burning propane gas pipeline, right, after bulldozer operator accidentally struck the pipe with his vehicle, causing explosion. The operator was killed and a coworker injured.

title: Cigarette Blows Up Oil Pipeline
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, Aug. 21 (AP)  A discarded cigarette butt started a pipeline fire that cut off oil supplies to Zambia, Police InspectorGeneral Philemon Mgaya reported today. He said there was a leak in the pipeline and when the butt ignited the leaking oil, it was like a long fuse which burned until it reached the pipeline and then, wham. He said the fire was controlled yesterday afternoon.

title: Article 6  No Title
description: Article 6  No Title

title: Australian Uranium Plan
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (AP)  Australia has asked a leading Japanese electric power company to join a project to develop uranium in northern Australia, a spokesman for the Kansai Electric Power Company said today. He said that the Australian Government request, made through the Tokyo Government, involved the Ranger uranium development project.

title: Obituary 2 -- No Title
description: PERCIVAL E. FURBER

title: Waters Out for Season
description: DALLAS, Aug. 21 (UPI)  The Dallas Cowboys placed Charlie Waters, the allpro safety who suffered torn knee ligaments in an exhibition game two weeks ago, on the injuredreserve list today. Ile will miss the entire 1979 season.

title: 210,000 Gallons of Crude Oil Spill In Minnesota Field From Pipeline
description: PINEWOOD, Minn., Aug. 21 (AP) 34inch pipeline burst near here yesterday, dumping 210,000 gallons of crude oil onto several acres of brushland, the Minnesota Pollution Control Agency said.

title: Pertec in Accord On Philips Stake
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  The Pertec Computer Corporation announced today an agreement in principle for the North American Philips Corporation to buy a 45 percent stake in Pertec for about $37 million.

title: Editor of Baron Report Is Held on Drug Charge
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP)  Alan Baron, the publisher and editor of the Baron Report, a threeyearold Washington newsletter, has been arrested on a charge of possessing cocaine with the intent to distribute.

title: Israeli at U.N. Meets With Blacks And Criticizes Support of P.L.O.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 21 Israel's chief delegate here met today with officials of the Southern Christian Leadership Conference to discuss the group's new support for the Palestinians and he later criticized the organization, suggesting that diplomatic issues in the Middle East were best left to the countries involved.

title: Farmer and 8 Others Waived
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 21  Ten players were affected today when the New York Jets trimmed their roster to the 50man limit. For one of them, Roger Farmer. it was an old story.

title: Arlen Bids to Satisfy Debt With Realty
description: The financially troubled Arlen Realty and Development Corporation, a New Yorkbased developer and operator of apartments, office buildings and shopping centers, is seeking to exchange certain of its properties for forgiveness of some $140 million in debts under a restructuring plan it is negotiating with its creditors.

title: U.S. to Export Oil to Iran
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (UPI) The Commerce Department said today that United States exporters have been authorized to ship $47 million worth of homeheating oil and kerosene to Iran this month to help overcome a shortage.

title: The Caesar Salad: A Trip to the Source
description: TIJUANA, MEXICO NO, no, I told the taxi driver, this can't be the right place. Wasn't there another Caesar's Restaurant in Tijuana, some great Moorish palace surrounaea by gardens and filled with crystal and linen and waiters who remembered Prohibition, when the swells from Los Angeles used to drive down for a night of drinking and gambling?

title: !Carter on Environment: Difficulties Persist
description: Two years is a short interval on the time scale of environmental progress, a fact strongly reflected in the second environmental message that President Carter has recently transmitted to Congress.

title: Tourist Flood Threatens to Engulf Waikiki
description: HONOLULU  Somewhat in the fashion of ants swarming over a crumb of picnic cake, tourists come in increasing numbers and have engulfed Waikiki, one o' the world's most famous beaches.

title: Economic Scene
description: Leonard Silk is on vacation. Robert Eisner, professor of economics at Northwestern University, is the author of  Factors in Business Investment.

title: ABC Still Holds Lead In Ratings
description: Perhaps foreshadowing what's to come in network television's big battleground this fall the Sunday night half hour beginning at 8 o'clock  ABCN's new hit comedy Mork &; Mindy bested the veteran CBSTV situationcomedy All in the Familyin a headtohead showdown of rerun episodes last week. In the Nielsen audiencepopularity ratings, the ABC entry drew 36 percent of the viewers, compared to 30 percent for the CBS show.

title: Indian President Renews Efforts to Form a Regime
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 21  President N. Sanjiva Reddy conferred with political leaders and constitutional specialists today in an attempt to define his obligations during the Government crisis created by the resignation of Charan Singh as Prime Minister.

title: Associated Press
description: FOUR BOMBS PLANTED IN ISRAELI PARK: Israeli bomb experts crouched as they detonated bomb discovered last night at an amusement park in Tel Aviv. Another bomb was recovered intact, but two others exploded before they were discovered, injuring at least four people. About 20,000 were said to be in park at the time.

title: Jersey Studying End of Controls For Milk Prices
description: TRENTON, Aug. 21  A move by the Byrne administration to abolish milk price controls as an unnecessary, anticonsumer regulation is expected to run into strong opposition from the dairy industry at a public hearing tomorrow. Aides said the Governor, who will preside at the hearing, disapproved of the policy of governmental price fixing.

title: STRAUSS, BRZEZINSKI AND VANCE CONCUR ON MIDEAST COURSE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  President Carter's senior foreign affairs advisers agreed today on a set of Middle East policy recommendations, reportedly including the dropping of plans to sponsor an American resolution on Palestinian rights in the United Nations Security Council.

title: Issue and Debate Should Hospital Barring Abortions Get State Aid?
description: New York Medical College is performing abortions at Metropolitan Hospital Center as part of the medical services it provides at the municipal institution in East Harlem under an affiliation contract with New York City's Health and Hospitals Corporation.

title: Thornburgh Urges a Greater Voice For States on Locations of Reactors
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  Gov. Dick Thornburgh of Pennsylvania said today that state officials and individual citizens must be granted a stronger voice in deciding where nuclear reactors should be located. But he said he was uncertain whether the states should be given a veto. in making such decisions.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS Mystique and Politics
description: LONDON  This has been a year in which ghosts walked: The people of the world were reminded of the power of spiritual forces to alter the material balance of world affairs.

title: United Press International
description: TEXAS BEACHES GET A REST AS OIL CLEANUP CONTINUES: Workers hired by the Coast Guard are shoveling thick loads of oil into piles for bagging on Mustang Island, Tex. A lull in currents has provided a respite from further oil accumulation, allowing more time to prepare spill defenses further north.

title: CONRAIL COMMUTERS COMPLAIN TO M.T.A.
description: ELMSFORD, N.Y., Aug. 21  Angry Conrail commuters turned out in force here last night to warn several Metropolitan Transportation Authority directors about what they said were rapidly deteriorating conditions on the lines serving Westchester County and as far north as Dutchess County.

title: Associated Press
description: SEAVER MATCHES A MARK MADE WITH METS: Tom Seaver pitching for Cincinnati Reds against the Expos last night. His 32 victory gave him 10 consecutive victories, mark he has not equaled since his 1969 season with Mets.

title: West Germany's Auto Output Off 9.4%
description: BONN, Aug. 21 The number of new automobiles registered in West Germany last month fell to 202,044, 6.5 percent lower than in June, while automobile output of 238,400 units in the month was down 9.4 percent from July 1978, the Automobile Industry Association said today.

title: Police Crack Jockey Case
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 21  The West Hartford police have arrested a 27yearold suspect for the theft of a number of lawn statues depicting black jockeys, which were stolen from homes in Hartford's affluent white suburbs.

title: Swiss Arrest a Lebanese In P.L.O. Leader's Death
description: GENEVA, Aug. 21.  A 22yearold Lebanese was arrested here today on suspicion of having assassinated Zuheir Mohsen, chief of military operations of the Palestine Liberation Organization, in France last month.

title: Galletta Beats Odds in Met Open But Bullock Leads on 4Under 68
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 21 When a club professional holes out a lengthy approach, he has made a 2,000to1 shot. But when he does it twice in a single round, he has bucked 4millionto1 odds.

title: Talmadge Earned $300,000 in '78
