description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP)  Senator Herman E. Talmadge has reported that he earned more than $300,000 last year and that his net worth was from $3.5 million to $7.7 million.

title: Advertising
description: HIGH TIMES is coming down to earth. The magazine that celebrated marijuana and the stoned society is reaching out for new readers and trying to broaden its appeal.

title: Obituary 1 -- No Title
description: JAMES A. SCURRY

title: NBC Reported Ousting Its News Chief
description: Top management of the National Broadcasting Company has decided definitely that NBC News needs new leadership and is planning to replace Lester Crystal as president of that division, according to knowledgable sources in the company.

title: Do the Aztecs Have World's Best Coach?
description: No one in the North American Soccer League has argued with the Los Angeles Aztecs for calling Rinus Michels the finest soccer coach in the world.

title: Business Records
description: MARY FRANCES THOMPSON, I Glenwood Ave. Yon kers, N.Y., Llabl I ities. 55,755; assets S2,082.

title: Mobil and Texaco Sue Belridge
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21 The Mobil Oil Corporation and Texaco Inc. filed suit in United States District Court here today to prevent the Bel ridge Oil Company from carrying out a previously announced sale program that could lead to a sale or merger of the concern, which owns 33,000 acres of oil land in California.

title: Fishing Rights Accord Sought
description: SAULTSTE. MARIE, Mich., Aug. 21 (AP)  Ken Frankland, an aide to Gov. William G. Milliken. said today that the state was willing to drop litigation if compromise could be reached with Indian tribes in the dispute over fishing regulations on the northern Great Lakes. The state is appealing a court ruling in May that gave Indian tribes unlimited fishing rights on the northern lakes.

title: CURRENCY MARKETS
description: The dollar was little changed in slow trading yesterday while the price of gold once again passed the $300anounce mark.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: MONG the great culinary blessings of the summer season, particularly, perhaps, for those who are mindful of cooking times, are lobsters. A 1to2pound lobster, sufficient for one (and often for two) servings, steams in about 12 minutes. One says steams. Actually, the lobsters are cooked in a quantity of water with such seasonings as bay leaf, thyme and, if desired, a hot, dried pepper. Many home cooks tend to overcook lobsters, just as they do shrimp, for a half hour or longer.

title: Pioneer 11 Nearing Saturn After Trip of 2 Billion Miles
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  More then six years and two billion miles since it left Earth, the robot explorer spacecraft Pioneer 11 is racing toward a historic rendezvous late this month with Saturn and its famous rings.

title: Good Sam Is Dumped
description: When word got around a year or so ago that Pat O'Brien was being eased out as a vice president of the New York Racing Association, the reaction here was flatout obstinate disbelief. No matter what corporate rolltics might be at work in the oligarchy that operated Belmont, Aqueduct and Saratoga race tracks, no matter what connivers might be tunneling under whom, it simply wasn't conceivable that the N.Y.R.A. could dispense with the services of the one man in the organization who could do and had done every job there was to do on the grounds, and who did it supremely well.

title: Canada Grants Credit to China
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 21 (Reuters) Canada's Governmentrun Export Development Corporation granted China a $2 billion line of credit today to buy Canadian goods. The agreement, signed by the agency's chairman, John MacDonald, and senior officials of the Bank of China, insures that longterm commercial loans will be available to allow Peking to buy Canadian goods and services over the next five years.

title: Estonian Elder Reported Jailed
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 21 (UPI)  A Soviet court in Estonia has sentenced a Pentecostal church elder to two years in prison camp on charges of draft evasion, dissident sources said today. The sources identified him only as Matveyuk. They said his exemption from military service was lifted when he applied for permission to emigrate, and he was arrested when he refused to serve.

title: Joint Satellite Venture
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  The Continental Telephone Corporation said today that it had agreed to establish an equally owned joint venture with Fairchild Industries Inc. to expand the satellite communications business currently conducted by the American Satellite Corporation, a wholly owned Fairchild subsidiary.

title: Chinese Impressed by Display of Huge U.S. Tractors
description: DONGFENG, China, Aug. 17  Men pulling carts puffed and grunted. Mules and horses snorted in front of e wagons piled high with everything from hay to lumber. Bicycles, with bells jingling, weaved in and out, while ancientlooking trucks and tractors lumbered through the jumble.

title: Program to Save Energy and Cut City Costs Begun
description: An energyconservation program that includes reducing the number of city cars in use, centralizing gasoline purchases and keeping close watch on temperatures in city office buildings was announced yesterday by Mayor Koch.

title: At This Clinic, Arts Are the Only Therapy
description: DANIEL is a burly man with timid eyes and selfconscious manner, but give him something to sing, and for a few minutes he powerful and radiant. Eyes close, arms stretch out, face and body strain, and his song emerges strong and clear: For once in my lifetime, I feel like a giant. I soar like an eagle, as though I had wines.

title: Rock: Rockpile Performs
description: IN some ways the principal news interest at Monday's rock concert at the Palladium was the David Johansen Group. But it was the headliners, Rockpile, who made the best music of the night.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: THERE are the good, priniitive soups: meat and bone, vegetables and stock, agitated by heat until they yield their flavors. And then there are the subtle soups  cream of asparagus, for instancesilken and full of nuance.

title: U.S. Inquiry in Killing of Officer
description: The director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons ordered yesterday that a special board of inquiry be convened to look closely into the case of Peter J. Donohue, the Federal prisoner accused of killing a New York City policeman during a shootout after a bank robbery in midtown Manhattan last Friday.

title: News Summary
description: U.S. foreignaffairs officials agreed on Middle East policy recommendations to President Carter that were said to include dropping plans to propose a resolution on Palestinian rights in the U.N. Security Council. The accord appeared to strengthen the role of Robert S. Strauss, the special Middle East envoy, who returned to Washington Monday convinced that such a resolution would interfere with American diplomatic efforts because of strong opposition by Israel and Egypt. [Page Al, Column 6.]

title: Kaiser in Pact for Farbest
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation said yesterday that it had reached a tentative agreement to acquire the Farbest Corporation, a privately held Los Angeles manufacturer of rolling lubricants and other specialty chemicals, for about 350,000 shares of Kaiser common stock.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Broken clouds cover New England and a band of clouds stretchs from the Middle Atlantic States through the Northern Plains States to the northern Rockies. Thunderstorms extend from the upper Mississippi Valley to the Southern Plains States.

title: Iran to Honor Airbus Deal
description: TEHERAN, Aug. 21 (Reuters) The new management of Iran Air, the national airline, has agreed to abide by a commitment it made before the Iranian revolution to buy six European Airbuses, but has canceled the purchase of three of the five Boeing 797's the airline had ordered.

title: State Dept. Refuses to Comment on Young
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  The State Department made known today that it probably had said its last official word about the controversy over Andrew Young's meeting with a representative of the Palestine Liberation Organization and intelligence reports about the incident. uenouncing wnat anonymous people somewhere in the intelligence community may be saying, Thomas Reston, a department spokesman, announced at a briefing for reporters that he could be of no further help about the series of events that caused Mr. Young to resign as United States delegate to the United Nations on Aug. 15.

title: Youth Indicted in Slaying Agent
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Melvin Bay Guyon was indicted yesterday on charges of murdering Johnnie L. Oliver, an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investination. on Aug. 9. The indictment. handed up by a Cuyahoga County grand jury, also accused the I9yearold suspect of attempting to murder Mr. Oliver's partner, William Tenwick, and robbing a store .three weeks before the shooting. Mr. Guyon is being held in jail here on a total bond of $1.3 million.

title: Wine Talk
description: WHAT do Ahlgren Vineyard, Fortino, Estrella River, GundlachBundschu and Freemark Abbey have in common? They were the gold medal winners in the cabernet sauvignon class at the Los Angeles County Fair wine judging in Pomona, Calif. Most California wine enthusiasts have heard of Freemark Abbey, but Ahlgren, Fortino, Estrella River and GundlachBundschu are hardly what you'd call household words.

title: Sports Today
description: Mets vs. Houston Astros, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadows, Queens, 2 P.M. (Television Cablevision, 2 P.M. Radio  WMCA, 2 P.M.)

title: Letters
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION: Your article ['All About Espresso Machines, Aug. 1] was, of course, of great interest as well as, frankly, great concern to me. The reason for my concern was, however, not your poor rating of our espresso machine. This letter would have gone off to you regardless of your opinion.

title: Nicaragua Issues a Bill of Rights; Vows Orderly Process of Justice
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Aug. 21 Nicaragua's new Government announced today a sweeping bill of rights for its citizens, promising them equal rights under the law, an orderly process of justice and, with some limits, the right to free expression.

title: U.N. Panel Drafts Resolution and P.L.O. Assails
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 21  A General Assembly committee reportedly has completed a draft for a Security Council resolution that supports the concept of selfdetermination for Palestinians but does not refer specifically to an independent state.

title: Associated Press
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa, Aug. 21  President Carter today expressed optimism about the nation's economy, saying, I hope that at the end of this year, we will see the inflation rate turning around and start going down again. And then he added, I believe we will see that happen.

title: Whippany Paper Sues Over Billing
description: The Whippany Paper Board Company announced yesterday that it had filed suit in New Jersey Superior Court against two former emolovees and six former suppliers for allegedly conspiring to defraud the company over a period of more than a year by billing it for loads of waste paper purportedly delivered to its Eden Mill facility but in fact never delivered.

title: 11 Are Killed in Shelling 0f 26 Towns in Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 21 (AP)  Israeli and rightist Christian militia gunners shelled 25 villages in southern Lebanon today in the heaviest barrage in years, Lebanese authorities said. Eleven persons were reported killed and more than 20 wounded.

title: Primary Drive for Simon Planned
description: CONCORD, N.H., Aug. 21 (UPI)  A group of Republicans is planning to write in the name of William E. Simon, former Secretary of the Treasury, in New Hampshire's firstinthenation primary next soring. The draftSimon venture is scheduled to begin officially tomorrow when backers of the Independent Campaign to Elect William E. Simon President plan a news conference in Concord.

title: 30 Bags of Money Taken at the Chase Manhattan Headquarters Building
description: Two armed men drove a stolen fish truck into an underground loading area at the Chase Manhattan Bank's headquarters in the financial district yesterday afternoon and sped away minutes later with more than $2 million in cash that had just been placed aboard a Brink's Inc. armored truck.

title: Koch May Drop Ward's Position From His Roster
description: Mayor Koch may abolish the position of Deputy Mayor for Human Services, which will become vacant on Sept. 1 when Haskell Ward leaves the administration. In that position, Mr. Ward had overall responsibility for social service programs operated by the city's Human Resources Administration, as well as for health matters.

title: Fuqua and S.E.C. Settle Complaint on Hoover Bid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  The Securities and Exchange Commission charged today that Fuqua Industries violated laws regulating tender offers in its bid to acquire the Hoover Company.

title: Palestinian Diplomat With a Sense of Mission
description: He is a small, benign man, bald and goateed, perhaps not the usual image of a representative of the Middle East's most influential guerrilla group, the Palestine Liberation Organization. But Zehdi Labib Terzi's eyes contradict his unremarkable appearance. They are dark, restless and determined.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: TROY, Mich., Aug. 21 (Reuters)  A group of investors announced today that they had offered about $265 million for General Growth Properties, a real estate investment trust whose holdings are mostly in shopping centers.

title: Napoli, on Tape, Refers To Theater as Bad Risk
description: James Napoli, the reputed organizedcrime figure, advised a friend against investing in the Westchester Premier Theater because they're looking to milk dry, according to a tape recording the prosecution tried unsuccessfully to introduce at Mr. Napoli's bribery trial yesterday. me tape of the conversation between Mr. Napoli and William Marchiondo, New Mexico lawyer, was made by Ralph W. Grano, an assistant deputy prison warden, on March 15, 1975. Mr. Napoli is being tried in State Supreme Court in Manhattan on charges of paying Mr. Grano two bribes totaling $600 to obtain special treatment in three Manhattan jails.

title: In Rehearsal: Sound of the 40's
description: LIVE, from the beautiful Astor Hotel in Times Square come the strains of I'll Be Seeing You as the Mutual Manhattan Variety Cavalcade, that famous 1942 radio program, goes out over the airwaves from radio station WOV.

title: Cahill Upsets Clerc
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 21 (AP)  Mike Cahill, an unseeded hopeful from Memphis, scored an upset with a 63, 75 victory over secondseeded JoseLuis Clerc of Argentina in the first round of the $175,000 United States Pro tennis championships at Longwood tonight.

title: Q&A
description: Q. The phrase eat crow has led to an office discussion. Is it possible that crow is edible? Or is it only a putdown for a loser?

title: Vegetable Oils: Looking for What's Best
description: ALL too often, gastronomes and nutritionists are at odds about foods that are valued by one group for their flavor and cooking properties and generally deplored by the other group for their effects on health. Fortunately, however, there are a few areas of agreement between these two factions, and foremost among them is the desirability of vegetable and nut oils.

title: Abrams Files Appeal Of 78 Court Decision On School Financing
description: State Attorney General Robert Abrams asked an appeals court yesterday to reverse a ruling by a judge in Nassau County that held the state's system of financing public education through the property tax to be unconstitutional.

title: Money
description: Fade al funds rate:

title: Bridge:
description: Longtime tournament players will recall the days when the Summer Nationals were invariably played in Asbury Park, N.J., and the experts pondered their problems ensconced in the comfort of rocking chairs. When the na.tionals outgrew the space available in the Convention Center, the tournament continued as a regional.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVING TODAY. Aug. 22 ORIANA P & 0 Cruises). Left Boston Aug. 21; due 1:30 P.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Committee on South African Arms Embargo3 P.M.

title: Fillol Triumphs, 46, 62, 62
description: MASON, Ohio, Aug. 21 (AP)  Jaime Fillol of Chile defeated Victor Amaya, 46, 62, 62, in firstround play today in the $200,000 Association of Tennis Professionals tournament.

title: West German Newsman Arrested in East as a Spy
description: WEST BERLIN, Aug. 21  East Germany announced today the arrest of a West German journalist on charges of espionage. It was the first such case to become known since the East German Government put into effect three weeks ago new restrictions that West Germany has criticized as hampering EastWest ties.

title: Banknote, Globe in Split
description: The United States Banknote Corporation said yesterday that a previously executed letter of intent between it and the Globe Ticket Company for the acquisition of Globe had been terminated by mutual consent because the companies had been unable to agree on terms. United States Banknote is a subsidiary of Midcon Industries Inc., which is controlled by GIT Industries.

title: Government Lists Legal Gasoline Prices in 20 Cities
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 (AP)  Motorists who suspect their local service stations of pricegouging now have a rough Government guide to legal gasoline prices in 20 major United States cities.

title: Real Estate
description: THE automobile is democratic on the road  one driver can be as assertive as another  but parking it, especially in a suburban or exurban office environment, is another matter.

title: Chess:
description: Anyone who faces Ljubomir Ljubojevic has to be prepared for ramieda771e, to assume that there is a snare underlying the most innocentlooking of his moves. He does play positionally when he must, but he loves the masked tactical twist. It is no easy task to predict what he will try next.

title: Service for Dr. Henry Magid, 61, Will Be Held Sunday in Pomona
description: A memorial service for Dr. Henry M. Magid will be held on Sunday at 2:30 P.M. in the First Unitarian Church, Pomona, N.Y.

title: Jazz: Freddie Moore at 79
description: F REDDIE MOORE, the rubberfaced jazz drummer and singer who began his career in minstrel shows when he was 12 years old, celebrated his 79th birthday Monday evening playing at One Fifth Avenue with the Downtown Blue Blowers, a group that has been there on Mondays and Fridays for the last year.

title: Blacks, Anger and the P.L.O.
description: Three strands of anger have now uncoiled from the Andrew Young affair. His contact with the Palestine Liberation Organization, which violated American pledges, angered Israel. His evasions angered his own government. His departure has angered American blacks. The depth of that anger and hurt was documented in this newspaper the other day in a report by Paul Delaney. A black construction worker in New York said of Mr. Young's resignation as Ambassador to the United Nations: He was the only truly powerful black man we had in government. Mayor Richard Hatcher of Gary, Ind., said, The Jewish community and Israel don't realize how large a stake Andy had with us and how important he was and is to us.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Terms of Anthony Industries proposed acquisition of the Shakespeare Company were incorrectly reported in Business Day on Saturday. For each common share, Shakespeare shareholders would receive $7.50 in cash and $8.50 in principal amount on an 11 percent, 20year convertible subordinated debenture of Anthony.

title: A FundRaising Group Under Abrams Inquiry
description: An organization called the National Police Conference, which says it raises money for police causes, is under investigation in connection with an allegedly fraudulent soliciting scheme, according to a spokesman for Robert Abrams, the State Attorney General.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: Amid the concern over falling national productivity, I wonder if our economic gurus have considered the role of government social policy in eroding and undermining the vigor of the American economy:

title: Concert: Two Soloists
description: IF variety and contrast are what you demand of a concert above all else, you could have had no complaints about Monday night's Mostly Mozart concert at Avery Fisher Hall. Before intermission the emphasis was on subdued elegance, at least while Rudolf Firkusny was to the fore giving a lightfingered interpretation of Mozart's Piano Concerto in D (K. 451).

title: 15 Picked for N.Y. Film Festival
description: Luna, the Italian director Bernardo Bertolucci's exploration of incest that stars Jill Clayburgh in her first film role since An Unmarried Woman, will open the 17th annual New York Film Festival at Avery Fisher Hall on Sept. 28.

title: False Ending in 50 Victory
description: Did you ever see a baseball game that was over, but not over? That unusual situation occurred last night at Shea Stadium as the Mets ran off the field with a 50 victory over the Houston Astros and were then called back by the umpires before finally nailinn down the decision.

title: Carey Asks Koch to Act Faster In Deciding on PowerPlant Site
description: Governor Carey has written Mayor Koch asking him to move more swiftly in deciding where to build a 700megawatt coal and garbagefired power plant that the State Power Authority wants to build in New York City.

title: Mortgage Broker's Milestone
description: When Arthur I. Sonnenblick completed negotiations earlier this month for an agreement in principle for his mortgage brokerage company to be acquired by Lehman Brothers Kuhn Loeb Inc., it meant a lot to him both personally and professionally.

title: Northern Telecom Plans Expansion
description: Northern Telecom Inc., a subsidiary. of Northern Telecom Ltd. of Montreal, said it planned a $20 million expansion program for its plants in California, New Jersey, North Carolina and Florida.

title: HOMOSEXUAL CLERGY STIRS GREAT DEBATE
description: The pin has been pulled and the hand grenade of ordination of homosexuals has been tossed through the open window, the Rev. Paul A. Mickey of Duke Divinity School said recently.

title: Kurdistan Tribes Have Battled Foreign Invaders for 2,000 Years
description: From their mountain strongholds, Kurdish tribesmen have been fighting intruders for more than 2,000 years. Their warrior qualities were recorded by Xenophon, whose army of Greeks fought their way through Kurdistan in 400 B.C. Yet their fight for a country of their pvm came close to realization only once, and briefly, after World War I.

title: Mondale Expected to See Ohira
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Vice President Mondale will meet with Prime Minister Masayoshi Ohira during a brief stop in Tokyo on his way home from visit to China, high Gdvernment sources said today. Mr. Mondale is scheduled to visit China later this month and will stop in Tokyo for a few hours on Sept. 3, the sources said.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Bemis Company Inc., Minneapolis, a diversified company, has elected Leroy F. Bazany controller.

title: Despite Cuts, U.S. Hopes To Expand CETA Arts
description: Ernest Green, Assistant Secretary of Labor, yesterday praised the arts programs of the Comprehensive Employment Training Act  called CETA  as making Rood economic sense. He added that, despite a 24 percent budget cut, he hoped that next year there would be 20,000 CETA artists, twice as many as there are now, but did not indicate how this might be accomplished.

title: The City
description: Errant motorists will be able to pay parking fines and towing charges with credit cards it the City Council enacts legislation tomorrow that received approval from the Council's Finance Committee.

title: Bar to Sun Chemical On Chromalloy Deal
description: A Federal judge issued a preliminary injunction barring the Sun Chemical Corporation from buying additional shares of the Chromalloy American Corporation until Sun Chemical amends its filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission to the court's satisfaction.

title: Wood, Field &
description: The fascination exhibited by many anglersAmerican anglers, in particularfor fishing tournaments is something that this fisherman has never experienced.

title: Fullback Is Dealt to Seahawks
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 21  The Giants still were not sure about their starting quarterback, found out they did not have a starting defensive lett end and then traded their starting fullback today.

title: Energy Stocks Continue Strong
description: Energy stocks, particularly oilandgas exploration issues with a stake in Canada, continued yesterday as the strongest group in the market. Ten of the 12 most active issues on the American Stock Exchange were in the energy group.

title: Radio
description: 8:158, WQXR. Lieutenant Kije Suite, Prokofiev; Printemps, Debussy.

title: Pirelli, I.T.T. Share Order
description: Industrie Pirelli said yesterday that it would have a 5050 share with Standard Telefon Kalelfabrik, a subsidiary of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, in a $200 million electriccable order for the Electricity Board of British Columbia.

title: The Gravity of the Addonizio Case
description: The United States Parole Commission was not being vindictive when it ordered former Newark Mayor Hugh Addonizio back to prison. The decision was necessary, in fact, to restore an important law that had been violated by his early release.

title: World Bank Spurs Energy Aid
description: In the wake of the latest oil price increases, the World Bank is rapidly expanding a new lending program for oil, gas and coal production in the developing world. The steppedup energy program, however, is still less ambitious than a program originally suggested by the bank staff but rejected after objections from United States officials and some American oil companies.

title: Two Views on FoodPrice Rise At a Time of FarmPrice Drop
description: Farm prices for food are going down these days, but one would never know it from shopping at the supermarket. President Carter puts the blame for the continued high prices on the middlemen, who, he contends, are not passing along the reductions in costs. The middlemen point to large increases in the costs of labor, packaging and fuel over the past year as reasons why consumers keep paying more.

title: Best Buys
description: THE Jamaican Blue Mountain Coffee saga continues. For years, the prized aromatic coffee bean was sold at just two stores in this country: One in Manhattan, another in San Francisco. Scarcity breeds popularity, and soon a cult of Blue Mountain Coffee lovers developed, willingly paying $5 to $7 a pound for this rare imported coffee.

title: Steelers Waive Roy Gerela After Trade Attempts Fail
description: LATROBE, Pa., Aug. 21 (AP)  Roy Gerela, the Pittsburgh Steelers alltime leading scorer and their placekicker, was placed on irrevocable waivers today by the National Football League club.

title: Filion Reducing Trot Role
description: Herve Filion, the Hall of Fame harness driver who has won more races than any one else in 10 of the last years and has been a successful trainer and breeder as well, has decided to cut back his participation in the Sport.

title: Newark Battling Jersey Township On Housing Bid
description: WEST MILFORD, N.J., Aug. 21  It is only 30 miles from Newark, with its block upon block of burnedout building hulks, to the hilly lakedotted woodlands of this Passaic County community.

title: CREDIT MARKETS Northwestern Bell Issue Is Slow
description: The credit markets remained calm yesterday with most investors playing a cautious hand in expectation that interest rates would rise still hi2her.

title: Fish Boil: Culinary Tradition In Bunyan Country
description: FISH CREEK, WIS.  SOME people play golf to relax. I boil fish, Russ Ostrand bellowed as he hoisted another container of whitefish and red potatoes from a boiling caldron. Four nights a week, from May to October, Mr. Ostrand, redfaced and as big as Paul Bunyan, practices his own form of relaxation, watching over a steaming pot at the White Gull Inn. He is a master of the fish boil, a culinary exercise traditional here on the Door County peninsula.

title: Drug Smuggler Is Sought by.U.S. On Charge of Jumping His Bond
description: ELPASO, Tex., Aug. 21 (UPI) Jimmy Chagra, the Las Vegas gambler and kingpin of a cocaine smuggling ring that brought drugs from Colombia to the United States, has allegedly jumped his $400,000 bond and is being sought by United States marshals.

title: Summer Hardware Sales Helped by Gas Shortage
description: Sales in the hardware and homeimprovement industries  already on solid uptrend for the past five years increased further this summer, apparently because the threat of gasoline shortages kept more people than usual at home and busy on reoairs.

title: Corporate Reports
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange. (A) the American Stock Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Private Lives
description: IT is late on a Sunday afternoon. Nobody knows exactly how late because, in the age of the digital clock, we have forgotten how to read the faces on our wristwatches  from which, anyway, most of the numbers have been removed, since wristwatches are no longer supposed to look like wristwatches; they are supposed to look instead like hightech sundials or the control panel of a lunar module.

title: Engine Trouble Excluded As Cause of Munson Crash
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 21 (AP)  Federal investigators have ruled out mechanical failure in the Aug. 2 airplane crash that killed Thurman Munson, but they have no proof of pilot error, an air safety inspector said today.

title: No Accord in Autonomy Talks
description: ALEXANDRIA, Egypt, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Egyptian and Israeli officials, meeting here with American representatives to discuss Palestinian autonomy, ended their talks today without reaching agreement, conference sources said.

title: Democratic Chief in Westchester To Quit Unless Patronage Grows
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 21  The Westchester County Democratic chairman, Samuel G. Fredman, said today that he would not seek another term next month unless he received some assurances of cooperation from every level of government, an apparent reference to frustraSpecial to The New York Times tions with the administration of his fellow Democrat, Alfred B. DelBello, the West: chester County Executive.

title: Arms and the Boy,'50: The Military Can't Hurt a Good Poet
description: ALBANY  New talk of resuming the draft unreels for my memory a summer day of 29 years ago.

title: A 5Run Ninth Sinks Royals
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 21 The New York Yankees, trailing by 21 and down to their final out, rallied for five runs in the ninth inning tonight to beat the Kansas City Royals, 62, for their fourth straight victory.

title: Virginia Wade Is Upset
description: MAHWAH, N.J., Aug. 21  Virginia Wade of Britain, last year's winner, was upset tonight in the first round of the $75,000 Volvo women's tennis tournament at Ramapo College.

title: 49 Tunisians Receive Jail Terms For Belonging to Marxist Group
description: TUNIS, Aug. 21 (UPI)  A group of 49 teachers, students and workers were sentenced today to prison terms ranging from one year to three years and nine months on charges of belonging to Marxist organization and circulating an illegal newspaper. The authorities are still searching for 8 of the 49.

title: George Meany a Failure?
description: George Meany's leadership of the A.F.L.C.I.O. has been widely touted, especially now that he's about to give up his power, as a failure. The labor movement has lost clout with Congress, and union membership has declined over the past quarter of a century from 28 to 23 percent of the work force. Some view such facts with glee, others with foreboding. And yet the diagnosis of a decline in unionism is probably more inaccurate than either very good or bad.

title: Market Place
description: THE high cost of boxcars is causing the railroads and holders of shares in companies that own the cars some grief and has raised questions regarding these investments as tax shelters.

title: Alexander A. Lawrence, A U.S. Judge in Georgia
description: SAVANNAH, Ga., Aug. 21 (AP)  Federal District Judge Alexander Atkinson Lawrence died last night after a brief illness. He was 72 years old.

title: Capital Loans Down in July
description: PARIS, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  Borrowing on international capital markets totaled the equivalent of $9.35 billion in July, compared with $9.52 billion in June, according to the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development.

title: Bursting Through Clouds of, Umm, Rhetoric to Rescue Us
description: WEST POINT, N.Y.  This past year, paradoxical solutions to seemingly simple problems have somehow become popular. For example, the solution to long gas lines is an oilimport ceiling; the solution to arms limitations is the deployment of a mobile missile; the solution to Middle East peace is the construction of two giant military airfields in the Sinai desert. Obviously what this country needs is an example of a sound, nonparadoxical, simple solution to a major national problem.

title: Australia Cuts Tax In Budget
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 21  In a budget intended to promote confidence in Australia among businesses both at home and overseas and to restore public faith in its administration, the Government announced tonight income tax cuts and a slight drop in public spending and projected a sharply reduced deficit for the fiscal year ending next June.

title: Careers
description: ATHUR S. FLEMMING, age 74, is an older American under whose sponsorship a report has been issued that may have quite an impact on the nation's job force. It is called Older Americans: An Untapped Resource.

title: Spill Hurts Credibility Of Pemex
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 21  Although elatively little oil from the runaway Mexican well has so far polluted Gulf Coast beaches, the credibility of this country's powerful oil monopoly, Petroleos Mexicanos, has already been badly hurt by the disaster.

title: Peter Kilbreth Bernuth Marries Colleen Corby
description: Colleen Corby, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Corby of WilkesBarre, Pa., was married yesterday to Peter Kilbreth Bernuth, chairman and president of the Bernuth Corporation of New York and Miami. The ceremony was performed in the Episcopal Church of the Heavenly Rest by the Rev. John Fisher.

title: 2 Quakes Felt on Coast
description: PALM SPRINGS, Calif., Aug.21 (AP)  Earthquakes shook sections of California twice today, with the latest jolt, measuring 9.1 on the Richter scale, setting off burglar alarms and shaking Palm Springs residents. The quake was reported at 7:01 P.M. Pacific daylight time. At 6:18 A.M., residents of Santa Barbara were awakened by a smaller quake that measured 3.3 on the scale.

title: Topics
description: As some judges are closing courtroom doors to the public and reporters, more and more of them, we're gratified to report, are opening up their windows  to televised coverage. Half the states, now including New Jersey and New York, are allowing cameras into some of their courtrooms at least on an experimental basis.

title: The Region
description: TRENTON  Hugh J. Addonizio, the former Newark Mayor who was to surrender to Federal authorities yesterday to continue serving a 10year term for extortion, will be allowed to remain free while the United States Parole Commission clarifies his status.

title: Strike to End at Indian Paper
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  India's oldest Englishlanguage newspaper, The Times, will reappear on Thursday, ending a nineweekold strike by its staff, the management said today. It said new wage scales for the employees would be fixed by a government tribunal. The strike at the 140yearold newspaper is its longest since 1968, when it was closed for 62 days.

title: Senator Cranston Says He Will Not Support Carter for Nomination
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 21 (UPI)  Senator Alan Cranston, Democrat of California, says he is not supporting President Carter for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: COMMODITIES Gold Auction Surge Aids Metals and Farm Crops
description: Unexpectedly strong bidding for gold at the Treasury's monthly auction of bullion yesterday spurred limit advances in preciousmetals futures and helped pull up prices of the basic farm commodities.

title: Television
description: $:02(2)Stanley Siegel 5:55(4)Dance, Dance, Dance 6:00(5)New Zoo Revue

title: Associated Press
description: MANY KILLED IN THAI TRAIN CRASH: Hundreds of rescue workers and the curious surrounded cars of a cornmuter train yesterday after it was rammed at Tailing Chan, Thailand, by a freight train. Railway officials were reported as saying that at least 65 people were killed and 250 injured, mostly school children and workers bound for Bangkok. Reason for the accident was not certain, but the freight train apparently failed to stop at a siding.

title: Thomas Eastwood, 40, An I.T.T. Publicity Aide
description: Thomas J. Eastwood, director of advertising and public relations for International Telephone and Telegraph Publishing Group, died Monday in Indiana University Medical Center, Indianapolis, following a threemonth illness. He was 40 years old and lived in Indiananpolis Mr. Eastwood joined I.I.T in 1969 as the director of advertising and public relations for Howard Sams & Company Inc., publishers. He was later named director of advertising and public relations for the I.T.T. Publishing Group, supervis: ing sales promotion and advertising for all I.T.T. publishing units, including BobbsMerrill, Marquis Who's Who, and Howard Sams.

title: Toyo Kogyo Exports Off
description: TOKYO, Aug. 21 (Reuters)  The Toyo Kogyo Company, Japan's thirdlargest vehicle exporter and the maker of the Mazda auto, said today that exports in July fell 12 percent, to 49,500 from 56,100, in June, but rose 41 percent from the yearearlier month.

title: Short Interest on Big Board at 50.4 Million Shares
description: The New York Stock Exchange reported yesterday that short interest rose 2.9 million shares in the month ended Aug. 15 to a record high of 50.4 million shares. The short interest for the yearearlier level totaled 47.5 million shares.

title: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 22, 1979
description: Natural gas from Canada would be imported into New England for the first time under an agreement in principle announced by two American and two Canadian pipeline companies. The agreement calls for a 350mile pipeline to be built between Maine and Rhode Island by a unit of Transco and the Algonguin Gas Transmission Company. It would cost an estimated $420 million and would be ready time for the 1983.84 heating season. [D1.]

title: Rebates Spur Chrysler Sales
description: DETROIT, Aug. 21 (AP)  Sales of Chrysler Corporation cars doubled in the first two days of the company's $400 rebate offer, the company said today.

title: Books:] Muriel Rukeyser Revealed as Total Poet
description: FOR a poet there is a gratification that must come from a Collected Poems that is surely not equaled by any other publishing experience. The whole THE COLLECTED POEMS OF MURIEL RUKEYSER. 588 pages. McGrawHill. $17.50. greater than its parts. The accumulated work is the finished building that rises from the blueprint, the hallflooding sound summoned from the flat black notes.

title: Israel's 2 Chief Rabbis Debate Giving Up West Bank
description: JERUSALEM, Aug. 21 (AP)  One of Israel's two Chief Rabbis has ruled that Jewish law would permit the Government to relinquish part of the biblical Holy Land to Arab rule if it would prevent war, and the ruling has touched off a fierce debate with his counterpart.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: IRECENTLY had occasion to be in a Chicago apartment that overlooked Lake Michigan, writes Don Belth. The apartment, as you may imagine, was properly elegant; but, because of a wicked fog which had reduced the ceiling to virtual zero, there was no view at all.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: With fashion designers current obsession for reviving the nipped waists and skimpy skirts of the 1950's, it followed that there would be an avalanche of that decade's accessories. We've already had spike heels and little hats. Now brace yourself for more trips down Memory Lane. Would you, for instance, believe you'd see the circle pin again? That badge of nicegi rldom that decorated every sweater and suit lapel during our innocent youth is back. If you don't have one in the back of your jewelry drawer, take your charge plate to Bergdorf's, where you'll find rhinestoneset circle pins in two sizes: $28.50 for a small one: $.36 for a larger one.

title: EARNINGS Firestone Profit Slides by 34.6%
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 21 (AP)  The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company announced today that its earnings in the fiscal third quarter had fallen 34.6 percent despite an 8.3 percent rise in sales.

title: World News Briefs
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 21 (UPI)  The Soviet Union said today that the Indian Ocean was vital to Soviet trade and security and warned against any American military buildup there.

title: Notes on People
description: Vice Admiral James B. Stockdale, a prisoner of war in North Vietnam for seven and half years, is retiring from the Navy today after 36 years to head one of the country's premier private military colleges, the Citadel in Charleston, S.C.

title: Turkish General Flies to Border
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Aug. 21 (Reuters) The Chief of Staff of the Turkish armed forces today flew to predominantly Kurdish eastern Turkey where separatists are reported to be active.

title: Official City Support For Boycott of Lettuce Is Forbidden by Koch
description: Mayor Koch has vetoed official city participation in the United Farm Workers of America boycott of nonunion iceberg lettuce and Chiquitabrand bananas.

title: Yonah Deuel Karp Is Bride Of Harold Edward Vayo 3d
description: Yonah Deuel Karp and Harold Edward Vayo 3d, students at the University of Wisconsin, were married yesterday in Fairfield, Conn. The Rev. Dennis O'Connell of St. Thomas Roman Catholic Church in Fairfield and Rabbi Charles Davidson of New Canaan, Conn., officiated at the ceremony in the Greenfield Hill Grange Hall.

title: Events
description: MOSTLY MOZART: FESTIVAL ORCHESTRA, Avery Fisher Hall, Lincoln Center, 8; preconcert recital, 7. DR PEPPER CENTRAL PARK MUSIC FESTIVAL: DR. HOOK AND DIXIE DREGS, Wollrnan Skating Rink Theater, Central Park, 6:30.

title: Rhodesia Life: Little Change
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, Aug. 21  A motorist signing himself Fuel Saver, evidently a white, wrote a letter to a Salisbury newspaper the other day suggesting a novel means of easing the country's acute gasoline shortage: hiring blacks at 5 cents a time to push cars in fillingstation lines to the pumps.

title: 2,500 Policemen at Funeral Pay Tribute to Slain Officer
description: Saluting with whitegloved hands, nearly 2,500 policemen lined up five deep for three blocks yesterday morning outside St. Teresa's Church on Staten Island to pay tribute to Officer Thomas Schimenti Jr. The 35yearold policeman was shot and killed Friday while attempting to apprehend a suspected bank robber near Grand Central Terminal.

title: Chase Lifts Broker Rate; Pressure on Prime Seen
description: The Chase Manhattan Bank raised the rate it charges brokers to finance their customers margin accounts yesterday, a move that many market participants believe will lead to further increases in the prime rate within the next two weeks.

title: Nigeria Orders Soviet to Reduce Advisers From 40 to 5
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21 Defense Department officials said today that Nigeria had recently ordered the Soviet Union to cut its contingent of military advisers in the country from about 40 to 5.

title: Pact Signed For Canada Gas in East
description: Natural gas from Canada would be imported into New England for the first time under an agreement in principle announced yesterday by two American and two Canadian pipeline companies.

title: STATE'S DEMOCRATS ALTER PRIMARY PLAN
description: The Democratic State Committee approved a major change in the state's Presidential primary yesterday. It agreed to hold a preference primary in which only the names of Presidential candidates would be listed on the ballot. National convention delegates would be selected at party caucuses rather than in the primary.

title: Sears's Net Down 3.6% In Quarter
description: Sears, Roebuck & Company, the world's largest retailer, reported yesterday that earnings in its second fiscal quarter ended July 31 declined 3.6 percent from the corresponding period a year earlier. The earnings reflected a 5.2 percent drop in sales, the company said.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: THE worst feeling about being locked up was it didn't seem real. It was akin to living in a dream. Thinking that it will THE LAST OF THE SCOTTSBORO BOYS. By Clarence Norris and Sybil D. Washington. 281 pages. Putnam's. $10.95. end in a minute. I hadsno control over what happened to me, not at all. From the time I was taken off that train, I was a robot. I was told what to do, when to do it and how. Most of the time I tried not to think of anything. Thinking and hearing about the pleasures people in the outside world were having was something I couldn't stand.

title: Around the Nation
description: BENTON, Ill., Aug. 21 (UPI)  Arnold Miller, the 56yearold president of the United Mine Workers of America, says he has some unfinished business to settle before stepping down.

title: Tennis Clinics Offer Children Idols and Aid
description: Bjorn Borg peered across the net and lofted a ball at Angela Calvin. The 5yearold wasn't a bit intimidated. She whacked it back at him. Once. Twice. Three times.

title: Fact vs. Fantasy In the Athlete's Diet
description: MOST athletes, whether they play for fun or compete for titles, are quite naturally interested in eating to win. Certainly it's reasonable to assume that the kind of food your body gets could make a difference in how well it performs.But to see how some sports participants fuel  or don't fuel  that resilient machine on which they depend, it's a wonder that they can function at all. Those who are not guilty of omitting nutritional essentials often do the opposite, stuffing themselves with winning foods, drinks, pills and potions that make a dent in their pockets but have little or nothing to do with performance. In fact, some have quite the reverse effect, compromising the athlete's ability just when he needs to be at his best.

title: Rafshoon's Agency Cleared on Aid To Carter's General Election Effort
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 21  The Federal Election Commission has concluded that President Carter's campaign committee did not receive illegal financial assistance from Gerald Rafshoon Advertising Inc., the agency that handled the committee's advertising in the 1976 general election.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Murray L. Weidenbaum, the former Assistant Secretary of the Treasury who directs the Center for the Study of American Business at Washington University in St. Louis, is taking a sabbatical for the forthcoming academic year. And he thinks that the center he founded, which is four and a half years old, can get along fine without him for a while.

title: Going out Guide
description: THE ARTFUL TRUTH Most photography exhibitions do not solicit written comments from viewers, much less enable the writers immediately to compare their reactions, good or bad, with those of others.

title: Judge Delays Priest's Trial Again As Police Investigate 2d Suspect
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Aug. 21 (UPI) The judge presiding at the trial of the Rev. Bernard T. Pagano today delayed the proceedings one more day, apparently to give investigators more time to determine whether the armed robbery charges against the priest should be dropped.

title: Toward Saving Energy
description: WASHINGTON  A new piece of energy legislation, The Energy Productivity Act, that was introduced in the Senate recently, seeks to cut the nation's dependence on foreign oil in half and provide economic relief for homeowners and business.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: American Pioneer Corporation, Orlando, Fla., has elected Grant C. Hunt president and chief executive officer of its subsidiary, the American Pioneer Life Insurance Company.

title: Dutch Bankers Expect Easing of Credit Limits
description: AMSTERDAM, Aug. 22 (Reuters) Some easing in the Netherlands restrictions on credit is expected by banking sources after the midSeptember budget announcements and economic forecasts. But they said the amount of easing would depend on the projected Government financing position next year, the state of the guilder and Dutch economic prospects.

title: Galletta Leads By a Shot
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., Aug. 22  Mal Galletta Jr. did nothing as spectacular today as he did yesterday, when he sank two I35yard approach shots. In fact, he did not come near sinking long shot as he played an orthodox round. All he did was take over the lead by one stroke after two rounds of the 64th annual Metropolitan Golf Association open championship.

title: ABROAD AT HOME What Price Power?
description: In office, Henry Kissinger complained of the difficulty of making foreign policy in a government subject to legal and political constraints on its authority. He fiercely resisted when Congress tried to limit what he and the President could do  grant preferred trade terms to the Soviet Union, for example, or bomb Cambodia, or wage covert war in Africa.

title: Sound
description: MOVING with the times, a desperately cheerful sales manager for automobile stereo equipment came up with a new promotional scheme. Enjoying good sound while waiting in the gas line, he suggested, would make the line seem shorter With stereo in the car, music is a nice travel companion.

title: The Europeans Stake In U.S. Energy Policy
description: BONN  President Carter is the third President who is trying to cut down Middle East oil imports, but until now those imports have, with short interruptions, grown. A new attempt by the United States Government to tackle the problem is being made. Will it be more successful than its precursors? I'd like to address seven questions to that concern.

title: Nicaraguans Commemorate a Commando Victory
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, Aug. 22  The Sandinist commandos who on this day last year captured Nicaragua's national palace returned there today to a spirited reception by thousands of people.

title: Homesteading on a Tugboat
description: NANTUCKET, MASS. TO be sure, there have been disconcerting moments. The time, for instance, when the seagull fell through the smokestack and sat blinking on the living room couch. Or when the dinner guests turned green and politely confessed to seasickness. Or the day the cat fell overboard and returned dripping in the middle of the night to sit on its master's head.

title: Divers Fail in Attempt To Save Life of Shark
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (UPI) Scuba divers swimming in a large tank made an extraordinary but vain effort today to save a young Great White Shark for the Steinhart Aquarium.

title: Turning a Dour Old Castle Into a Home
description: THEY saw the house at 2:30 P.M. and owned it by 4 P.M. Gordon Micunis and Jay Kobrin hardly had time to see all 35 rooms before committing themselves to Mr. Micunis, who for years created fairytale kingdoms and castles for the New York City Opera as a costume and scenery designer, and Mr. Kobrin, a costume, fashion and interior designer, seem wellsuited to cope with their new castle. It now houses their threeyearold interior design company, Gordon Micunis Interiors Inc.

title: Black Leaders Air Grievances on Jews
description: Leaders of the principal national black organizations met in New York yesterday to discuss the resignation of Andrew Young as United States delegate to the United Nations, but they widened their session into a discussion of black grievances against American Jews.

title: Owners of Atoll Reject Idea of Nuclear Wastes Site
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 22 (UPI)  The family owners of the lush South Pacific atoll of Palmyra that the Federal Government wants to use as a dumping ground for nuclear wastes say that they would not sell the land at any price and promised public opposition if the Government tried to take the island.

title: Waste Dumped in Mines Pollutes the Susquehanna
description: PITTSTON, Pa., Aug. 21 When it was announced three weeks ago that poisonous industrial wastes had been illegally dumped into abandoned coal mines here and were pouring from a mine outlet into the Susquehanna River, Charles P. McCarthy chuckled.

title: Associated Press
description: FAREWELLS TO FORMER CANADIAN LEADER: As funeral train bearing body of John G. Diefenbaker, former Prime Minister of Canada, neared final stop yesterday in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, George Janzen and family stood on tractor to pay homage to former leader. Mr. Diefenbaker, who died last Thursday, was a leader of Progressive Conservative Party and was Prime Minister from 1957 to 1963. He was buried yesterday near Saskatoon.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A band of clouds extends from the Middle Atlantic States through the Ohio Valley to the upper Mississippi Valley. Broken clouds cover the Tennessee Valley and thunderstorms stretch from the lower Mississippi Valley to Texas. Clear skies cover most of the West.

title: Bridge:
description: A remarkable performance during the summer nationals in Las Vegas, Nev., that received less attention than it deserved was the victory in the master mixed teams of Sidney Lazard and Nancy Alpaugh of New Orleans, Mark Lair of Canyon,Tex., and Joan de Witt of Chicago. Although they had to share the title with two other teams in a field of 246 teams, they achieved an unusual triple, for they had won the same title in 1977 and 1978.

title: Acquisition Canceled
description: The Beneficial Corporation, an insurance holding company, announced the termination of a previously reported agreement under which the First Savings and Loan Association of El Paso would have become part of a Beneficial subsidiary.

title: Hers
description: IN the literature of desire, one of the greatest masters was surely Leo Tolstoy. No one who reads Anna Karenina can be untouched by the erotic tension, as heavy as a velvet curtain, that separates and yet irrevocably binds Anna and Vronsky when they set eyes upon each other first in the Moscow train station, and later at the ball. This tension springs from the scalding physical attraction, the wellingup of new passion, and, at the same time, from its suppression for reasons of propriety and morality. Once they become lovers, a terrifying and sweet suffering is lost.

title: Rock and AvantGarde: Twains Meet
description: THE Public Access Synthesizer Studio is one of the worthier institutions on the New York avantgarde music scene, offering hourly access to synthesizers and tape recorders at inexpensive prices for impecunious composers. But a few weeks ago some meanie absconded with much of the studio's equipment, and so Tuesday night group of performers got together at CBGB for the first of two nights of benefit concerts.

title: Cosmos Shuffle Positions Because of Alberto's Injury
description: TULSA, Okla, Aug. 22 The Cosmos will meet the Tulsa Roughnecks here tomorrow night in the second round of the North American Soccer League playoffs without Carlos Alberto, who is in New York nursing a strained muscle in his left thigh.

title: EARNINGS
description: Retail merchandisers are showing a highly irregular pattern of earnings, as illustrated yesterday by secondquarter reports of Federated Department Stores Inc., whose profits fell 22.6 percent, and the Allied Stores Corporation, where earnings jumped 18.8 percent.

title: Suspected Terrorist Surrenders
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22 (AP)  A Jordanian accused of placing a bomb that caused two deaths irr Israel surrendered to the Federal Bureau of Investigation here today. Ziyad Abu Eain, 29 years old, had been charged by Israeli officials with placing the bomb that exploded in crowded marketplace in Tiberias May 14, killing two young boys and wounding 38 persons, F.B.I. officials said. An extradition hearing is to be held in Federal District Court.

title: Hungarian Bank Studied
description: TOKYO, Aug. 22 (AP)  A group of European and Japanese banks is negotiating to establish an international bank in Hungarythe first in Eastern Europe, a Japanese bank said today.

title: Profile of Today's Bank Robber: A Jobless Petty Criminal in 20's
description: Behind the recent surge in bank robberies in the city are a new type of criminal and a new type of bank, lawenforcement experts say.

title: Mets Finish Shutout, Then Bow
description: It's never over until it's over, Yogi Berra once said. That philosophy was severely tested yesterday at Shea Stadium when the Mets learned just before the regularly scheduled game with the Houston Astros that they had to replay part of Tuesday night's contest, too.

title: Swan Building a Case
description: When Craig Swan was a student at Arizona State, one of his teachers was, a man named Dick Merkel, who gave business courses in things like estate planning.

title: Fuel Oil Supplies Up Sharply
description: Supplies of homeheating oil and diesel fuel increased shtrply in the week ended Aug. 17, as refineries geared up to meet the heavy postsummer demand, according to figures released yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute.

title: At a County Fair, Animals Star
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y. ALL in all, it has been a good year for Hamilton Ferris's summer squash. The same true of Melissa Waddle's gladiolus. As for Kim Dorrer's pig, he may well win a blue ribbon on Saturday morning, when judges at the 134th Dutchess County Fair view the 4H hogs. On Saturday night, PigPig, as Kim calls him, is fated to be auctioned off for pork chops.

title: Theater: Gorky Drama
description: WILLIAMSTOWN, Mass., Aug. 22  In plays by Chekhov we can hear the offstage cry as the cherry orchard is toppled by the axes of progress, but in plays by Gorky, the restlessness of the rising classes is often made vocal and visible. With Gorky, we are only one step from the Revolution, and in his Children of the Sun there is even a small rebellion on stage with peasants, brandishing bricks, attacking the home of a provincial gentleman.

title: Orders for Durables Off in July
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  New orders for factory goods, including machinery, automobiles and aircraft, plunged 5.2 percent in July to the lowest level in 11 months, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRI VING TOMORROW, At 24 QUEEN ELIZABETH 2 (Cunard). Lett Southampton Aug. 19; due 8 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: 2Month Price Rise Reflects Inflation Rate of 13.2%
description: Prices in the Northeast quarter of the United States jumped 2.1 percent between April and June for a 13.2 percent annual inflation rate, well under the national average, according to figures released yesterday by the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

title: Be Patient, Sign Asks Robbers
description: As a veteran of 10 years of detective and community relations work in the New York City Police Department, Joseph A. Wiscovitch, now a banker, feels he knows well the situation of which he speaks.

title: Collecting Russel Wright
description: IT is proof of our fickle taste that today the name Russel Wright elicits looks of incomprehension, even from some in the design field. But from the late 1930's through the 1950's, Mr. Wright was one of America's leading industrial designers and his name was a household word. Between 1939 and 1946,14 million pieces of his dinnerware were sold; Easier Living, written with his wife, Mary, in 1951, was for years a popular homemaking guide.

title: U.S. Fails to Get Delay in U.N. Debate on Palestinians
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 22 United States delegates failed today to obtain postponement of a Security Council debate on Palestinian rights as Arab and thirdworld representatives pressed for the presentation of a draft resolution before the Council tomorrow.

title: Judge Rules City's Suit on Subway Defects Should Stay in U.S. Court
description: A Federal judge yesterday rejected New York City's request to return its lawsuit about defective subway cars to State Supreme Court and ruled that the suit should remain in Federal District Court in Manhattan.

title: Move to Win Release Of U.S. Businessman Falters in El Salvador
description: SAN SALVADOR, Aug. 22 (UPI) A New Jersey businessman held by striking Salvadoran textile workers was not released as expected today because of what a United States Embassy spokesman called a holdup in negotiations.

title: Plea Entered in Agent's Death
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 22 (AP)  Melvin Bay Guyon, who spent a week on the run as one of the most wanted fugitives in the country, pleaded not guilty today to charges that he shot and killed Johnnie L. Oliver, an agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. Mr. Guyon, who is 19 years old. was arraigned before Judge Harry Jaffe of Cuyahoga County Common Plea's Court on a state indictment charging aggravated murder and attempted aggravated murder in the Aug. 9 shooting death of Mr. Oliver. He also pleaded not guilty to a charge of robbery.

title: U.N. Reports a Decrease In Boat People Arrivals
description: GENEVA, Aug. 22 . The number of Vietnamese boat people arriving in countries around the China Sea is declining, according to figures published today by the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees.

title: 1st Graders Bused In Kentucky
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Aug. 22 (UPI)  The courtordered busing of first graders began without incident today, with school officials reporting only routine problems with bus operations and firstday bus overcrowding.

title: Royals Gura Stops Yanks, 31, As Winning Streak Ends at
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Aug. 22 Larry Gura, the Royals fine lefthander, beat the Yankees tonight, 31, to salvage the last game of a threegame set and end New York's modest fourgame winning streak. But the Yankees did not go down easily.

title: Richard Paul, 59, Was a Partner In the Law Firm of Paul, Weiss
description: Richard H. Paul, a Manhattan lawyer who was chief counsel for a Federal study of the country's stock markets, died yesterday at the age of 59 at University Hospital. apparently of a heart attack.

title: Chrysler Is Selling Its Realty Subsidiary
description: The beleaguered Chrysler Corporation announced yesterday that planned to shed another of its profitable businesses, the Chrysler Realty Corporation, a 12yearold subsidiary that owns or leases 780 Chrysler dealerships across the country.

title: Visiting Zulu Leader Has Evoked Black Hostility
description: Gatsha Buthelezi, a black South African political leader, is not popular with the ruling white regime, but he is the chief minister of a Zulu tribal homeland that the Government is trying to persuade him to accept as an independent state.

title: Aid From Development Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22  The InterAmerican Development Bank, the largest of the regional development banks, is restructuring $55 million in loans and other funds to help Nicaragua rebuild its economy.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Man Wielding Scissors Is Killed as 5 Officers Open Fire, Police Say
description: A 26yearold man wielding a pair of scissors was shot to death by policemen last night when he lunged at a group of five officers who were attempting to subdue him in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn, a police spokesman said.

title: Sports Today; GOLF; M.G.A. open, final round, Plainfield (N.J.) Country Club,8:15A.M.
description: Yonkers Raceway, Central and Yonkers Avenues, 8 P.M. (Television  Channel 9, 11:30 P.M.)

title: Oil Derrick Collapses, Killing One And Injuring 3 in Gulf of Mexico
description: INTRACOASTAL CITY, La., Aug. 22 (AP)  The derrick of drilling rig in the Gulf of Mexico collapsed onto the crew's living quarters today, killing one man and injuring three others, officials said.

title: Cost of Legislators Trip To Coast Put at $42,000
description: ALBANY, Aug. 22  The cost to the state for the expenses of 30 New York State legislators and 22 legislative employees who attended the annual meeting last month of the National Conference of State Legislatures in San Francisco will total about $42,000, the State Audit and Control Department estimated today.

title: What Makes Diana Swim?
description: We were inclined at first to disparage Diana Nyad's latest exploit  a 60mile swim from the Bahamas to Florida. It seemed like so much hype: the effort to cross a body of water that few others wanted to cross, the failed attempt two weeks ago that ended with a paralyzing jellyfish sting, the sharks that never materialized, and, ultimately, success  crowned with kisses from the crowd and headlines.

title: Shim Grudin, Abstract Painter And MarketResearch Executive
description: Shim Grudin, an abstract painter and market researcher, died Saturday at the Washau Medical Center in Reno. He was 66 years old and lived in Reno.

title: 7 in South-West Africa Killed by Grenade Blast
description: WINDHOEK, SouthWest Africa, Aug. 22 (AP)  Seven children died and three were seriously injured when an Americanmade rocket grenade detonated accidentally, military authorities said today.

title: Guilty Pleas Are Obtained From 2 DrugRing Leaders
description: Federal prosecutors obtained guilty pleas in Manhattan yesterday from the leaders of two major narcotics rings that distributed millions of dollars of heroin and cocaine in the New York area.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Council for Namiba 10:30 A.M.

title: Open Season on Open Banks
description: The ten bank robberies on Tuesday did not set record for New York City. That was set on July 27, when 13 banks were robbed. What's going on?

title: Holiday InnsPerkins Deal
description: Holiday Inns Inc. said it had completed its acquisition of Perkins Cake & Steak Inc., a privately held restaurant chain with headquarters In Minneapolis. Perkins has about 80 companyowned and 280 franchised restaurants in 30 states.

title: Letter. On Fighting Recession
description: To the Editor: Social Security payroll tax reductions are among the Better Ways to Cut Taxes (editorial Aug. 7).

title: The Program
description: THE Legend of Love may well be Yuri Grigorovich's best ballet. Certainly, its American premiere by the Bolshoi Ballet Tuesday night at the New York State Theater revealed poetic work seamlessly united in its narrative, music and highly stylized choreography. Nina Timofeyeva, Nadezhda Pavlova and Vyacheslav Gordeyev led the cast in a superlative performance.

title: 2 Young Women Held in Slaying Of an Elderly Couple in Brooklyn
description: Two young women were arrested in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of having entered the apartment of an elderly couple across the hall from where the teenager lived and stabbing the couple to death during a robbery.

title: Giants Give Pisarcik Top Quarterback Job
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 22 His knee hurt so much he didn't know whether he could play again. Then the Giants chose a quarterback on the first round of the college draft. But today, only 10 days before the Giants open their National Football League season, Joe Pisarcik was named our starting quarterback by Coach Ray Perkins.

title: Sadat Apparently Saw U.S. Plan As a Threat to His Peace Efforts
description: CAIRO, Aug. 22  President Anwar elSadat has turned down an American proposal for a new Security Council resolution on the Middle East, apparently because.he fears that his own painstaking peace efforts would be sidetracked or scuttled by others, including his Arab opponents The American proposal, designed to head off a tougher Arabbacked resolution on Palestinian rights, was conveyed over the weekend by the Carter Administration's special ambassador for Middle East negotiations, Robert S. Strauss, and had the rare distinction of being rejected by both Israel and Egypt.

title: Gasoline Dealers Protest Federal Retail Price List
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  Gasoline dealers say that wholesale prices are changing so fast that any Government attempt to compile a list of permissible maximum retail prices would be fruitless because it would so soon be out of date.

title: 2 Senators Ask Inquiry on Letter Assailing Their View on Abortion
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  Two Senators, labeled as babykillers in a mass mailing by a group opposing abortion, are supporting a call for an investi gation of the material by the United States Postal Service.

title: Crows Growing As Sternwheeler Continues Tour
description: ABOARD THE DELTA QUEEN, Aug. 22  The Delta Queen steamed out of the fog and rain and into a sunny, tumultuous welcome from 10,000 people today in Burlington, Iowa, and later through winds described as near hurricaneforce as President Carter's sevenday journey on the Mississippi River continued to gain momentum.

title: Coke, Soviet Extend Pact
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 22 (AP)  The CocaCola Company and the Soviet Union have agreed to extend an agreement in a joint effort to develop proteinrich foods and beverages in Russia, CocaCola officials announced.

title: Even With Stockard Channing, Shakespeare Is a Flop in Long Beach, Calif.
description: LONG BEACH, Calif. A S You Like It died in Ldng Beach the other day, halfway through its scheduled month's run. We mismarketed it, said the producer, Norman Twain, of his eccentric, barestage production of Shakespeare's comedy of love and tomfoolery in the forest of Arden. It was directed by Tony Richardson and starred Stockard Channing, the tough girl from the movie Grease, as Rosalind. It was too sophisticated for the audience, Mr. Twain said.

title: If They Go by Air, Train or Bus
description: Each airline makes its own policy governing unaccompanied children. Parents should check age restrictions, fares and procedures when calling for flight information. In general, most airlines accept children as young as 5 years old for domestic flights; some set the limit at 7. On international flights, or trips that involve connections, the minimum age usually 8.

title: Hometown of Humorist Twain Gets Serious About Carter Visit
description: HANNIBAL, Mo., Aug. 22  As for politics and energy, President Carter has his work cut out for him here. The Democratic Mayor thinks that Edward Kennedy can beat him for the nomination, one of the President's hosts is a Republican fundraiser and someone at the Mark Twain Motor Inn keeps shoving the thermostats back below 78 degrees.

title: Salvage Concern Seeks Treasure of 2d Lost Galleon
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 22 (Reuters)  Burt Webber, who turned a boyhood dream into reality when he found a sunken Spanish treasure ship last year, plans another undersea hunt in the Caribbean.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 22 (AP)  A Federal judge has denied the Household Finance Corporation and Wien Air Alaska Inc. an injunction that would have barred Alaska Airlines Inc. and its real estate unit from making further purchases of Wien Air stock, it was announced today.

title: Oklahoma City Strike Is First by Teachers in the State
description: OKLAHOMA CITY,Aug. 22 (UPI) More than 1,000 of the school district's 2,150 instructors refused to report for their first day of work today in the first teachers strike ever in Oklahoma.

title: Money
description: WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 22, 1979

title: Ford Sales Incentives Widened
description: DETROIT, Aug. 22  In an effort to compete with the Chrysler Corporation's successful customer cashrebate program, the Ford Motor Company expanded its sales incentive program for dealers today by increasing to a maximum of $1,000 a car the rebate to dealers meeting a quota on slowselling big cars.

title: Deaths
description: ADLERNatalye. Beloved wife& the late Harry. Devoted mother of Arthur and Brenda Wallach. Adored Grandmother of Debra, Scott, Robert, Lori and Michael. Services Private.

title: 'sTRAUSS ANNOUNCES PRESIDENT'S BACKING FOR MIDEAST POLICY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22  Robert S. Strauss, the. Administration's special envoy to the Middle East, announced today that President Carter had accepted the recommendation of his advisers to abandon plans to sponsor a resolution on Palestinian rights in the United Nations Security Council later this week.

title: Advertising
description: THE big emphasis in airline advertising in recent years has been on how cheaply you can fly someplace. There's this super discount fare and there's that super discount fare. With all the uneasiness in the country these days, however, United Airlines feels that it's time to remind people about service; and so its new commercials, breaking this weekend, center on a confidence theme.

title: What All Child Travelers (and Their Parents) Should Know
description: EACH year, thousands of children set out o1 trips alone, traveling to schools, to camps, to visit grandparents or to spend time with a divorced parent. From as young as 5, years old, they go by bus, by train and  most often  by airplane.

title: Technology
description: THE $8 billion officecopier market may be in for a change. A number of significant product announcements made during the last nine months appear to be signaling the onset of fierce new competition within the industry.

title: Cash Prices
description: GRAINS & FEEDS

title: G.E. Workers Strike in Erie
description: ERIE, Pa., Aug. 22 (AP)  A 6,700member union local stayed off the job in oneday strike today, seriously hampering production of heavy electrical equipment at the General Electric Corporation's huge plant along Lake Erie, the company said. Officials of United Elec. trical Workers Local 506 told members to stay off the job and refrain from picketing in the protest against company furlough policies, said G.E., the nation's largest electrical equipment maker. Company officials said 5,000 other workers at the plant were not involved.

title: West German Gadfly on Taxes Starts New Party
description: BONN, Aug. 22  Three months after Hermann Fredersdorf started a political party here with tax reform as its central theme, support from conservatives has ebbed, membership rolls have remained slim and, perhaps most discouraging, two of the country's three main parties have called for preelection tax cuts.

title: New Airline Is Planned
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 22 (UPI) A group of airline executives announced today a plan to organize a new airline with the lease or purchase of four Boeing 707 jets.

title: China's New Market Policy Brings 'sidewalk Capitalists
description: TAIYUAN, China, Aug. 18  The plane dipped slightly over the western edge of the city and suddenly eight parachutes opened below it.

title: The City
description: The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey has announced plans for a trade mission to China in late November. Invitations have been extended to Governor Carey'of New York and Governor Byrne of New Jersey for the twoweek trip, which will include a delegation of about 30 business representatives and officials from the two states.

title: Iran Press Accused of Slandering Soviet and Afghan Governments
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 22 (UPI)  Pravda charged today that the press in Iran was publishing all kind of inventions and insinuations about the Soviet Union and the Marxist Government of Afghanistan.

title: State Union's Officials Get Raises
description: The board of directors of the Civil Serv ice Employees Association, which is in the midst of a statewide election, has approved an increase in its president's salary to $50,000 a year from $35,000, effective in October.

title: Where to Find Wright Designs
description: THE designer Robert Shaw calls Russel Wright's china the most organic I have seen to date  it's not Deco, it's not 50's, it's not anything, but it's as close to nature as possible.

title: KREISKY SEES TALKS WITH P.L.O. GOING ON
description: VIENNA, Aug. 22  Contacts between Western governments and the Palestine Liberation Organization will inevitably continue, according to Chancellor Bruno Kreisky of Austria, who was instrumental in bringing together the American Ambassador to Vienna and a ranking member of the P.L.O.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in Metropolitan Report yesterday said incorrectly that officials of Conrail left in the middle of meeting with Westchester rail commuters Monday night in Elmsford, N.Y. They stayed through the threehour session.

title: New York Doors
description: The greening of front doors in summer Page C10 AMAN'S home is his castle. But in some parts of New YOrk, clearly, his door is an inspiration for horticultual decoration. Give someone a brownstone stoop or a bit of picket fence or some ornate grillwork or rich red brick or fine flagstone to set off his door and right away, thoughts turn to a bit of embellishment from nature. For some door decorators, nothing will do but a great burst of ivy, its momentum carrying it up the facade of the brownstone, its vigcir spilling it across and over. the steps themselves. Those loathe to let a plant wander as it may choose the discipline of window boxes filled with petunias or set great planters, looming like sentries, outside their do9rs. Down below street level, sunken doorways nestle in the cool shade of awnings of grape vines and morning glories. But all this is so much parsley to those who feel that no home is complete without a tree outside the door. For them, nothing will do but two slim growths, bending toward each other to form an arch; or the romance of a weeping willow overspreading the access route; or great jungle growths whose trunks seem to double as buttresses. To those who say New York is naught but unfeeling heartless brick and steel and glass, these urban decorators set varied their castle gates.

title: Carter Approved Fuel Sale to Iran
description: BURLINGTON, Iowa, Aug. 22 (AP)  President Carter, asked today about the sale of $47 million worth of heating oil and kerosene to Iran, said he had personally approved on a onetime basis the export of a very tiny bit of these products to Iran.

title: J.P. Stevens Is Ordered to Repay Union for Its Costs of Organizing
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 22 (AP)  The National Labor Relations Board has or dered J.P. Stevens & Company to reimburse a textile union for an organizing drive in North Carolina.

title: Exxon Sued in Bid For Reliance Shares
description: The Exxon Corporation said that it was the target of a lawsuit intended to force the oil company to buy all the shares of the Reliance Electric Company that were submitted to it in a $1.17 billion takeover offer.

title: Q&A
