description: HARTFORD  The State Health Services Commissioner said yesterday his agency would publicize the names of nursing homes that did not meet adequate levels of care, to put pressure on them to correct persistent violations of state and Federal health codes.

title: Deaths
description: MILLSEthel (Mrs. Mason P. Mills) on August 27, 1979. Of 3030 Park Ave, Bridgeport, Conn. Mrs. Mills was a long time resident of Stony Brook and a direct descendent of the Bayles family, one of the original settlers of Stony Brook. She was also a descendent of COL Nathaniel Hawkins of Stony Brook: Her grandfather. David T. Bayles was a shit) builder who built many 2 and 3 masted schooners at his yard on Stony Brook Dock. Her father Thomas Nathaniel Bayles was ;eminent In politics and in lumber and hardware business In the late 1880s. The firm Is still in existence. Mrs. Mills is survived by a niece Dorothy Mlnuse Smith of Woodbridge, Conn. and a nephew T. Bayles Misuse of Stony Brook and several grandnieces and grandnephews. Funeral services will be held at the Caroline Church in Setauket at 2 PM Friday, August 31. with the Interment in the Caroline Church Yard immediately following. Under the direction of O.B. Davis Funeral Home. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to

title: Hong Kong Aides Seize Heroin
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 29 (Reuters) Customs officers here seized 60 pounds of highquality heroin this week worth at least $6 million, in the largest such catch in two years.

title: Cosmos Defeated By Whitecaps, 20
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Aug. 29  The Cosmos have their backs to the wall again in the North American Soccer League playoffs.

title: France Sets Outlays To Spur Economy
description: PARIS, Aug. 29  The French Government announced a billiondollar spending program today that is intended to offset some of the expected depressive economic effects of the latest round of oil price increases.

title: To Blacks: Condemn P.L.O. Terrorism
description: Amid the heated controversy following Andrew Young's resignation as the United States delegate to the United Nations, some black people have suddenly embraced the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: BARBARA M. VLASTO
description: Barbara M. Vlasto, who had been assistant to the publisher of Atlantis, Greeklanguage daily newspaper published in New York from 1894 to 1972, died yesterday in a hospital in Athens, after long illness. She had lived in Athens since 1960. She was 52 years old.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP) The Justice Department filed two suits today in Chicago to block the Beneficial Corporation from acquiring two finance companies.

title: Deaths
description: FERGUSLucene, died August 28, 19791n New York. She is survived by a brother, William T. Fergus, of 3005 Shady Knoll Lane, Bedford, Texas, two nieces, Susan Shutowlch and Jill Fergus and three nephews, William, Jeffrey and Daniel Fergus. There will be no services. Donations may be made to Cornell Medical College, 1300 York Avenue, New York City.

title: United Press International
description: OIL CLEANUP CONTINUES IN TEXAS: A cleanup crew uses a vacuum truck to pick up oilsoaked sand on a beach at Mustang Island, Tex. Scientists monitoring the slick were optimistic yesterday when a tropical depres- sion, which would have threatened efforts to prevent further damage to the Texas coast from the spill, was found to be dissipating over northern Mexico. The slick is from a Mexican well that blew out in the Gulf of Mexico June 3.

title: Iran Says Kurds Will Allow Army In Mehabad but a Leader Denies It
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 29 (AP)  With an unofficial ceasefire reported holding in the Kurdish center of Mehabad, the state radio said today that an agreement had been reached for the Iranian Army to enter the rebelheld northwestern city to take over security.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in The Times on July 26 incorrectly identified a company that does not hire graduates of private computer schools. It is the Home Life Insurance Company.

title: Mrs. Harris to Seek Reconciliation of Blacks and Jews
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  Patricia Roberts Harris, the new Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare, said today that she would work for reconciliation between blacks and Jews but doubted that the division was as deep as had been portrayed.

title: Winning Hands Wins Title at Show in East Hampton
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 29 Winning Hands, owned by the Belcourt Farms of Keswick, Va., and ridden by Katie Monahan, won the firstyear green working hunter championship today at the Southampton horse show.

title: The New York Times / Neal Boenzi
description: MAYOR REAPS BOUNTY FROM URBAN FARMING: Mayor Koch climbing the stairs of City Hall yesterday with a basket of vegetables given to him as a gift by contestants in 17th annual Tenant Gardening Competition.

title: Hurricane David Hits 2 Caribbean Islands, Heads for Puerto Rico
description: SAN JUAN, P.R. Aug. 29 (AP)  Hurricane David battered two Caribbean islands today and headed toward Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands with winds of up to 150 miles an hour. Weather officials said the storm could intensify.

title: Benjamin H.Shapiro, 79, Is Dead; Headed Commander Oil Company
description: Benjamin H. Shapiro, chairman of the board and founder of the Commander Oil Corporation of Oyster Bay, L.I., died Tuesday at the North Shore University Hospital. He was 79 years old and lived in Glen Cove, In.

title: St. RegisSimkins Pact
description: The St. Regis Paper Company reached agreement in principle to sell to Simkins Industries Inc. its folding carton plants in Atlanta, Chicago, Cleveland and Dallas, the companies said.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSAnne On Aug. 28, 1979 Beloved wife of the late Jac Abrams, devoted sister of the late Samuel I., Maurice, Max and Meyer Rosenroan. Survived by six nieces and nephews and many great nieces and nephews. Funeral service will be private. Please omit Bowers.

title: Sound
description: STANDARDS are up. It's hard these days to find a loudspeaker that's downright bad  at least among reputable brands. Most are fair and many are good. But speak- ers whose sound is almost like real music are still rare. What's more, not all such speakers receive the recognition they deserve because of extraneous handicaps such as limited advertising and distribution. It is always a special pleasure to ferret out, in a glutted market, such instances of obscure excellence.

title: Reagan Backing Klein in Suffolk In Primary Bids
description: Determined to win delegates and influence Republicans in this state, Ronald Reagan yesterday took the unusual step of intervening in a local political fight. He endorsed the Suffolk County Executive, John V. N. Klein, for renomination in both the Republican and Conservative primaries Sept. 11.

title: Four Oil Pipeline Plans Are Held Similar in Impact
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  None of the four pipeline plans proposed for carrying Alaskan oil to the energyhungry Middle West offer significant advantages environmentally, the Interior Department said in an environmental impact statement.

title: COVEROP
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  The fore man of a Federal grand jury charged that the Justice Department was engaged in a coverup to protect White House aides and submitted his resignation from the panel yesterday. The jury is investigat

title: Exxon Reports Malaysia Find
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Aug. 29 (AP)  The Exxon Corporation said today that it had made a significant gas discovery off the coast of Trengganu in the South China sea.

title: Hulk of Monitor Too Fragile to Be Raised From Ocean
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  Federal officials said today that they would leave the hulk of the world's first modern warship, the Monitor, in the graveyard of the Atlantic off Cape Hatteras because the remains were too fragile to be raised.

title: Taiwanese View Cellar League
description: Last Saturday in Williamsport, Pa., they jogged onto the field in close formation, bootcamp style, and when they jogged off they had the seventh Little League world championship in nine years under their belts.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Baker International Corporation, Orange, Calif.based supplier of products and services to the petroleum and mining industries, has elected to its board Dan M. Krausse, founder, president and chief executive officer of the Earth Resources Company, a Dallasbased refiner and marketer of petroleum products.

title: Seagram to Record $75 Million Tax Gain
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 29, (Reuters) The Seagram Company, the world's largest producer and marketer of alcoholic beverages, said today that it would record a gain of more than $75 million due to new British tax legislation.

title: Advertising
description: Sperry To Push Listening

title: The City
description: A police bankstakeout team foiled a robbery at a Chemical Bank branch at 1934 Broadway. But the holdup attempt brought to 125 the number of attempted or successful bank robberies in the city this month, tying the monthly record, according to a Police Department spokesman.

title: Rock: Kansas, Middle West Energy and Synthesizing Influences
description: KANSAS began its Tuesday evening concert at Madison Square Garden with a string of direct, uptempo rockers and a healthy dose of the sort of energy and momentum that Middle Western hardrock bands have long been noted for. One started to wonder if this was really the same band that has charmed so many adolescents with its pop-philosophical lyrics and intricate arrangements. It was; before long, Kansas was playing music that would have made fan of Yes or Genesis feel right at home.

title: For Neil Simon, MovieMaking Is  Exciting? Glamorous?
description: IT has been almost impossible in recent weeks to walk around the streets of New York without bumping into Neil Simon. One day he was spotted  in his usual plaid shirt and khaki slacks  standing in front of Zabar's on the Upper West Side. Another day he was on the steps of the Public Library on Fifth Avenue. He has also spent hours outside Carnegie Hall and in the Sheep Meadow in Central Park. And the other night he was downtown at the Public Theater  yet another location for the filming of his new movie, Chapter Two.

title: Rally Falls Short
description: Bobby Cox was one happy manager yesterday after watching his lastplace Atlanta Braves complete a threegame sweep of the lastplace New York Mets at Shea Stadium. The 54 victory had the onetime Yankee third baseman thinking along ambitious lines.

title: Senators Visiting Soviet See Hope for Deep Arms Cuts
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 29  The head of a United States Senate mission said today that the group's talks with Soviet officials had left him with the impression that the Soviet Government was prepared to consider deep, acrosstheboard cuts in nuclear and conventional weapons as the next phase of arms negotiations with the United States.

title: Doctor Guilty in 1970 Murder of Wife and Children
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Aug. 29  After six and a half hours of deliberations, a jury convicted Dr. Jeffrey R. MacDonald today of killing his pregnant wife and two young daughters almost a decade ago when he was a Green Beret captain at Fort Bragg, N.C. The doctor maintained that his family had been beaten and stabbed to death by four young intruders.

title: Jersey to Refuse to License Casinos Imperiling Housing in Atlantic City
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 29  The Casino Control Commission put the gaming industry on notice today that it would issue no licenses for casinos on property zoned for residential use in the city's new master plan.

title: Brussels'
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 29 (Reuters)  The Mayor of Brussels, Pierre van Halteren, denied today that his office had received a telephone call from the Irish Republican Army claiming responsibility for a bomb blast in the center of the city yesterday.

title: Affirmed Returns in Speedy Form
description: As Patrice Wolfson noted yesterday when Affirmed stepped into the paddock at Belmont Park, He knows where he is all right.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Aug. 29, 1979

title: Murray Belts 3 in Orioles Sweep
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 29 (AP)  Eddie Murray slammed three home runs, driving in all seven Baltimore runs, as the Orioles defeated Minnesota, 74, to complete a doubleheader sweep today.

description: Money

title: Article 5 -- No Title
description: The New York Times

description: Morning

title: Public Hiking Halls For Minorities Urged At Construction Sites
description: Black, Hispanic and women's rights leaders urged Mayor Koch yesterday to set up community hiring halls that would be similar to laborunion hiring halls. The goal would be to insure that members of minority groups were hired at city construction sites where public funds were involved.

title: Entertainment Events
description: Music

title: EDWARD W. EWEN
description: Edward W. Ewen, a retired assistan vice president of the Manufacturers Han over Trust Company who had served the Yorkville and Flatbush branches died yesterday. He was 77 years old anc lived in Jackson Heights, Queens.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Outgoing

title: Leading Indicators Down 0.4%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The composite index of leading indicators, which is intended to forecast trends in the nation's economy, slipped fourtenths of 1 percent in July, for the third decline in four months, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Edsel Ford in Australia: Young Man in No Hurry
description: MELBOURNE, Australia, Aug. 24  When relaxing on weekends, Edsel Ford 2d, scion of the Ford motor family, regularly abstains from using his car. He often takes a trolley, with his wife and dog, to visit a local park  an example of practicing what he preaches.

title: Researcher Says 1946 Plane Crash Gave Hughes 30Year Drug Habit
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 29 (AP)  The 1946 plane crash that nearly killed Howard R. Hughes started a 30year drug habit that eventually killed him, according to a researcher who wrote Mr. Hughes's medical history.

title: Lack of Contest Leads To Heart Bill
description: A former New York City deputy police inspector was awarded a taxfree heart bill pension of $30,000 a year yesterday because an assistant corporation counsel forgot to file a court appeal to block it.

title: Touch Your Plant, Your Lights Go On
description: WASHINGTON

title: Canada Output Index Falls
description: OTTAWA, Aug. 29 (Reuters) Canada's real domestic product index fell a seasonally adjusted threetenths of 1 percent in June to 138.1 (1971= 100), compared with a rise of sixtenths of 1 percent in May and a gain of seventenths of 1 percent a year earlier, Statistics Canada said today.

title: Help the States Rescue the Shorelines
description: Too many of America's shorelines are crammed with highrise apartments that block the view and with private houses that block the beaches. The water, meanwhile, has in many places been so polluted by sewage and commercial waste that the shellfish beds have been ruined. In 1972, Congress sought to come the rescue by establishing a program of grants to help states oversee development and curb destruction along their coasts.

title: Design Notebook
description: ONE of the nicest book titles to come along in quite a while is Gritty Cities. You don't have to read very far between the lines to recognize this collection of photographs and essays as a love letter to America's smaller industrial cities, with their manufacturing beginnings overlaid by modest vernacular building in patterns of use and style never taught by planning schools or studied by aspirants for the Prix de Rome.

title: Lance Tells Appeals Court He Did Not Get a Fair Hearing in Inquiry
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 29 (UPI)  An attorney for Bert Lance, the former budget director, told a Federal appeals court yesterday that disclosures by the Justice Department had made it impossible for his client to receive a fair hearing before the grand jury that indicted him for alleged violations of the banking law.

title: Corporate Sales and Earnings Reports
description: For periods as shown.(N) indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) over-the-counter.

title: Coe Runs Afoul of the Law
description: LONDON, Aug. 29 (AP)  Sebastian Coe was stopped by the police while running today. Apparently as a result, he developed muscle trouble. And, as a further result, he has pulled out of a track meet and thereby lost his chance of setting a fourth world record in two months.

title: Browns
description: HEMPSTEAD, L.I., Aug. 29  Like two men about to engage in a fist fight, Chris Ward of the New York Jets and Lyle Alzado of the Cleveland Browns began circling each other today. But they were throwing compliments instead of punches.

title: Godunov Says Defection Was for Artistic Reasons
description: Aleksandr Godunov, the former Bolshoi ballet star, said at a news conference yesterday that he had acted solely for artistic reasons when he defected to the United States a week ago. He also said that he believed his wife would not have chosen to return home if he had been able to talk with her.

title: The New York Times / Gene Maggio
description: Heavyweight Holloware: A Vanishing Species

title: New Secretary Reportedly Moving To Restructure Energy Department
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  The new Secretary of Energy, Charles W. Duncan Jr., is planning a swift and fundamental reorganization intended to fulfill his Presidential mandate to bring order to his troubled department, according to Administration officials.

title: Turkish Debt Restructured
description: LONDON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The central bank of Turkey has signed an agreement in London and Zurich with more than 250 foreign banks restructuring about $2.2 billion of convertible Turkish lira deposits, it was announced today.

title: Gas Shortage: Charges And Denials Renewed
description: The latest available data on world oil production and United States imports for the first half of 1979 are once again raising the question of whether there was a genuine shortage of oil while motorists fumed in gasoline lines last spring.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Aides Say Nicaragua Needs $800 Million in Help
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  United States Government economists estimate that Nicaragua will need at least $800 million in outside assistance through 1980 to achieve the economic recovery that political specialists say will provide the best chance for survival of a moderate regime.

title: McEnroe Wins in Open, Dibbs Averts Loss
description: The two youngsters are standing in line to buy tickets for a John McEnroeIlie Nastase match. One youngster points to a sign that reads: This tennis match has been rated R. No one under 17 admitted without parent or guardian.

title: Dividends
description: WEDNESDAY. AUGUST 29, 1979

title: Restaurant Ideas to Take Out
description: WITH so much attention being paid to the interior design of restaurants these days, it is no surprise to find that many contain decorating ideas that are easily translatable to home use. Although details in the more spectacular restaurant settings are usually too elaborate, too costly and too highly specialized to be practical in homes, designers of smaller restaurants, working with relatively modest budgets, often must solve the same problems that confront home decorators.

title: JERSEY INTRODUCING ANEW HEALTH PLAN FOR HOSPITALS
description: TRENTON, Aug. 29  New Jersey health officials announced today a new system of uniform statewide hospital rates. It would reward institutions where charges are lower than average and would force economies on less efficient hospitals.

title: Bronx All but Ignores Significant Race
description: Back from a business trip to Japan, Joseph L. Galiber, still sleepyeyed from jet lag, sits on a bench outside the William McKinley Houses and chats with playground children holding their end-of-summer party.

title: Guidry Gains 14th
description: ARLINGTON, Tex. Aug. 29  Righthanded hitting power was what the New York Yankees sought from George Scott when they picked him up as a free agent last Sunday and righthanded hitting power was what he supplied tonight in Arlington Stadium as the Yankees beat the Texas Rangers, 75.

title: OSBORNE EARLE
description: Osborne Earle, one of the founding members of the Brandeis University faculty, died Sunday at his summer home in South Orleans, Mass:; after a short illness. He was 74 years old and lived in Cambridge, Mass.

title: Chiola Hanover 52 Hambletonian Choice
description: DU QUOIN, III., Aug. 29 (AP) Chiola Hanover, winner of 11 of 13 races this season, was a 52 favorite in today's morning line to win the 54th Hambletonian Trotting Classic at the Du Quoin State Fairgrounds on Saturday.

title: Home Beat
description: HAVE you ever wondered who designs the multitude of everyday household appliances that surround us? Monte Levin, of Monte Levin Associates, is shown above with some of his most recent products: a Code- aPhone telephone dialer, a Montgomery Ward clock radio, a Hamilton Beach iron, and a Seth Thomas batteryoperated wall clock. For 34 years, Mr. Levin has been the designer behind many household objects, from vaporizers, blenders, fryers and food processors to stereo equipment, door chimes, television sets and vacuum cleaners. Many, if not most, of his designs are electrical products, and the current energy situation has led Mr. Levin to speculate on their future. In terms of the overall picture, the amount of power used for these appliances is not critical, he said. But he added that there were bound to be changes in the market, more batteryoperated clocks, for instance, and a greater use of electronically controlled devices. Blenders and food processors will soon be designed to have a range of speeds to allow for more efficient operation, he predicted. And people will be looking for small, multiplefunction appliances, that are both task and space saving.

title: French Robbers Get $3.4 Million During Raid on a Pensions Office
description: VALENCIENNES, France, Aug. 29 (Reuters)  A gang of five men and a woman escaped with about $3.4 million in a raid on a government pensions office near here, the police said today.

title: Knicks Sign 2d, 3d Picks
description: The New York Knicks yesterday signed their second- and thirdround draft choices  Kim Goetz, a 6-foot-7-inch forward from San Diego State, and Geoff Huston, a 62 guard from Texas Tech.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH some metals are more resistant to corrosion that others, most common metals will corrode or rust to some degree if not protected against exposure to a combination of air and moisture. On ferrous metals such as iron and steel, corrosion takes the form of the reddishbrown coating that we all know as rust. On zinc and aluminum, corrosion causes pitting and a buildup of a white powdery residue; on brass and copper alloys, the result is a bluishgreen film, and on silver corrosion it causes a dark brownish film of tarnish.

title: No Charges Filed Immediately
description: LONDON, Aug. 29  The Irish police believe they know who assassinated Earl Mountbatten of Burma on Monday, Deputy Prime Minister George Colley said tonight in Dublin.

title: Brooklyn Woman, 35, Slain After Slashing an Officer
description: A 35-year-old Brooklyn woman was shot to death by a policeman in her Flatbush apartment yesterday after she slashed a sergeant in the upper left arm with a knife while resisting an attempt to evict her, police officials said.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 30, 1979

title: N.B.A. Limits Movement Of Coaches and Trainers
description: In a move designed to reduce harassment of officials, the National Basketball Association's board of governors voted yesterday to limit the movement of coaches and trainers during games.

title: Police Seeking Driver Who Shot at a Crowd After Car Struck Boy
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 29  The police are seeking a Hartford man who allegedly opened fire last night on a crowd that gathered to right his overturned car and free a 12yearold bicyclist the car had struck.

title: Jordan Inquiry: Web of Public Accusations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  In the week that has passed since Hamilton Jordan, the White House chief of staff, was accused of using cocaine last year at Studio 54, the Manhattan discotheque, two parallel but sharply dissimilar inquiries have developed.

title: Trident Launched From Sub
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI)  The Navy has launched its new Trident 1 missile from a submerged submarine for the first time. The Pentagon announced that the launching took place yesterday at 8:30 P.M. off the Florida coast.

title: Deaths
description: STONEMurrayThe Officer's. Board of Directors and Members of the Association for the Help of Retarded Children, NYC Chapter. mourns the passing of Murray Stone, beloved father of our esteemed Vice Pres,ident, I. William Stone. Our deeibost sympathy to the bereaved family. Irene L. Plan, President Michael Goldfarb, Executive Dires.

title: A Scramble for the Airwaves
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J., Aug. 27 The United States is facing a challenge to its telecommunications supremacy from developing nations in Africa, Asia and South America that are demanding more access to the frequencies of the radio spectrum.

title: When a Computer Joins the Family
description: TONY CERRETA, a New Rochelle high school teacher with no previous background in computers, uses his $1,500 Apple II home computer to balance his check book, operate a motiondetecting home burglar alarm, brush up on chess strategy, and to learn to read music. It's revolutionized my life style, he said.

title: Deaths
description: DEALYJohn M. Aug 21, 1979. Sur vived by wife Mae Langley Dealt'; father to Marese Brady, John A. and Robert J. (deceased), Gloria and Mary. Brother to James and Frank. Veteran of WW I and the First National Commander of Catholic War Veterans. Burial In Florida.

title: Rate Rise Squeezes Inventories
description: The continuing rise in the prime in terest rate, which now stands at a record 12 percent at most banks, is putting a squeeze on companies that finance large inventories of unsold goods with borrowed funds.

title: Equity Dispute Clouds Off Off Broadway's Future
description: The future of Off Off Broadway is in doubt because of the new Actors Equity showcase code scheduled to go into effect on Saturday. Under the code, Off Off Broadway theaters would be required to pay a fixed sum of 15 to 20 percent of their gross annual income to the Equity actors employed in their productions.

title: Steel Imports Up 11% in July
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 29 (AP)  Steel imports in July totaled 1.5 million tons, up 11 percent from the previous month but still 15 percent below the 1.8 million tons imported in July last year, the American Iron and Steel Institute said today.

title: PennDixie ExChief Convicted
description: Jerome Castle was convicted in Federal District Court in Manhattan yesterday of having defrauded PennDixie Industries in 1973 Florida land manipulations while he was president and chief executive officer of the company.

title: Ben Oakland, Wrote Scores for 300 Movies
description: Ben Oakland, a songwriter whose work included I'll Take Romance and scores for more than 300 motion pictures, died of cancer Sunday in the University of California at Los Angeles Medical Center. He was 71 years old.

title: Ford Campaign To Begin Sept. 9
description: The Ford Motor Company announced yesterday that its new corporate advertising campaign will begin Sept. 9 and will focus on the company's efforts to make its cars and trucks more fuel efficient. The theme is Ford  That's Incredible.

title: Pop: Mary Wilson Bows as a Solo Singer
description: CELEBRITYSTUDDED openings can be curious affairs, clotted with photographers, full of endless delays for no discernible reason and what not. It might seem hardly an auspicious occasion for a debut, especially when your costume splits down the back shortly after you go on and the sound system is dull and feedbackridden.

title: Where the Donald Trumps Rent
description: IVANA TRUMP, in a shrimpcolored Ultrasuede dress with matching silk blouse by Leo Chevalier, stood in the small dark entry hall of her apartment high above Fifth Avenue and described what she'd had in mind for the area: I wanted a very dramatic galle-

title: Dow Scores a Modest Advance
description: The stock market closed practically unchanged yesterday in active trading as a Government report on the nation's economy dampened investors enthusiasm. A few special situation issues and rumored candidates for takeovers had the biggest price moves.

title: Assassination Photos Are Taken Off Market
description: Copies of photographs purportedly made at the autopsy of President Kennedy were taken off the market yesterday by a conspiracy theorist who had said that he wanted to sell the pictures to finance a continuing investigation into Mr. Kennedy's death.

title: Diamond Price Increase
description: De Beers Consolidated Mines Ltd. said yesterday that prices of largersized rough diamonds marketed by the Central Selling Organization will be increased by about 13 percent at the next diamond sight, or price fixing, in London on Sept. 24. Individual price increases, De Beers said, will vary according to quality and size of the stone.

title: Notes on People
description: The first American lecturer known to have received a fee was Ralph Waldo Emerson. In the 1880's, he received $5 for a speech and oats for his horse and there was often an argument over whether the oats was part of the bargain, according to Dan Tyler Moore, director general of the International Platform Association.

title: Talking Business
description: with John F. Bookout of Shell Oil

title: Market Place
description: MAYBE it's summer madness, but some oil analysts are wondering if Helmerich & Payne has designs on the Sun Company Inc.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Walter M. Creitz, president of the Metropolitan Edison Company, the utility subsidiary of the General Public Utilities Corporation that owns half of the Three Mile Island nuclear power plant in Pennsylvania, resigned yesterday, effective immediately. He will become an assistant to the president of the G.P.U. Service Corporation, another subsidiary of General Public Utilities, a Parsippany, N.J.based holding company.

title: U.S. Tells Queens Board To Desegregate a School
description: The Federal Office for Civil Rights yesterday gave a local school board in Queens 30 days to desegregate an allblack intermediate school or face the loss of nearly $3.5 million in Federal education funds.

title: 7 Die in South African Gold Mine
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, Aug. 29 (Reuters)  Seven men were dead and two missing today after an explosion at a gold mine near here, according to a company official. The explosion, caused by an accumulation of gases, occurred at a depth of about 10,000 feet at the AngloAmerican Western Deep Level Mine at Carletonville, the official said.

title: Carey Seeks U.S. Aid Westway Would Bring
description: Conceding that opponents of the Westway can keep it stopped forever, Governor Carey called on the Congressional delegation and the city people opposing Westway yesterday to try to prevent the possible loss of Federal aid.

title: NAVY CRACKS DOWN ON RACIST ACTIVITY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The Navy ordered a crackdown on racist activities today and said it was seeking to increase black recruitment with special training.

title: MixUp in Glaucoma Drug Called Isolated Incident by Manufacturer
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  A mixup involving a cancer drug that turned up in a bottle labeled glaucoma medicine appears to have been an isolated incident, a spokesman for Lederle Laboratories of Wayne, N.J., said today.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 30, 1979

title: U.S., at U.N., Calls Upon Israelis And P.L.O. to End Lebanon War
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 29 The United States demanded in the Security Council today that Israel end its policy of preemptive strikes on southern Lebanon and that Palestinian guerrillas stop attacking Israel and its Lebanese Christian allies.

title: Navy to Settle With Shipyard
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The Navy announced today that it had reached an agreement to settle a 1975 dispute with the Newport News Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company over construction of the nuclearpowered cruiser Arkansas.

title: Ernest H. Ahlstrom, Dead; Was California Marine Biologist
description: SAN DIEGO, Aug. 29 (UPI)  Ernest H. Ahlstrom, a marine biologist who founded the National Marine Fisheries Service Center, died Monday in Scripps Memorial Hospital of a heart attack. He was 69 years old.

title: Tenants Protest Linking of Rent to Cost of Fuel Oil
description: At an emotional meeting punctuated by claps, shouts and boos from many of the 400 people attending, the New York City Rent Guidelines Board held a hearing yesterday to consider raising the rents for 425,000 rentstabilized apartments. The increases would help to pay for the rising cost of fuel oil.

title: Giants and Eagles Pondering Ways to Score Points
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 29  Yesterday Brad Van Pelt had a fever and was sent home to bed. Today Brad Van Pelt practiced with the Giants.

title: City Bar Unit Refuses to Endorse Steinberg of Brooklyn Civil Court
description: A Civil Court judge in Brooklyn who conducted a series of financial and business dealings in his chambers has failed to win approval from the City Bar Association in his bid for reelection.

title: Diesel and Heating Fuel More Plentiful in Week
description: Supplies of homeheating oil and diesel fuel increased sharply last week despite a decline in the operating rate of the nation's refineries, according to figures released yesterday by the American Petroleum Institute.

title: India Debates Polyesters: Would Gandhi Approve?
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 29  If the millions of Indians now spinning yarn and handlooming cloth in their village homes and workshops were to begin using polyester fiber, would this represent the desecration of an important Gandhian vision?

description: Yesterday's Weather at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/UPI

description: To the Editor:

title: Exxon Is Planning A Little Less
description: The Exxon Corporation, the world's largest oil company, said yeterday that it would supply a little less gasoline in September than it made available in August.

title: Insider Reports
description: The New York and the American stock exchanges issued yesterday their latest reports of changes in the shareholdings of officers, directors and large stockholders in companies whose shares are listed on the exchanges.

title: L.&N. Rate Rise Cleared
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission today approved a 7.5 percent increase, effective tomorrow, in the Louisville & Nashville Railroad's rate for hauling coal. The I.C.C. also let earlier L.& N. rate rise of 22 percent and 5.5 percent stand, but said the latest rise could not apply to 24 Southern utility plants.

title: A Little Street Musik
description: All New Yorkers are looking for at least one of three things: a job, an apartment, or a lover. This is what unifies them as a people. If by chance they happen to have all three, they begin to graduate to the next search: nicer job, a bigger apartment, a better lover.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: WITH the popularity of food processors comes the problem of how to store its blades. For cooks with limited storage space, there are several ingeniously designed holders that can accommodate the two shapes of blades at one time. These hold- ers come in various sizes and shapes and are a convenient way to keep the blades neatly organized. The Pottery Barn, at 117 East 58th Street, has found that a heavyduty magnetic knife or tool rack holds processor blades  except allplastic ones  handily. A magnetic rack is versatile since it can be mounted either vertically or horizontally and will hold the larger blades that will be introduced in the fall with a larger model of processor. The Pottery Barn carries a wood and magnetic knife rack in a 12inch length for $7.90 and in an 18inch length for $11.90. The store also carries a black magnetic tool rack in a 13inch size for $11 and a 24inch size for $14. For standard blade holders, W.G. Lemmon Ltd., 755 Madison Avenue, sells four styles made of acrylic that range in price from $7.95 to $22. Three are countertop models that hold from four to six blades. The fourth style, a wall model, comes in two sizes and holds from four to seven blades. Dean & Deluca, 121 Prince Street, carries a handsome oak holder manufactured by Inter Design. It is wall mounted and comes in a fiveblade size, $9.75, and a sevenblade size, $11.50.

title: After Delay, Soviet Grants Visa To Morrow's Head for Book Fair
description: Lawrence Hughes, president of William Morrow & Company, whose visa to enter the Soviet Union to attend the International Book Fair in Moscow next week had been delayed for two months, was granted the visa yesterday. Mr. Hughes is the chairman of the Association of American Publishers international freedom to publish committee, which is concerned with the right to free expression and cultural exchange without government interference.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Amex Reports Net Down 43%
description: The American Stock Exchange's earnings declined 43 percent in the second quarter and 14.2 percent in the first half, primarily because of rising operating costs, Arthur Levitt Jr., chairman of the exchange, reported yesterday.

title: Food, Fuel and Necessity
description: The Administration knows very well that this winter's heating bills are going to be a shock, particularly to the poor. Witness the meeting that Charles

title: Samuel I. Newhouse, Publisher, Dies at 84
description: Samuel I. Newhouse, the restless, selfmade newspaper magnate who ran his 31 newspapers out of a battered briefcase, died yesterday at Doctors Hospital of the effects of a stroke. Mr. Newhouse, who was known in the business world as S. I., was 84 years old.

title: AMTRAK ELIMINATES 6 PASSENGER ROUTES TOTALING 5,000 MILES
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29  The board of directors of Amtrak, the national passenger railroad corporation, whose popularity rose when the gasoline supply dropped, eliminated six routes from the system today but saved the Montrealer and the Southern Crescent.

title: Hers
description: I'VE known Janna since we were both 10 years old and in the Girl Scouts in Minnesota. Later, we spent summer vacations together canoeing and making lists of clever conversational openings to use on boys. In high school we spoke French to each other on the phone, so our mothers couldn't understand. We roomed together for the first year of college, sharing mohair sweaters that we thought were sexy and likely to lure men to the table in the student union where we squandered afternoons over lemonade and Twinkies.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: Prices of most debt issues closed a touch lower yesterday as most retail business continued slow. Dealers said much of the trading was among themselves as they prepared for the long holiday weekend.

title: Chrysler Said to Lift Loss Figure
description: The Chrysler Corporation has reportedly revised upward its projected loss for this year to $600 million from its earlier estimate of $400 million because of the decline in car sales caused by the gasoline shortages and the effects of the economic downturn.

title: Ranking Official In the Fire Dept. Is Forced to Quit
description: The Fire Department's secondranking officer, First Deputy Commissioner Ste phen J. Murphy, resigned yesterday following a ruling by the city's Board of Ethics that he had used his position tc help his son get legal business.

title: Life of Art, Art of Life
description: Artists, we're told, are the antennae of the race. They're more sensitive than the rest of us. They suffer more. They see more. And like all seers, they're spiritually exiled from their time.

title: A Tale of Carter and the Killer Rabbit
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  A killer rabbit penetrated Secret Service security and attacked President Carter on a recent trip to Plains, Ga., according to White House staff members who said that the President beat back the animal with a canoe paddle.

title: Hacienda Echoes Puerto Rico's Past
description: HORMIGUEROS, P.R.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: LOUIS AUCHINCLOSS is talking about the rector in his bestknown novel, The Rector of Justin. According to Mr. Auchincloss, who should know, Francis Prescott was based as much on Judge Learned Hand as he was on Endicott Peabody of Groton. The author asks

title: About Hyde Park
description: HYDE PARK, N.Y.  Some of the oldest upstairsdownstairs country in America lies along the high shores of the Hudson, riverine real estate that took on aristocratic dimensions 350 years ago, when the patroons first eyed it and decided it was a place they could, with sufficient household help, call home.

title: She Visits Hazardous Outposts
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 29  Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher paid a dramatic sevenhour visit to this battleweary province today to demonstrate her concern over recent killings by terrorists.

title: Chrysler Broadens Its Layoffs
description: DETROIT, Aug. 29  The Chrysler Corporation, which has idled more than 26,000 factory workers in recent months, has begun to concentrate on whitecollar workers as it seeks to reduce its salaried work force by 5,000 by early next year, according to company and union sources.

title: I.M.F. Distribution
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (AP)  The International Monetary Fund announced the distrubution of $396 million to 104 poor countries from profits from its gold sales. Two previous payouts totaled $363 million; another is due next July. They account for just under 28 percent of the profits; the rest goes to a fund for lowinterest loans.

title: Associated Press
description: TITO ARRIVES IN CUBA FOR MEETING: As President Tito of Yugoslavia stood at attention, President Fidel Castro of Cuba saluted honor guard yesterday at airport in Havana. President Tito is in Cuba for a meeting of the group of nations that call themselves nonaligned.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: LOS ANGELES  The weekend after Labor Day Jerry Brown will fly to New Hampshire and Massachusetts for some familiar primary scenes: political picnic, a factory gate, college auditoriums. He will be off on the long road to the Democratic Convention in New York a year from now, not yet formally committed but really in for keeps barring surprises.

title: Briefs on the Arts
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 29 (UPI)  A cabletelevision executive announced plans today to form the nation's first black television network, providing movies, music, talk shows and sports events featuring blacks.

title: Grain Concern's Objection
description: The Continental Grain Company took issue yesterday with a dispatch by United Press International published in The New York Times on Aug. 28 that said that the company had been blacklisted by Iraq. Neither Continental Grain nor the United States Department of Commerce is aware that Continental Grain is on an Iraq blacklist, the concern said.

title: Deaths
description: GORDY--Edward L. August 29, 1979. Husband of Laura Jane Nielsen Gordy in W. Palm Beach, Fla. Services private.

title: Rarities in Two Shows
description: Approximately 125 samples of glass representing a wide variety of periods and styles went on view this week in the new Decorative Arts Gallery of the museum. The show will continue through Nov. 25.

title: Q&A
description: Q want to insulate the part of the

title: Catholics Deplore New Python Movie
description: The Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York has deplored Monty Python's Life of Brian, a film satire by the British comedy group Monty Python, as a mockery of Christ's life.

title: U.S.MEXICAN TALKS SEEK TO MEND TIES
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 29  After a flurry of angry public exchanges, highranking United States and Mexican officials began talks here today aimed at patching up frayed relations before President Jose Lopez Portillo's planned visit to Washington next month.

title: MARDI KUNZ
description: SOUTHFIELD, Mich., Aug. 29 (AP) Marji Kunz, a fashion writer for The Detroit News, is dead of complications resulting from pneumonia. She was 40 years old.

title: Richard W. Konter Is Dead at 97; Accompanied 2 Byrd Expeditions
description: Richard W. Konter, a former chief radioman in the Navy and a member of Mm. Richard E. Byrd's expeditions to the Arctic and the Antarctic in 1926 and 1929, died Saturday at the Veterans Administration Hospital in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn. He was 97 years old and a life- long resident of Brooklyn.

title: Bridge:
description: Three NoTrump Is Tricky, As Novices Soon Discover

title: World News Briefs
description: PEKING, Aug. 29 (UPI)  The Chinese Government, accusing Vietnam of regional hegemonism, said today that Hanoi had 200,000 troops in Cambodia and demanded that they be withdrawn immediately.

title: Music: Davis Conducts Philharmonic in Park
description: A HAPPY balance between frivolousness and profundity marked the New York Philharmonic's final program in Central Park this summer. Andrew

title: A Running Start On Fall for ABCTV
description: The summer audience ratings appear to have given ABCTV a running start on the new season. Not only has the network maintained, through most of the offseason weeks, the popularity levels that have made it the leader in entertainment for the last three years, but it also has had encouraging results with previews of two new programs that will be regular weekly series in the fall.

title: At the Movies
description: IT'S an old story, even among people who make storytelling their livelihood. A novelist writes a successful book, and Hollywood decides to turn it into a movie. Soon the novelist is off to movieland: It's so glamorous, and everybody's dressed to kill, everybody's beautiful, and they're all into health food and jogging. You know why? Because they feel like they might die any second! Here are all these writers, getting more money than they've ever gotten in their whole lives, and they haven't got the faintest idea what they're doing to deserve it. Half the guys I ran into out there would take me aside and whisper some horror story  Lemme tell you what they did to my novel. Then I'd ask them what they were doing now, and they'd say Oh, I'm working on another screenplay.,

title: HANNA REITSCH, 67; A TOP GERMAN PILOT
description: Hanna Reitsch, the leading German female pilot and a muchdecorated favorite of Hitler who flew the last plane out of Berlin hours before the city fell in 1945, died Friday at her home in Bonn, West Germany. She was 67 years old.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: Continental Reaches Bankruptcy Accord

title: Unions Pension Investments
description: Lack of Control Cited by Study

title: 21 ExMental Patients Taken From 4 Private Homes
description: Detectives yesterday removed 21 residents from four private homes that housed former mental patients in Laurelton, Queens. They also began an investigation into a network of unlicensed houses where, according to community groups, dozens of former mental patients have lived for years amid broken plumbing, rotting food and roaches.

title: Royals Conquer Yankees
description: Before Luis Tiant pitched against Kansas City last night, George Scott offered him some advice.

title: Seaboard to Meet Oct. 18
description: Seaboard World Airlines Inc. said yesterday that it would hold a special stockholders meeting on Oct. 18, at a place to be announced, to vote on the merger agreement between the cornpany and Tiger International Inc. The merger of Seaboard into 1 !ger was approved by directors of both companies on July 31. Seaboard shareholders of record Aug. 23 will be eligible to vote and will receive proxy and notice materials shortly, the company said.

title: PoliceMinority Group Friction: Differences on the Use of Force
description: LeRoy Collins, the former director of the United States Community Relations Service, was shocked in the summer of 1965, in the aftermath of the Watts riots, to learn that two of his subordinates, a white and a black, had been thrown up against a car and frisked at gunpoint for no apparent reason by two members of the Los Angeles Police Department.

title: Mattel Set To Acquire Macmillan
description: Toy Maker Bids $329 Million For Publisher

title: The Newhouse Chain
description: In cities around the country, the very term chain newspapers used to carry an odor of colonialism, suggesting canned features, stingy budgets and tablepounding editorials dictated by some outsized ego back East. It is a tribute to S.I. Newhouse that his death Wednesday at the age of 84 will not change the voices of his three dozen publications; he insisted all along that they speak in their own voices.

title: East European Rowers Dominate World Trials
description: BLED, Yugoslavia, Aug. 30 (AP) Competitors from Eastern European countries dominated opening preliminaries of the world rowing championships today, taking first places in all but three heats. The three exceptions were won by Americans, including a clocking of 2 minutes 57.79 seconds in the eightoared trials that topped the firstplace time of 2:57.94 by the Soviet Union, the world champions, in an earlier heat.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: AMF Inc., a producer of leisure time and industrial products, has named Frederick A. Foss vice president and group executive of the company's industrial products group.

title: The Case for Limiting Sidewalk Cases
description: Mayor Koch wants to limit the freedom of citizens to sue the city for injuries from potholes, cracked sidewalks and other pavement defects. He is asking the City Council to enact a law barring such suits unless someone has given the city written notice of a dangerous defect at least 15 days before an accident.

title: Weicker May Run for Reelection As an Independent in 1982 Race
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 30  Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., who made a brief run for the Republican Presidential nomination earlier this year, says he may seek reelection to the Senate as an independent in 1982.

title: 2 CHARGED IN DUBLIN WITH ASSASSINATING LORD MOUNTBATTEN
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 30  The Irish police charged two men today with the assassination of Earl Mountbatten of Burma.

title: Text of the President's Speech at Emory University
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30 (AP)  Following is the prepared text of the speech that President Carter delivered today at Emory University:

description: Black Americans Mideast Concerns

title: Bank Theft Suspect Arrested
description: RENO, Nev., Aug. 30 (UPI)  Reno policemen yesterday arrested a man who allegedly gave a bank teller a note saying I don't have a gun and don't want to hurt anybody, but I need money. Tne teller stalled for time until she drew the attention of guards. Policemen went to the First National Bank and arrested James Bomholt, 32 years old, of Houston.

title: World News Briefs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Aug. 30 (Reuters) Iranian Government troops were reported within five miles of the Kurdish rebel center of Mehabad today, and the city was said to be running short of food and gasoline.

description: $100,000 Taken at Citibank Branch at Kennedy in Latest Flurry

description: Robert Metz

title: For Ferre of Milan, An American Debut
description: Centuries after Christopher Columbus discovered America, Americans have returned the favor and are constantly discovering Italians  Lollobrigida, Mastroianni, Fellini, Gucci, the list is a long one. The latest name is Gianfranco Ferre, a 31-year-old architect turned fashion designer. He was discovered in Milan by Saks Fifth Avenue, which has ensconced his fallwinter collection in a miniboutique on its fifth floor.

title: Perjury by a Carter Aide Is Alleged In Federal Inquiry Into Vesco Case
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  A top Justice Department official told Federal grand jurors last month that Richard M. Harden, a special assistant to President Carter, apparently committed perjury in the jury's investigation involving Robert

title: The Pentagon Budget Battle
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  The disclosure this week that President Carter is likely to present Congress with a multibilliondollar supplemental budget request for military spending represents only the latest phase of a crucial and often confus

title: Britain's Inflation Battle Takes Toll on Industry
description: LONDON, Aug. 30  To Sir Arthur Bryan, chairman of Wedgwood Ltd., Britain's new Conservative Government is like a bull in a china shop.

title: Senators Visiting Soviet Report Kosygin Vow to Curb New Bomber
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 30  Six visiting American Senators said today that they had been assured by Prime Minister Aleksei N. Kosygin that the Soviet Government was fully committed, under the terms of the new strateeicarms treaty with the United States, not to improve the capabilities or production rate of its bomber known in the West as Backfire.

title: Senator Church Charges Moscow Has a Brigade of Troops in Cuba
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 30 (AP)  Senator Frank Church, the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, said tonight that American intelligence units had confirmed the existence of a brigade of Soviet ground combat troops  between 2,300 and 3,000 men  in Cuba.

title: Flatbush Woman, 35, Slain During Eviction, Had Rent Ultimatum
description: Elizabeth Mangum, who was shot to death by a policeman Wednesday after slashing a sergeant as he attempted to evict her from her Brooklyn apartment, had been given a notice over three weeks earlier to pay her rent or be evicted within 72 hours.

title: Dance Festival Opens 16th Free Year in Central Park Tomorrow
description: The leaves may not have started drifting down yet, but dance fans know it's fall. It must be. The New York Dance Festival opens tomorrow at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park.

title: July Orders At Plants Fell by 2%
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)  New orders at factories fell 2 percent in July, with this second consecutive monthly decline providing further evidence of the economy's sluggishness, the Government reported today.

title: Issue and Debate P.L.O., Partner or Barrier in the Quest for Mideast Peace?
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  On Oct. 28, 1974, Arab leaders meeting in Rabat, Morocco, unanimously endorsed the Palestine Liberation Organization as the sole, legitimate representative of the Palestinian people. The declaration gave the P.L.O. responsibility for negotiating any settlement involving the Israelioccupied West Bank and Gaza Strip.

title: Jetliner Forced to Land
description: CLEVELAND, Aug. 30 (AP)  A United Airlines 727 jetliner on the way from Kansas City to New York's La Guardia Airport was forced to land today at Cleveland Hopkins Airport after it developed trouble in its hydraulic system.

title: Israelis Rebuke Dayan For Gaza Rendezvous With a P.L.O. Backer
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 30  Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan conferred in Gaza yesterday with a prominent Palestinian Arab who supports the Palestine Liberation Organization, and the meeting touched off criticism from some members of the Cabinet and proGovernment members of Parliament.

title: 2 Carter Aides Say Fund Raising Is Running Above Expectations
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)  The resignation of Andrew Young, President Carter's Cabinet shakeup and the uproar over Middle East policy have not hurt Mr. Carter's 1980 campaign fund raising, according to two top political aides.

title: Auctions
description: Previews of a busy season.

title: Judge in Suffolk Acquits Barbato Of BribeTaking
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., Aug. 30  Nicholas Barbato, who as former Republican leader of Smithtown, wielded considerable power in Republican politics in Suffolk County, was found not guilty today of charges of grand larceny and extortion involving the letting of county insurance noliries

title: PANEL IN CALIFORNIA IS PRESSED ON JUDGE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 30  A special panel of six Court of Appeals justices serving temporarily on the California Supreme Court heard arguments yesterday on a motion to disqualify Justice Frank C. Newman of the Supreme Court from participation in issues pertinent to a state investigation of his court.

title: Cuba Assails U.S. and China at Meeting of Nonaligned
description: HAVANA, Aug. 30  Cuba attacked the U.S. and its allies, the current leaders of China, at the opening of a ministerial meeting here today that will prepare for next week's conference of the leaders of the socalled nonaligned nations.

title: The Region
description: NIAGARA FALLS, N.Y. (AP)  The Board of Education voted unanimously last night to close a second school because of chemical contamination from the Love Canal.

title: Giant and Jet Openers on TV Sunday
description: Pro football's television fans in the metropolitan area will begin a 16week season of watching the Giants and the Jets with games on Sunday as the National Football League's 60th campaign opens. The Giants play at Philadelphia (Channel 2, 1 P.M.) and are followed by the Jets against Cleveland at Shea Stadium (Channel 4, 4 o'clock).

title: About Real Estate Report Lists Flaws in Way City Uses Housing
description: Just when familiarity begins to breed efficiency in governmental housing programs, processes change, personalities are substituted and the problems seem to persist as production lags.

title: Audit by Goldin Finds Public Agencies Paid Private Schools Twice
description: The city's Comptroller, Harrison J. Goldin, reported yesterday that the Special Services for Children program was owed at least $196,000 by private schools. He said this was because some private schools had been reimbursed two or three times by different agencies to educate the same children.

title: Waldheim Promises New Efforts For Peace in Southern Lebanon
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 30 Secretary General Kurt Waldheim today pledged new United Nations efforts to bring peace to southern Lebanon, and he appealed to all parties concerned to give the ceasefire announced Sunday a chance to become permanently effective.

title: TV Weekend
description: WNEWTV's most worthy presentation of Against the Wind continues to its end with twohour installments tonight and tomorrow at 8:30 P.M. on Channel 5. The Australian

title: The New York Times/Sara Krulwich
description: INFORMAL ATTIRE: Ron Luciano, sporting a Yankee cap and an ushers uniform, responded to kidding as he took position behind home plate at beginning of game between the Yankees and Kansas City Royals last night at Stadium. The umpires uniforms had been lost in transit.

title: Pop: Walter Egan at the Bottom Line
description: WALTER EGAN, who is a protg of Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks of Fleetwood Mac, has released three LP's. All of them have been in a buoyant, upbeat, melodic pop idiom that recalls Mr. Buckingham's songs, and one of them contained a nit single, Magnet and Steel. Wednesday night, Mr. Egan opened a twonight run at the Bottom Line, and he was a distinct disappointment.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: An article in Business Day on Monday incorrectly described the California operations of the Equitable Life Assurance Society. The company says it is not approving new mortgages in California but it is not closing its investment operations offices there.

title: Retailers Post Sharp Sales Gains
description: Woolworth and K Mart Lead

title: A Cultural Gulf Divides Mohawks on St. Lawrence
description: AKWESASNE TERRITORY, N.Y. Aug. 30  As a child on this Mohawk Indian reservation on the St. Lawrence River, Luanne Martin worshipped at the Catholic mission, where she assimilated not only religion but also what one traditionalist of the tribe disparagingly called an ideological package.

title: Market Posts Modest Decline, But Merger Issues Show Gains
description: Merger and specialsituation issues again made the biggest price moves yesterday as the general market declined slightly in continued active trading.

title: Outdoor Ideas For Summer's Last Holiday
description: NE of the nice things about living in New York is that everybody doesn't have to leave town every time a holiday weekend rolls around  there is always plenty to do close to home. Take this Labor Day weekend, for example: with very little effort, it is possible to catch a couple of outdoor art shows, several festivals celebrating one ethnic neighborhood or another and a scattering of openair concerts.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: City Opera Restores Nauaty Marietta
description: Like any good company of its kind, the New York City Opera has not neglected operetta, light opera, opera comique, musical plays, musical comedy or whatever you want to call opera that is less than grand. It has produced works in this genre as diverse as Gilbert and Sullivan's The Mikado, Jerome Kern's Show Boat, Offenbach's Orpheus in the Underworld, Kurt Weill's Lost in the Stars and Marc Blitzstein's The Cradle Will Rock.

title: Carter Describes Foe: Quiet Georgia Rabbit
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30 (UPI)  President Carter today lifted some of the mystery the White House had sought to create over his reported battle with a rabbit last Easter.

description: N. R. Kleinfield

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: The Penn Central Corporation, the diversified successor of the defunct Penn Central Railroad, announced the resignation yesterday of Frank E. Loy as president and chief operating officer.

title: Suspect Arrested In Upstate Death Of Museum Aide

title: C.A.B. Rejects Air Canada Cut
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)  The Civil Aeronautics Board today rejected low air fares proposed by Air Canada after President Carter agreed with the board's finding that United States carriers should have the same opportunity to offer discount prices on flights to Canada.

title: Mrs. Leslie Foster Is Married To Alfred Lurie, an Executive
description: Mrs. Leslie Foster of New York, widow of Lee Foster, was married at her home yesterday to Alfred J. Lurie of Upper Greenwood Lake, N.J. Rabbi Roy Rosenberg performed the ceremony.

title: Mrs. Thatcher to Meet Lynch on Dealing With Terror
description: LONDON, Aug. 30  Prime Minister John Lynch of Ireland agreed today to meet Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher of Britain next week to discuss the situation in Northern Ireland after the assassination of Earl Mountbatten of Burma Monday.

title: Mondale the Politician Takes to Chinese Hustings
description: XIAN, China, Aug. 30  Surrounded by cornfields and waving crowds, Vice President Mondale felt so much at home in central Shaanxi Province today that he turned a day of touring into a demonstration of how an American politician works.

title: Thai Leader Says Cambodian War Threatens People With Extinction
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 30 Prime Minister Kriangsak Chamanand of Thailand declared today that the continuing fighting in Cambodia and the resultant famine threatened to extinguish the country's people and civilization.

title: Cadillac Recalls 41,500 Sevilles Over Fears of Fire Under Hood
description: DETROIT, Aug. 30 (UPI)  The Cadillac Division of General Motors Corporation today recalled 41,500 1978 Sevilles equipped with electronic fuel injected engines to correct a fuel hose defect that could cause a fire under the hood.

title: United Press International
description: STRIKE BY TEACHERS ENTERS FIFTH DAY: As striking teachers picketed outside the Rudolph Matas Elementary School in Jefferson Parish, La., Wednesday, some pupils reported for school. Forty of 44 teachers are on strike.

title: Publishing: Mailer Weighs In With a Big Book
description: NORMAN MAILER, who since his long war novel, The Naked and the Dead, has not been known as a man of few words, is about to unleash his longest book. The Executioner's Song, a work of nonfiction to be published Oct. 15 by Little, Brown & Company, is 1,057 pages. It is priced at $16.95, a publishing figure worth noting in inflationary times.

description: Common Zinnias

title: Murder Suspect Arrested
description: Steven T. Garrett, a 28-year-old suspect in the strangling of Albert Abolafia, 28, in Rochester last April was arrested yesterday by the state police in his apartment at 1035 Union Street in Brooklyn.

title: Conviction of Doctor Ends a Couple's Long Quest
description: RALEIGH, N.C., Aug. 30  Moments after guilty verdicts were announced yesterday in the murder trial of Dr. Jeffery R. MacDonald, Alfred Kassab, a 58yearold frozenegg salesman from Cranbury, N.J., reached for the phone to call a lawyer in Long Island.

title: International Prayer Session Held at St. Patrick's
description: More than 300 religious leaders from 46 nations  Christians, Jews, Buddhists and followers of Islam, Hinduism, Confucianism, Shintoism and other faiths  gathered at St. Patrick's Cathedral yesterday to pray for peace and world unity.

title: The Last Word at Discos Belongs to the Doormen
description: There are any number of people around who wonder just who in the heck they think they are, those men standing out there, able to make or break an evening with a word or a wave.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: In light of deteriorating conditions in the bond markets, Comptroller Edward V. Regan of New York State announced the indefinite postponement yesterday of a $95.9 million bond issue that had been scheduled for sale Sept. 13.

title: F.D.A. Begins a Drive to Reduce Peril From Lead in Canned Food
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration today announced a campaign to reduce consumer exposure to lead in canned foods, with particular emphasis on products eaten by children.

description: Below 42d Street

title: Australia Plans Alcohol Fuel
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 30 (AP) An Australian oil company announced plans today to produce four million tons of alcohol fuel a year that would replace 15 percent of the country's oil imports.

title: 2 Chrysler Chiefs to Cut Pay, Earn Credits
description: DETROIT, Aug. 30  The two top executives of the Chrysler Corporation said today that they would reduce their salaries to $1 a year for two years unless the financially ailing company returned to profitability before then.

title: Broadway
description: TOM CONTI is being rather vague, and Frank D. Gilroy is being quite mysterious. One thing is certain, however: Mr. Conti will direct Mr. Gilroy's new play, Last Licks, on Broadway this fall. The actor will leave his Tony Awardwinning role in Whose Life Is It Anyway? on Oct. 27 to start rehearsals. Opening night is Nov. 22.

title: Campaign Director Quits
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)  Daniel James, the national campaign director for Benjamin Fernandez, a Republican Presidential candidate, has confirmed that he has resigned. Reached at the camoaign's Washington office, he said yesterday that he submitted his resignation about a week or 10 days ago. He declined to give a reason for his resignation.

title: Nekoosa Strengthens Its Hand
description: MILLINOCKET, Me.  James Giffune, manager of the Great Northern Nekoosa Corporation's huge paper mill that straddles the Penobscot River here in northern Maine, listened with pleasure to the falling rain.

title: 5 Members of Asian Bloc Form Rice Stockpile for Emergencies
description: MANILA, Aug. 30  Five member countries of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations have established here an emergency rice reserve of 50,000 metric tons to be replenished every time a needy member draws from it. They have also adopted a common agricultural policy to increase production.

title: 5 Teams Allowed to Print Playoff and Series Tickets
description: The Baltimore Orioles, the California Angels, the Cincinnati Reds and the Pittsburgh Pirates  the four division leaders in the major leagues  and the Houston Astros, close runnersup, have been authorized by Commissioner Bowie Kuhn to print playoff and World Series tickets.

title: Folk Festival on Tap For Weekend in Jersey
