title: Deaths
description: ABRAHAMSE NAlf red E. Insurance Square Club of NY Inc., Officers and Members are requested to meet at ObergBedell Funeral Home, 3787 HyIan Blvd, S.I. on Sunday, September 2, at 8:30 p.m. to participate with Kilwinning Lodge No. 825, in services for our departed brother.

title: NettlesMoran Case and the Commissar
description: When Bowie Kuhn fined Ray Kroc $100,000 on a gossamer charge of tampering, the owner of the San Diego Padres was so outraged he vowed he would sell the team. At a family conference it was decided to put the club on the market, but that course of action simply wouldn't go down with a man who had what it took to build a fortune of $500 million after his 52d birthday. At the last moment he said no, dammit, he wasn't

title: FOUR DIE AFTER CRASH ON MISSISSIPPI RIVER IGNITES BUTANE FIRE: Rescuers tarring an injured seaman to ambulance after removing him from the Inca Tupac Tupanqui yesterday after collision with tank barge. Page A10.
description: GOOD HOPE, La., Aug. 30 (AP)  A Peruvian cargo ship traveling down the Mississippi River veered out of control today and rammed a big butane tank barge, setting off a huge fireball. Four Peruvian crewmen died, three people were missing and 20 were hospitalized.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday EAST HAMPTON AUCTION

title: Bridge:
description: Founding a Duplicate Club, Unlike Playing, Is a Gamble

title: 5 Die in Canary Islands Crash
description: SANTA CRUZ DE TENERIFE, Canary Islands, Aug. 30 (UPI) A military truck swerved out of control today and collided with five vehicles. Six people were killed, five of them soldiers.

title: Floyd Reeves, Educator; Aide at Michigan State
description: Floyd W. Reeves, an educator here and abroad who was known for serving as consultant to John Hannah, former president of Michigan State University, died Aug. 20 in East Lansing, Mich. He was 88 years old.

title: Expos Buy Dale Murray
description: The New York Mets sold Dale Murray, a righthanded relief pitcher, to the Montreal Expos yesterday for an amount said to be in excess of the $20,000 waiver price.

title: Nader Associate Rejects Chance For White House Consumer Post
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  Mark Green, a close associate of Ralph Nader who is an outspoken critic of President Carter's energy policies, has turned down a chance to succeed Esther Peterson as the President's consumer affairs adviser.

title: Why a Depression Might Be Good For Us All
description: HANOVER, N.H.  The United States is now in a recession. What would happen if there were another depression? We survived the crash of 1929, though at great cost. How would America fare in another fullfledged economic collapse?

title: Guggenheim Presents Matisse Exhibition
description: THAT Henri Matisse was one of the great artists of all time is by now taken pretty much for granted. It is, moreover, a proposition that the New Yorker can verify any day of the week by walking into the Museum of Modern Art. Thanks primarily to Alfred H. Barr Jr., the Modern Museum has one of the great Matisse holdings. For certain major achievements of the period before 1914 there is simply no place to go except Moscow and Leningrad; but once that has been said_we can be very proud indeed of what can be found in the Museum of Modern Art.

title: Deaths
description: H E RMANHeten. We mourn the loss of our cherished friend and leader. The Group

title: For Children
description: Family Weekend

title: Television
description: Morning

title: South African Is Cleared Of Blocking an Inquiry
description: PRETORIA, South Africa, Aug. 30 (Reuters)  Former Information Minister Cornelius P. Mulder was cleared today of charges that he tried to block an inquiry into the misuse of funds by South Africa's information agency.

title: A Major, Quiet Problem in Southern Africa
description: PITTSBURGH  One of the unspoken problems of Southern Africa is skepticism. Racism, we hear a great deal about, and Communism, and liberation, and imperialism, and majority rule. But there is a deeper prob- lem  one with which neither skigans nor guns can cope. Indeed, it is even difficult to confront, for the skepticism I am thinking of is largely inarticulate; it expresses itself in the deep silence of disenchantment, resisting with an obdurate reserve the claims of leaders and movements, throwing back at them the accumulated disillusionment of the first 20 years of African independence.

title: State Aide Says New York Lags In Submissions to Control Board
description: The special deputy state comptroller said yesterday that New York City had continued to execute and even pay on certain city contracts before submitting them to the Financial Control Board for approval as required by the legislation that saved the city from default three years ago.

title: Cauthen Is Happy in England, Where Racing Is His Cup of Tea
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., Aug. 30  Sounding more like a confirmed Anglophile than a Kentuckybred farmboy, 19yearold Steve Cauthen indicated today that he would probably continue riding outside the United States for at least another year.

title: 51,000 More in the New York Area Got Jobs in June
description: Employment in the 18county New Yorknortheastern New Jersey area increased by 51,000 in June over May, with 18,000 of the increase in New York City, the Federal Bureau of Labor Statistics reported yesterday.

title: Restaurants
description: IN Italy, the term tavola calda  literally, hot table  was originally applied to small, coffeeshop style eating places that usually had counME ters and which offered simple hot dishes often kept warm on steam tables. But as with other restaurant designations such as trattoria, bistro and cafe, the meaning gradually blurred. In Northern Italy especially, one now finds that a tavola calda is a rather stylish modern cafebistro still featuring a wide array of light to heavy dishes served up with relative dispatch. Tavola Calda da Alfredo on Bleecker Street in Greenwich Village is one of the most attractive and innovative Italian eating places in the city, offering a moderately priced assortment of dishes that range from choices as light as stuffed vegetables or cold vegetable salads through a selection of pastas to several substantial meat and poultry dishes featured each day. The setting is simple and bright, though crowded and noisy, and the tone is casual. It is extremely popular with those who wish to enjoy diverting and satisfying food without having to wear anything more formal than blue jeans and Tshirts. It is also entertaining to be able to eat Italian food Chinese style, sharing the generously portioned appetizers, pastas, main courses and salads.

title: News Summary
description: FRIDAY, AUGUST 31, 1979

title: Kaiser Appoints New Chief
description: In a major shakeup of its top manag ment, the Kaiser Steel Corporation announced yesterday that Mark T. Anthony, who for the past two years has served as president, has been appointed one of two vice chairmen of the board of directors. Edgar F. Kaiser Jr. will become president and chief executive officer of the troubled company.

title: C.I.A. Oil Report Predicts Output Drop
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30  The Central Intelligence Agency has disagreed with President Carter over the consequences of his decision to remove price controls from crude oil produced within the United States.

title: No Agreement On Mexican Gas
description: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 30  After two days of talks, senior United States and Mexican officials tonight failed to reach agreement on a price for proposed Mexican natural gas exports to the United States. No

title: Cabaret: Salute to Hoagy Carmichael
description: DICK SUDHALTER, the cornetist and biographer of Bix Beiderbecke who produced a program based on the music of Beiderbecke's close friend Hoagy Carmichael at the Newport Jazz Festival in June, is continuing his explora- tion of Mr. Carmichael's music at Michael's Pub, where he has assembled a company of singers and musicians who relate very closely to the Carmichael musical styles.

title: Albert Speer, on the Nazi Invasion Of Poland
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, Aug. 29  As the German Army, on Adolf Hitler's orders, crossed the Polish border on Sept. 1, 1939, touching off the Second World War, the dictator was offering a deliberate challenge to fate along the lines of his slogan Victory or Ruin.

title: Correction Chief Acts to Prevent Any Further Escapes in Maryland
description: JESSUP, Md., Aug. 30 (AP)  Maryland's corrections chief, stung by the escape of 33 inmates from three prisons in nine days, has ordered that guards be put on overtime and searches at all state orisons be stenoed un.

title: VAST RESERVE OF OIL FROM ATLANTIC SEEN,
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30  A Government official offered hope at a symposium today on energy problems that vast untapped reserves of oil might lie under sedimentary rock deep below the floor of the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Film: Pryor Revisited:The Watch Is Different
description: ACCORDING to the ads, most of the material contained in "Richard Pryor Is Back Live in Concert," which opens today at the Cinerama 2 and other theaters, was contained in "Richard Pryor Live in Concert," which was released in New York last February. In fact, the first 20 or so minutes of the second film are from the earlier movie.The rest of the material is largely the same but, as a spokesman for the tireless producer told me, "It was photographed at a different concert  you can tell because Mr. Pryor is wearing a watch in the second part, and he isn't in the first part."If you cannot rest until you see Mr. Pryor wear a wristwatch, don't miss this recycled work. However, it's far cheaper to stay home and remember the first movie fondly.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Thursday, Aug. 30, 1979

title: McEnroe Captures Tumultuous Match
description: It began as a tennis match and ended as a tragic soap opera. In the middle, John McEnroe and Ilie Nastase exchanged roles as heroes and villains. There were cheers, boos, point penalties, game penalties, police on the court, a switch in umpires and even some brilliant shot making.

title: Around the Nation
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 30 (UPI) City officials who endorsed a resolution supporting Cesar Chavez's farm union lettuce boycott learned today that it had cost San Francisco a major farmers convention in 1982.

title: Having It Both Ways on Mergers
description: Merger fever rages unabated on Wall Street: R.C.A. wants C.I.T. Financial, Exxon wants Reliance Electric. And no wonder. As long as stocks sell below the intrinsic value of the property they represent, cor- porate America will have a powerful incentive to feed on itself. Why start from scratch, building up expensive new product lines when existing facilities can be had for a song?

title: Books of TheTimes
description: JOHN STEINBECK lived 66 years (19021968); produced 20 books of fiction, eight of nonfiction, two plays, two screenplays, and a large volume of letters, and won the Nobel Prize for Literature.

title: CETA Workers in City Sue to Block Layoff Plan
description: A lawsuit to block the scheduled layoff of thousands of CETA workers employed by New York City and private agencies was filed yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn. The suit would also bar the hiring of anyone else until laidoff CETA workers eot their fobs hark

title: Iranian Oil Head Now Says U.S. Fuel Is Unneeded
description: Despite an urgent request earlier this summer, the Iranian Government has decided that it does not need a shipment of homeheating oil and kerosene that the Carter Administration had quickly approved. As a result, an official in Teheran said, Iran may resell the oil at a higher price on the international market.

title: Jaworski Supports Bush; Will Join His Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 30 (AP)  Leon Jaworski, the former Watergate prosecutor, who says the only Republican Presidential candidate he ever voted for was Richard M. Nixon, today endorsed George Bush, a Republican.

title: Priest, 34, Pleads Guilty To Attack With Hatchet
description: NEWARK, Aug. 30 (AP)  A 34yearold Roman Catholic priest from Union County pleaded guilty yesterday to a charge that he assaulted a parishioner with a hatchet, and church officials appeared uncertain today about what steps they may have to take in the race

title: Hurricane Kills 10 on Caribbean Islands
description: Hurricane David, said to be one of the most powerful storms the Western Hemisphere has experienced in this century, swept across several Caribbean islands yesterday, killing 10 people and causing widespread destruction.

title: Mrs. Marcos, at Dinner, Listens to Denunciations
description: MANILA, Aug. 30  Leaders of the Congress that was displaced by martial law denounced the regime of President Ferdinand E. Marcos tonight as Imelda Marcos. the First Lady. listened.

title: New Face: Daniel Stern Off the Sofa and Onto the Movie Screen in Breaking Away
description: AS Cyril, one of four Indiana teenagers in Breaking Away, he was tall, skinny, gangly, slightly goony looking, and in his own oddball way funny.

title: Timetable Shows a 4Month Wait In U.S. Trial Against Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 30 (AP)  The United States Justice Department has filed a timetable for its abuse suit against the Philadelphia Police Department that indicates the case will not come to trial for at least four months.

description: Music

title: Walter J. Petschek, 78, Counsel to a Law Firm
description: Walter J. Petschek, counsel to the New York law firm of Rosenman Colin Freund Lewis & Cohen, died yesterday at his home in the Stanhope Hotel after a short illness. He was 78 years old.

title: Kathy Horvath Gets Her ComingOut Party
description: She took a long drink from the thermos and rubbed cold water across her face. It was a sunny, humid morning on the grandstand court, and she was starting to feel tired. People were filing into the stands by the hundreds. It looked like the side view of an ant colony, she thought.

title: Atlantic City Waters Offer Bluefish, Fluke
description: AREA A  Bluefish, many of them large, were being caught less than two miles off Convention Hall in Atlantic City this week, according to Capt. Andy's Marina at Margate, N.J. A good number of weakfish and fluke are inshore of the blues. Snapper blues are plentiful in Margate Bay. Ken's Landing at Barnegat says that bluefishing continues to be good over Barnegat Ridge, and !hiking is improving inshore.

title: Money Supply Declines; No Fed Shift Is Expected
description: The basic measure of the money supply declined by $1.3 billion in the week ended Aug. 22, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday.

title: Garden Goes Latin With Salsa Festival
description: Ralph Mercado, the Latinmusic impresario, is fairly exploding with enthusiasm for the Kool New York Salsa Festival that he is producing with Ray Aviles at Madison Square Garden tomorrow and Sunday at 8 P.M. (with the help of a new sponsor, Kool cigarettes).

title: O'Brien Sets Hearing Date For Walton Compensation
description: Larry O'Brien, commissioner of the National Basketball Association, announced yesterday that he would conduct a hearing Sept. 10 on the Bill Walton compensation case.

title: Resorts
description: Resort operators in the New York metropolitan area are counting on a combination of good weather and ample gasoline supplies this long holiday weekend two elements that have been missing most of the brief summer season  to help them end one of the most erratic business periods in recent years on a high note.

title: CARTER ACTS TO SPUR BLACKJEWISH AMITY
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 30  President Carter sought today to smooth differences between blacks and Jews and avert deep and damaging divisions in the aftermath of Andrew Young's resignation as United States delegate to the United Nations.

title: Niger Uranium Find Reported
description: TOKYO, Aug. 30 (AP)  A Japanese uranium development company has discovered rich uranium deposits in the African country of Niger, the newspaper Nihon Keizai reported today. It said that the Overseas Uranium Resources Development Comnanv of

title: A Labor Day Fair With the Emphasis on the Labor
description: A Labor Day street fair unfolds Monday at noon on 92d Street, between Ninth and 10th Avenues, involving several unions, music ensembles, clowns and jugglers, films, crafts, disco roller skating and fortune cookies with health messaees.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: Incoming

title: Auto Workers Pick General Motors as Strike Target
description: DETROIT, Aug. 30  The United Automobile Workers today designated the General Motors Corporation as the target employer from which it would seek pattern contract and would strike if there was no settlement by Sept. 14. Intense negotiations between the union and the auto maker are scheduled to begin at 9:30 A.M. tomorrow at the company's headquarters here. One union leader expressed confidence that a settlement could be reached without a walkout.

title: Money
description: THURSDAY, AUGUST 30, 1979

title: Taste of Peace on Vacation Leads Couple to Quit Rhodesia
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, Aug. 30  Irene and Stuart Clark are taking the gap. Like many white Rhodesians and most of their closest friends, the Clarks, who are in their early 20's, are turnina their backs on Zimbabwe Rhode- sia and the war they feel is closing in on them. In two weeks they will fly to Perth, Australia, and a life they are convinced must hold more promise.

title: The Pop Life
description: How the B52's cope with the success trap.

title: St. Louis Symphony to Mark Its Centennial
description: The St. Louis Symphony Orchestra, which was founded on Sept. 1, 1880, under the name of the St. Louis Choral Society, will celebrate its centennial season with a eala concert on Sent. 8.

title: Citizen Beame and Mayor Koch Share a Lunch and a Few Quips
description: At 1 P.M. yesterday, a grayhaired man in a crisp blue cord suit emerged from the exit at the Brooklyn Bridge stop of the Lexington Avenue IRT and walked the 100 or so yards to City Hall, where he was met by photographers and reporters.

title: Film: A Comic Romp In Apple Dumpling Land:A Kind of a Sequel
description: WALT DISNEY'S "The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again" is a sequel of sorts to the company's 1975 comedy about some incredibly lovable moppets, a card sharp and two inept bandits, played by Don Knotts and Tim Conway. The children, apparently, have gone on to rewards in other endeavors, as has the gambler. That leaves Mr. Knotts and Mr. Conway to carry on in the sequel, which is as cheerful and painless as not going to the dentist.The screenplay, written by Don Tait, has Mr. Knotts, who looks more fragile and worried than ever, and Mr. Conway, who possesses the serenity of the well-fed, attempting to go straight, but nevertheless being hunted throughout the West as desperadoes.Kenneth Mars is very funny as a big but bird-brained lawman named Woolly Billy Hitchcock. The supporting cast includes Jack Elam, as a truly dishonest bandit, and young Tim Matheson and Elyssa Davalos as what used to be called "the love interest." The veteran actor Harry Morgan has some nice moments as the commandant of a frontier fort that Mr. Knotts and Mr. Conway accidentally burn down as they are attempting to serve fruit punch. It's to the movie's credit that at the time this happens it seems absolutely logical. There's not a child in the entire movie, though I don't think the children in the audience will mind.Vincent McEveety directed the film, which opens today at theaters in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Island.

title: Couple and 2 Sons Die in Blaze
description: PEABODY, Mass., Aug. 30 (UPI) The parents of 11 children and two of their sons died early today in a fire that destroyed a twofamily home. The dead were identified as Fred L. Davidson, 53 years old; his wife, Elizabeth, 48, and their two youngest children, Charles, 13, and Derek, 8. Eight other members of the family, including a married son, his wife and their 6month old son escaped uninjured.

title: Notes on People
description: Earl Butz Revisited: A Plowing Match in Iowa

title: Deaths
description: SEEDMANBetty Lauer, on August 30, 1979. Devoted wife of the late Mathew J. Lauer, adored mother of Bob and Betty Lauer, and Lynne and Hal Dietz, dear sister of Biddie Kramer and Frances Kerin, adored grandmother of Matthew, April, Ken, Laurie and Marcie. Services, 2PM, August 31, at The Riverside 76 St. and Amsterdam Ave.

title: Four Days of Movie Nostalgia
description: Cinecon, a fourday marathon devoted to the movies of the 1920's through the 40's, will begin today at 9 A.M. in the Biltmore Hotel, Madison Avenue and 43d Street. It is an annual event sponsored by the Society for Cinephiles, a worldwide organization of oldmovie buffs that boasts 3,000 members, 20 to 70 years old.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: FRIDAY, AUGUST 31, 1979

title: McHenry, Young's Top U.N. Aide, Is Reported Chosen to Succeed Him
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 30 President Carter has chosen Donald F. McHenry, deputy chief of the United States Mission, to succeed Andrew Young as the chief delegate to the United Nations, according to authoritative sources here. A formal announcement was expected later this week.

title: Building Of Homes Down 10%
description: Construction of singlefamily and multifamily homes declined 10 percent to 531,405 units in the second quarter compared with the period last year, the F.W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Information Systems Company reported yesterday.

title: Another Boardwalk Landmark Comes Down for a Casino
description: ATLANTIC CITY, Aug. 30  Another Boardwalk landmark was demolished today to make way for a casino.

title: A TieUp on Harlem Line Delays 13 Conrail Trains for 90 Minutes
description: Thirteen trains carrying about 2,500 commuters and other riders were stranded up to 90 minutes on Conrail's Harlem line last night after a train making a switching maneuver at Mount Vernon in Westchester County stalled across four sets of tracks, blocking all of the line's outbound and inbound traffic.

title: Adm. Wilfred McNeil Dies at 78; Was Assistant Defense Secretary
description: Adm. Wilfred J. McNeil, former Assistant Secretary of Defense, died yesterday at the National Naval Medical Center in Bethesda, Md. He was 78 years old.

title: Teachers Facing 1,000 Transfers And 208 Layoffs
description: Schools Chancellor Frank J. Macchiarola has laid off 208 teachers, reassigned 1,000 others and is considering closing five small annexes near public schools and about 10 other facilities. These include schools and centers in poverty and middleincome areas throughout New York City

title: Statement by I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 30 (AP)  Following is the text of a statement issued by the Provisional wing of the Irish Republican Army claiming responsibility for the assassination of Earl Mountbatten of Burma:

title: Suspect Cleared in 58 Now Admits a Killing
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 30 (AP)  A former policeman who was cleared 21 years ago in the fatal shooting of a young man has pleaded guilty to the shooting.

title: Somali Charter Wins Easily
description: MOGADISHU, Somalia, Aug. 30 (UPI)  Voters have approved a new Constitution almost unanimously in a nationwide referendum, the Government announced today. In the balloting Saturday, official figures said, the vote in favor was 99.69 percent. The results are to be reviewed by the Supreme Court within 10 days.

title: Cosmos Disturbed by Officiating
description: In the wake of a 20 defeat Wednesday night in Vancouver, the Cosmos had their backs up and to the wall yesterday as they looked toward tomorrow's second playoff game against the Whitecans at Giants Stadium.

title: New Face: Lynnie Godfrey BittyThing With a Daddy, Won't You Please Come Home
description: IT'S the long leg of Lyrmie Godfrey that has made her Broadway debut so memorable. Certainly there is no overlooking the other qualities she brings to the musical Eubie! in general and a number called Daddy in particular. These are her powerful voice, part alto, part oboe, part Satchmo; a sense of comedic timing that makes a onebeat pause and a sidelong look grow with audience laughter, and an insistent something with her hips as she reclines atop a white piano that makes men in the first three rows occasionally try to climb over the footlight line. Nevertheless, the high point of that number comes when Miss Godfrey points one leg straight skyward. Daddy, won't you please come home, she growls. Yeah, mama, someone usually shouts back from the audience.

title: JACOB J. CRESKOFF
description: Jacob J. Creskoff, a civil engineer, inventor and retired executive, died of a heart attack Saturday at Lankenau Hospital in Philadelphia. He was 79 years old and lived in Wynnewood, a suburb of Philadelphia.

title: Convict, 24, Gets 15 More Years For Killing Fiance and 3 Others
description: MASON, Mich., Aug. 30 (UPI) A convict serving 30 to 50 years for rape was sentenced yesterday to 15 more years in prison for killing his former fiance and three other women.

title: Stage: Hal and Hotspur
description: IF energy and eagerness were the primary attributes necessary for actors to perform Shakespeare, then the Riverside Shakespeare Company might be compared to London's Royal Shakespeare Company. The tact is mat me toversme company is miles away from both the R. S. C. and the New York Shakespeare Festival. Faced with the Riverside production of Henry IV, the First Part, one can only wish this youthful company good growth. There is room in New York for a yearround Shakespeare troupe, and to judge from the enthusiasm of the audience at one summer night's performance, there is also public interest.

title: Crusader Against Cults Accused of Kidnapping
description: SALT LAKE CITY, Aug. 30 (AP) Theodore R. Patrick, a crusader against cults, has been charged with kidnapping in the abduction of a member of Hare Krishna.

title: Pioneer 11 Reports No Evidence of a Fifth Saturn Ring
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., Aug. 30 Photographs transmitted today by Pioneer 11, now two days and one million miles away from its rendezvous with Saturn, were beginning to show the pale yellow planet and its spectacular rings in more revealing detail and from different angles than have ever been seen through groundbased telescopes.

title: Edward L. Meister, 64, Publisher
description: Edward L. Meister, president of the Meister Publishing Company and once a prominent amateur golfer, died last Friday at his home in Waite Hill, Ohio, near Cleveland. He was 64 years old.

title: Jets
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. Aug. 30  Jim Clack, center, and Harry Carson, middle linebacker, were elected by their teammates as captains the Giants today. Clack and Carson replace Doug Van Horn, a guard who still with the Giants, and Jack Gregory, a defensive end now with the Cleveland Browns.

title: Art of the Subway Goes on Exhibition
description: When most New Yorkers think of art in the city's subways, they think of graffiti. When they think of architecture and technology in the subways, they think of dark, odorous corridors and broken air conditioners in cars with what seem to be hermetically sealed windows.
